loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Alberta is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with three children. 

Alberta has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
 
Alberta is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Alberta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Zafar

texts.ru: Зафар проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 36 лет. Женат. Имеет троих детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Зафар занимается торговлей. Он арендует торговую точку на рынке, где продает продукты питания. Этим видом бизнеса занимается десять лет. Кредит берет для покупки масла, колбасных изделий, молочных продуктов и хозяйственных товаров. Он хочет увеличить ассортимент своего товара.
texts.en: Zafar lives in the city of Kulob.  He is 36 years old, married and has three children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Zafar is involved in retail sales.  He leases a retail outlet at a market, where he sells food products.  He has been involved in this type of business for ten years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of butter, sausage, dairy products and household goods.  He wants to increase the assortment of his merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase butter, sausage, dairy products and household goods

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Pilar has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, detergents & noodles.

Pilar is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Pilar hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, detergents & noodles

loans.name: Aidalet

texts.en:
Aidalet is a strong, determined woman whose goal in life is to give better living conditions to her family. Aidalet is 37 years old and married to a farmer. They have three school-aged children. Aidalet and her husband have managed their rice farming business for almost 10 years.

Aidalet usually earns a gross income of PHP 70,000 per crop during wet season from one hectare. Her income went for her children's fees for school. Some was used to pay for her loan to the traders. Aidalet wants to borrow a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy seeds and fertilizers and to pay for the labor costs for farming.

She will use the loan wisely. She will not get a loan again from the traders because it has high monthly interest. .

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers and pay for labor costs

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 20 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Gina has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Gina is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Gina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more goats to resell.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.

Luzminda has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, breads and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

Luzminda is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Luzminda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

texts.en:
Clemera is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married .

Clemera has a retail shop that sells spices like onions and garlic by the kilogram. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy spices to sell.

Clemera is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Clemera hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy spices to sell.

loans.name: Ikhtiyor

texts.ru:
Ихтиёр воспитанный, умный и добросовестный человек. Он женат и отец 3 детей. Более 10 лет Ихтиёр занимается купля продажей сухофруктов. Он покупает сухофруктов из местных рынков, а затем отправляет в Россию, чтобы продать и получить прибыли. А также он занимается приготовлением шашлыка и скотоводством. Ихтиёр хочет расширить свой бизнес и получит максимальной прибыли. Он хочет, устроит своих детей в хороших школах и университетах, чтобы они стали образованными и воспитанными людьми. Ихтиёр запрашивает займ 1500$ США для покупки сухофруктов и мясо. Он заранее благодарит всех кредиторов за поддержку и поощрение. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Ikhtiyor is a well-mannered, smart and conscientious person.  He is married and is a father of three children.  Ikhtiyor is involved in buying and selling dried fruits.  He buys dried fruits from local markets and then sends them to Russia in order to sell and make profits.  He is also involved in preparing kebabs and animal husbandry.  Ikhtiyor wants to expand his business and maximize his profits.  He wants to place his children into good schools and universities, so that they grow up to be educated and well-mannered people.  Ikhtiyor is requesting a loan in the sum of $1500 for the purchase of dried fruits and meat.  He is grateful in advance to all creditors for the help and support.

loans.use: to purchase dried fruits and meat

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en:
Aiza is 20 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.

Aiza has a retail shop that sells spices like onions and garlic by the kilogram. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy spices to sell.

Aiza is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Aiza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy spices to sell.

loans.name: Tuongozane Group

texts.fr: La cliente Masika, leader du groupe d’affaire « Tuongozane », est entrepreneur, âgée de 40 ans, mère de 12 enfants qui étudient. Elle est  vendeuse de pommes de terre. Son mari est aussi petit commerçant. Elle installe ses marchandises au marché central de Virunga. Il y a 14 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Elle s’était constituée son premier capital à travers ses récoltes de son champ. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec 6 sacs de pommes de terre  à marchander et payer les fournitures scolaires à ses enfants.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement  et acheter des parcelles pour ses enfants.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en: Masika is the leader of the Tuongozane business group. She is a 40-year old entrepreneur and the mother of 12 children who are all in school. Masika sells potatoes at the central market of Virunga. She and her husband are both small retailers. Masika has been a small retailer for 14 years and raised her initial capital with crops grown on her own land. This loan would be used to buy 6 sacs of potatoes for resale and to pay for her children's education. Masika would also like to provide for her children's future by buying them plots of land. She would like to thank Hekima for helping disadvantaged women excluded from regular bank lending channels.

loans.use: to buy 6 sacs of potatoes and pay education expenses

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Hilolidin

texts.ru:
Хилолидин умный, добрый и целеустремленный человек. Он женат и ответственный молодой отец 1 ребенка. Более 2 лет он занимается услугами транспорта.  Он хочет, чтобы его сын вырос здоровым, умным и образованным. С этой целью он хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить прибыли. С прибылью он хочет отремонтировать своего дома и улучшить условия жизни. Хилолидин запрашивает займ 3000$ США для покупки запчастей для ремонта своего автомобиля. Он заранее благодарит всех кредиторов за поддержку и поощрение.

It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. texts.en: Hilolidin is a smart, kind and goal-oriented person.  He is married and is a responsible young father of one child.  He has been involved in transportation service for over two years.  He wants his son to grow up healthy, smart and educated.  With this goal in mind, he wants to expand his business and make a profit.  He wants to then use the profit to make repairs to his house and improve his living conditions.  Hilolidin is requesting a loan in the sum of $3000 for the purchase of auto parts to repair his car.  He thanks all creditors in advance for the help and support.

loans.use: to purchase auto parts to repair his car

loans.name: C2386 Abajyamugambi Group

texts.en:
Annonciata is 45 years old and is married with three children between the ages of 18 and 25 years old. Her business is well-organized and is well-known in this business of selling goods such as rice, sugar, biscuits, etc. She is the team leader of this group which is called "ABAJYAMUGAMBI" in local language.

In the picture, Annonciata is the first person on the left side and she has a document in her hand. Her business hours are from 6am until 5pm every day and she currently employs one person to help her. She has five years of experience in this business.

Annonciata and her team have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase their businesses by buying more products (sugar, rice, biscuits, salt and so on) for sale. With any profit, they will reinvest the profits in their businesses and save for their future. Annonciata will also be able to renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase more goods such as rice, sugar, biscuits, etc., for sale.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 48-years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children.  Merlinda has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. 

Merlinda is a new member of HSPFI, and she requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.  In the future, Merlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 52, married, and has three children.  She is patient and hard working, which is her secret to financial improvement, despite the poor living conditions.  Estelita constantly wishes for a stable source of income to sustain her family's basic necessities

Estelita has been involved in planting and harvesting rice for thirty years.  She is asking for a loan of P25,000 to buy hybrid seeds, fertilizers and pay for the expenses of farming.  Estelita and her husband will continue to manage their rice farming business.  Estelita will also strive to lift the family from a poor quality of living to a better quality of living.  She looks forward to the growth of her business and how she can become a better borrower and entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy hybrid seeds, fertilizers and pay for the expenses of farming.

loans.name: Shadya

texts.en:
Shadya is a 42-year-old woman, married with four sons and one daughter. Shadya has her own business of clothing sales. She wants to purchase a new collection of clothes for the coming season, but the amount of money she has isn't enough for that, so she needs to take out a loan of $1,000 from FATEN. 

When Shadya takes the loan from FATEN, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will buy more clothes and have a new collection that will give customers more options. This will lead to increase income and let Shadya live in better conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a new collection of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Filomina

texts.en:
Filomina is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. 

Filomina has a retail shop that sells fruits like mangoes & papaya. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy fruits to sell. 

Filomina is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Filomina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 34-year-old man. He is married and has two children aged six and two, whom he hopes to give a good education up to the university level. 

He operates a motorcycle transport business and serves the local people at Magongo in Mombasa. He been running this business for two years now. He says that the business is profitable and the major challenge he has is he only owns one motorcycle, thus he has a small business. He however works hard from early morning to late evening to ensure his business is doing well. 

He is using his loan of 40,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to buy another motorcycle to grow his business and serve more people. He hopes to buy a fleet of rickshaws in the future. He also hopes to build a residential house for his family. He describes himself as a person who loves and is committed to his business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.en:
Emiliano is 61 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has three children. 

Emiliano has a shop that sells herbal medicines in syrup from Blue Miracle. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy additional stocks of herbal medicines. 

Emiliano is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Emiliano hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of herbal medicines

loans.name: Sayidahon's Group

texts.en:
Sayidahon is the leader of this group. She is 39 and married to a constructor. Together with her husband she is bringing up two sons and a daughter. The older son and the daughter study at school, and the second son is preschool age (under seven).   

In order to earn money to meet the family needs, Sayidahon cultivates fruits and vegetables. In September she plans to sow 0.16 hectares of onions, but she needs money to purchase onion seeds, and for this purpose she applied for the loan. Some part of the loan funds she will use to purchase mineral fertilizers. In the future Sayidahon plans to start building a summer house. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase onion seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma  is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Emma  has a retail shop that sells used clothing or "ukay-ukay". She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy used clothing to sell.

Emma  is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Emma  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is married with two children. Lolita is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Lolita  is a hog raiser to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. She has requested a loan to purchase piglets. 

Lolita  has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Lolita hopes to become a supplier of pork in all of Misamis Occidental.

loans.use: To purchase piglets.

loans.name: Nelfa

texts.en:
Nelfa is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Nelfa has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Nelfa is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Nelfa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more sugar, salt, maize flour, cooking oil, etc to resell.

loans.name: Imilda

texts.en:
Imilda is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 9 children. 

Imilda has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Imilda is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Imilda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Paulette

texts.fr:
Paulette est une femme  âgé(e) de 44ans. Elle est célibataire et n’a pas d’enfants en charge.  
Paulette est couturière de profession et à cette activité elle a ajouté la vente des tissus et accessoires de couture (fermeture, bouton, épingle, ruban) depuis 2003. Elle vend à AVEPOZO après achat au Grand Marché de Lomé. 
Paulette a requis son sixième cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des tissus et des accessoires de couture.
texts.en:
Paulette, age 44, is single and not raising any children. 
  
She works as a seamstress and she has also been selling cloth and sewing accessories (zippers, buttons, needles, ribbons) since 2003. She sells in AVEPOZO after buying her goods in the Grand Market of Lomé. 

Paulette has requested her sixth loan from WAGES in order to buy cloth and sewing notions.

loans.use: to buy sewing notions and cloth.

loans.name: Ulduzhon's Group

texts.en:
Ulduzhon is the leader of this group. She is 28 and married to a constructor, whose monthly salary is 5000 soms.  Together with her husband she is bringing up two daughters and a son; the daughters are at school and the son is preschool age (under seven).  

Ulduzhon works as a teacher at school, and her monthly salary is 8000 soms. The family earns additional money by breeding cattle and reselling it at a higher price after it is fattened. At the moment they are raising seven bull-calves. 

Ulduzhon applied for the loan because she needs additional funds for purchasing feed for cattle. In the future, with the profits gained from the business, she wants to purchase a car for the family.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase feed for cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a pool table for the project he has.

loans.name: Paciencia

texts.en:
Paciencia is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Paciencia has a retail shop that sells firewood. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy firewood to sell.

Paciencia is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Paciencia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy firewood to sell.

loans.name: Améyovi

texts.fr:
Améyovi est une femme âgé(e) de 54 ans. Elle est veuve avec 01 enfant en charge. 
Améyovi travaille comme revendeuse de parfum, de déodorant depuis 2006. Elle vend à domicile. Elle achète à LOME. 
Améyovi a requis son second  cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des parfums et des déodorants.
texts.en:
Améyovi, age 54, is a widow responsible for one child. 

Améyovi has been selling perfume and deodorant since 2006. She sells out of her home. She buys her goods in Lomé. 

Améyovi has requested her second loan from WAGES in order to buy various perfumes and deodorants.

loans.use: to buy various perfumes and deodorants.

loans.name: Amowassina

texts.fr:
Amowassina est une femme âgé(e) de 36 ans. Elle est mariée å un tailleur. Elle a 02 enfants. 
Amowassina travaille comme revendeuse d’articles de mercerie depuis 2007. Elle vend ans un quartier de la place. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. 
Amowassina a requis son troisième cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des articles de mercerie.
texts.en:
Amowassina, age 36, is married to a tailor. She has two children. 
 
Amowassina has been working at selling sewing notions since 2007. She sells in a neighborhood where she lives. She buys her products in Lomé. 

Amowassina has requested her third loan from WAGES in order to buy sewing notions.

loans.use: to buy sewing notions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grocery items

loans.name: Akmal

texts.ru:
Акмал добросовестный и честный человек. Он женат и любящий отец 1 ребёнка. Акмал любит свою семью и старается, обеспечит и содержит в хороших условиях жизни. Он начал свой бизнес с продажей мелочевки, а потом постепенно перешел на продажу  тканей и одежду.  Более 5 лет он занимается торговлей и у него богатый опыт. Акмал хотел бы получит займ в размере 3000$ США для покупки нового ассортимента тканей и одежду. Он заранее благодарен вам всем за вашу доброту!

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Akmal is a conscientious and honest person.  He is married and is a loving father of one child.  Akmal loves his family and tries to provide and support them living in good conditions.  He started his business with the sales of small items and then transitioned into sales of fabrics and clothing.  He has been involved in retail sales for over five years and has a rich experience.  Akmal wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $3000 for the purchase of new assortment of fabrics and clothing.  He thanks all of you in advance for your kindness!

loans.use: to purchase a new assortment of merchandise

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Seng is a 31-year-old woman who is married to Savut, age 31, and they both appear in the picture here. This old couple lives with four school-aged children and earns a living by planting various crops on their own farmland. Seng currently plants a rice crop, which she will harvest and collect on her productivity when it is mature. Recently, her crop is not growing well because it is ravaged by insects and lawn. Because of that obstacle, Seng has decided to seek a loan to buy insecticide and fertilizer, which she will use to protect her crop. She said that this loan is very useful for her family.

loans.use: to buy insecticide and fertilizer.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is married with three children. Fe is 35 years old and lives in San Roque, Panaon, Misamis Occidental.

Fe sells groceries to earn a living and has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns PHP 7,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 30,000 to purchase groceries.

Fe has been a member of PMPC for two years.  In the future, Fe hope to see her business earn more to provide for the education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase groceries to sell to customers of her retail store

loans.name: Abduzarif

texts.ru: Абдузариф проживает в Варзобском районе. Ему 55 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Абдузариф предоставляет услугу, он парикмахер. У него имеется собственная парикмахерская. В этой области он работает уже три года. Кредит берет для приобретения нового кресла и аксессуаров.
texts.en: Abduzarif lives in the Varzob district.  He is 55 years old, married and has three children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Abduzarif provides a service; he is a barber and owns a barbershop.  He has been working in this field for three years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of a new chair and accessories.

loans.use: to purchase a new chair and accessories

loans.name: C9634 Abishyizehamwe Group

texts.en:
Consolee is 46 years old and is married with three children between the ages of 8 and 16 years old but she is now a widow. Her business is well-organized and is well-known for selling fruit and vegetables. Consolee is the team leader of this group which is called "Abishyizehamwe" in local language which means in English "Being together". 

In the picture, Consolee is the second person in the second row from the right side. The picture  shows eight clients but one of them, Laurence Nzabonankura, the first person on the left in the second row, left the group.  Now there are seven.  

 Consolee`s business hours are from 7am until 2pm every day except on Saturday and she currently employs two people to help her. She has eight years of experience in this business.

Consolee and her team have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses by buying more products (passion fruit, mangoes, vegetables and so on) for sale. With any additional profit, they will reinvest in their businesses and save for their future.

loans.use: To buy more fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Akouvi Lina

texts.fr:
Akouvi est une femme âgé(e) de 36 ans. Elle est mariée å un plombier. Elle a 01 enfant. 
Akouvi travaille comme revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale et liqueur depuis 2006.
 Elle vend à ses clients  dans un marché de la place. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. 
Akouvi a requis son second cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des sardines, de la spaghetti, de l’huile végétale.
texts.en:
Akouvi is a 36-year-old woman who is married to a plumber. She has one child.

Akouvi has been working as a retailer of grocery items and liquor since 2006. She serves her customers at a local market. She gets her supplies from Lomé. 

Akouvi has requested her second loan from the micro-finance institution WAGES in order to buy spaghetti, sardines, and vegetable oil.

loans.use: to buy spaghetti, sardines, and vegetable oil

loans.name: Paizilatkhan's Group

texts.en: Paizilatkhan is the leader of this group. She is 44 and unfortunately she is a widow. She has raised three sons and a daughter. Two sons are working in Russia, the daughter studies at university and the youngest son is a farmer. In order to earn money for her livelihood, Paizilatkhan cultivates cotton. She earns 3000 soms per month selling part of the harvest. With the profits gained from this business, she has repaired her house. Paizilatkhan applied for this loan because she needs financial help to purchase mineral fertilizers for cultivating cotton and to buy building materials for the house. In the near future, she plans to finish house construction and celebrate her son’s wedding. ====================================== Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young and ambitious socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers and building materials

loans.name: Amivi

texts.fr:
Amivi est une femme âgée de 47ans. Elle est mariée å un commerçant. Elle a 01 enfant. 
Amivi travaille comme restauratrice depuis 1990. Elle sert ses clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. 
Amivi a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter du riz, de l’huile, de la tomate et divers.
texts.en:
Amivi is a 47-year-old woman who is married to a merchant. She has one child.

Amivi has been working as a restauranteur since 1990. She serves her customers out of her home. She gets her supplies from Lomé. 

Amivi has requested her first loan from the micro-finance institution WAGES in order to buy rice, oil, tomatoes, and various other items.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, tomatoes, and various other items

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en: Susanna runs a small cafe-restaurant in the city.  Susanna would like to improve the cafe's condition and increase the quality of services for her clients. With the requested loan Susanna plans to purchase chairs and tables, as well as renovate the cafe.  With the help of this loan Susanna will be able to meet the demands of her clients and also attract new ones.  Susanna will develop her business and ensure a brighter future for her family.  Susanna lives together with her parents and cousin.

loans.use: to pay for furniture and renovations for her cafe

loans.name: Javzandolgor

texts.en:
Mrs. Javzandolgor is 33. She is a taxi driver, and she lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of  Mongolia. She has been running her business for four years and requested a loan to discharge her new car payment. She recently bought a car marked Hyundai Pulsar for her taxi business, but she still could not pay the cost fully. 

Before, she used to drive another Korean car, and it became very old and dangerous to use for a taxi. Sometimes, she uses her car for private usage, to bring her kids to the kindergarten or school, for example. Changing her car is absolutely important and beneficial to this family’s life, and likewise, their income.

loans.use: To discharge her new car payment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grocery items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike.

loans.name: La Patience Plus Group

texts.en:
Jolie is a chairwoman of a community bank named “La Patience Plus,” which is composed of 31 micro-entrepreneurs. La Patience Plus is in Lubumbashi, which is a city located in the southeast of the Democratic Republic of Congo. Lubumbashi is the second largest city in the DRC, which was not spared from the crisis and multiple wars that hit the DRC during the 1990s decade. It is from the 2000s until today that the informal sector took off.

Jolie, aged 27, is married with four children aged between 2 and 7 years. She sells pairs of shoes in the southern area of Lubumbashi. She has been in business since 1999. She has acquired solid experience, and her business has prospered thanks to good management and accumulated profits. She intends with the next loan to open a new selling place and purchase some more pairs of shoes to increase the inventory of her business in order to increase the income. Currently, she earns a profit of $120 every week. Jolie’s ambition is to open a general shop. All of her children attend school.

loans.use: to purchase some more pairs of shoes for reselling at a new selling place.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Michleen

texts.en:
Michleen is a 56-year-old woman, married, with three sons and one daughter. One of her sons works as a teacher with a low salary. Michleen lives in Biet Sahour near Bethlehem city in Palestine. She owns a grocery store that sells grocery goods such as sugar, frozen food, rice, etc. 

Michleen wants to purchase more grocery goods for her store but she hasn't enough cash to pay, so she needs to take a loan of amount $3,000 from FATEN.

When Michleen takes the loan, that is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to increase the number of grocery items she has in the store and also has got more options for consumers to choose from and buy. That will increase her income and lead her to change her life positively. Michleen is photographed in her grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery goods for the store.

loans.name: Bandi

texts.en:
Mr. Bandi is a clothes seller at shopping center called Bumbugur. He is 34 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been selling clothes for seven years and recently his current  business assets are not good enough. He wants to increase them, because it is absolutely important and beneficial for his business expansion. 

Bandi requested a loan to purchase a larger number of clothes than before for sale. He has a plan to buy a new apartment, if he can raise his income later.

loans.use: To purchase a larger number of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a cow to get more milk to resell.

loans.name: Ariunbold

texts.en:
Mr. Ariunbold is 27 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  He drives a taxi and has been running it since 2007. And his wife has been working as a hotel organizer for many years. This family owns a small-sized plot of land and a house. 

Recently he decided to build a house with 6-8 rooms inside his fence to rent out to others. One room's price will be USD20-25 a day. It is absolutely beneficial for his family income. If he can manage it, his income is going to increase rapidly. Maybe he could start to gain a return from renting after year or an even shorter period.  But he needs additional funding for it.  

Therefore Ariunbold requested a loan to use as additional funding to build his rental house. Before this, he took out a loan from another source and was able to repay successfully on time.

loans.use: To use as additional funding to build his rental house.

loans.name: Abdusalom

texts.ru:
Абдусалом добрый, умный и честный человек. Он женат и любящий отец 3 детей. Он занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур и скотоводством. Более 25 лет он работал бригадиром в местном колхозе. Его семья помогает ему на переработки абрикосов. Имеет хороший доход от продажи абрикосов и персика. Он взял в аренду земли и там он хочет заниматься откормом скота. С этой целью он запрашивает займ в размере 1000$  США для покупки скота.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Abdusalom is a kind, smart and honest person.  He is married and is a loving father of three children.  He is involved in growing agricultural crops and animal husbandry.  He spent over 25 years working as a foreman at a local collective farm.  His family helps him with processing apricots.  Abdusalom has a good income from the sales of apricots and peaches.  He leased a plot of land and wants to use it to feed livestock.  With this goal in mind, he is requesting a loan in the sum of $1000 in order to purchase livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Karen

texts.ru:
Карену 42 года и он проживает в селе Акнахбюр (Aknaghbyur), Тавушского региона. 
Жена Карена работает учительницей химии в средней школе, дочери учатся в Ереванском Педагогическом Институте на платном отделении, а сын учится в средней школе. Сам Карен работает в сельской администрации.  
Одновременно со своей постоянной работой, Карен занимается сельским хозяйством: разводит коров, выращивает овощи и фрукты, виноград, а на поле выращивает корм для своих двух коров и двоих телят. Часть полученной продукции Карен оставляет для своей семьи, а остальное продает своим односельчанам и скупщикам из соседних деревень и городов.   
Карену необходим кредит на сумму 1.000.000 драм для сооружения теплицы, в которой он намеревается выращивать помидоры, огурцы и другие овощи для продажи, что увеличит доход семьи Карена и позволит ему платить за обучение дочерей в институте.
texts.en: Karen is 42 years old.  He lives in the Aknaghbyur village in the Tavush region.  Karen's wife works as a chemistry teacher at a secondary school, daughters attend a paid division of the Yerevan Pedagogy Institute, and son attends a secondary school.  Karen works in the village administration.  Concurrently with his permanent job, Karen is involved in agriculture.  He breeds cattle, grows vegetables and fruits, grapes, and grows animal feed in the field for his two cows and two calves.  Karen leaves a portion of grown agricultural products for his family and sells the rest to his neighbors and buyers from neighboring villages and towns.  Karen needs a loan in the sum of 1,000,000 dram in order to build a greenhouse, where he plans to grow tomatoes, cucumbers and other vegetables for sale, which will increase Karen's family income and allow him to pay for his daughters' education in the institute.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.ru: Исмоил проживает в городе Худжанд. Ему 44 года. Он женат. У него двое детей. Он занимается животноводством. У себя дома он имеет коровник, где разводит скот. В основном он разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже шесть лет. В продвижении его деятельности ему помогает его жена. Исроил берет кредит для закупа бычков.
texts.en: Ismoil lives in the city of Khujand.  He is 44 years old, married and has two children.  He is involved in animal husbandry and has a cowshed at home, where he breeds livestock.  He primarily breeds livestock for future resale.  Ismoil has been involved in this business for six years.  His wife helps him with running the business.  Ismoil is requesting this loan for the purchase of bulls.

loans.use: to purchase bulls

loans.name: Sharofatkhon

texts.ru:
Шарофаткон 43 года, замужем и воспитывает двух детей.  В 1991 году Шарофаткон начала свой бизнес в торговле продуктами питания, используя стартовый капитал в сумме 5,000 сом (KGS). Ее магазин, находящийся на основной дороге Кадамжай – Баткен (центр области)  стал известным за счет представленного широкого ассортимента товаров.  На сегодняшний день, магазин Шарофаткон дает стабильный доход в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS) , что позволяет семье покрыть свои расходы.  
Для дальнейшего расширения ассортимента в магазине,  Шарофаткон обратилась в компанию «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS). Это позволит ей обрести новых клиентов и повысить продажи ее товара.
ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" предоставляет кредиты по линии Кива для социально-уязвимых слоев населения. ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" является одной из лидирующих Микрофинансовых организаций Кыргызстана. "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" – это надежный финансовый партнер, осуществляющий вклад в развитие экономики Кыргызской Республики путем предоставления доступных микрофинансовых услуг в сельской местности и городах, способствующих созданию рабочих мест и отвечающий интересам своих клиентов и инвесторов.
texts.en: Sharofatkhon is 43 years old, married and is raising two children.  Sharofatkhon started her business in 1991 by selling food products, using a starting capital in the sum of 5,000 som (KGS).  Her store, located on the main road Kadamjai-Batken (center of the area), became known for having such a wide assortment of merchandise.  Today, Sharofatkhon's store provides a stable income in the sum of 15,000 som (KGS), which allows the family to cover their expenses.  Sharofatkhon went to the "Bai Tushum and Partners" to request a loan in the sum of 50,000 som (KGS) in order to further grow her business.  This will allow her to attract new customers and increase the sales of her merchandise.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of merchandise

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a hardworking and honest 41-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with a seven-year-old child who is school-going. For more than three years he has been supplying hospital consumables and laboratory items so as to make a living. He supplements income from this venture with the earnings he makes from farming tea. 

Previously he was employed. He wants in the next five years to have his own vehicles to supply his products. His dream is to have an annual turnover of 5 million Kenya shillings. He is requesting a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy a microscope, an electric centrifuge and a digital thermometer. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to acquire business management skills.

loans.use: to buy a microscope, an electric centrifuge and a digital thermometer.

loans.name: Dolreen

texts.en: Dolreen is a hardworking and visionary 33-year-old business lady. She is married and blessed with two children, ages 4 and 10 years old, who are going to school. To make a living, she has been specializing in dairy farming. In the next five years, she wants to have bought a pickup to distribute her products. Her dream is to open up her own dairy processing plant. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a cow. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to develop a culture of saving.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Upendo-Kahembe Group

texts.fr: La cliente Asha, leader du groupe d’affaire «Upendo-Kahembe », est jeune entrepreneur, âgée de 21 ans, mère de 2 jeunes enfants. Elle est  vendeuse de poissons et des boissons.  Son mari est chômeur. Elle installe ses marchandises au marché communal de Kahembe. Il y a 4 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser 5 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  3 paniers de poissons  à marchander et  10 casiers de boissons (Fanta, Primus, Aigle).  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement  et acheter une  parcelle.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en: The client is a young entrepreneur by the name of Asha. She is the leader of the “Upendo-Kahembe" group. She is 21 years old and the mother of two young children. She sells fish and beverages. Her husband is unemployed. She sets up her goods for sale at the communal market of Kahembe. She has been doing these to earn some money for four years. She just finished five lending cylces with Hekima. This new loan will allow her to stock up by buying three baskets of fish and 10 cases of beverages (Fanta, Primus, Aigle) for resale. Moreover, she would like to see her children grow up in a comfortable environment and to buy a land plot. The clien thanks Hekima for its work in favor of impoverished women who  lack access to traditional banking.

loans.use: to buy three baskets of fish and 10 cases of beverages (Fanta, Primus, Aigle) for resale

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Kyzjibek's Group

texts.en:
Kyzjibek is the leader of this group. She is 32 and married to a taxi driver, whose monthly salary is about 6,000 soms. Together with her husband Kyzjibek is bringing up two daughters; the first daughter is at school and the second is not yet. 

In order to earn money Kyzjibek sews school uniforms. In this way she earns about 5,000 soms per month. She also breeds cattle for making additional money. With money received from this loan she wants to purchase a calf for breeding and materials for sewing school uniforms. In the future she wishes to open a sewing workshop. 

---Where Did This Loan Come From?---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team-Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a calf and fabrics for sewing school uniforms

loans.name: Kakamba Bakyara Kwetungura Group

texts.en:
41 year old Watson is hoping for a resurgence in his business prospects. To open new horizons for his food sales business, he says he will have to be on his mettle. 
He knows this will come to fruition when he works harder. Under the auspices of a loan too, he knows he can make unprecedented strides.
 Watson is a high spirited business man who unremittingly has been working tirelessly to make inroads in his business.
That hard work ethic has seen the good natured father of 8 have 17 years in this highly competitive business.  It’s been a chequered career however. Much as he has registered many achievements, the downsides have also been innumerable.
His recourse has invariably been optimism, tenacity and a strong sense of perseverance.
Watson set forth in this business which he operates at a stall in one of the biggest food markets in Ntungamo with the persuasion from a close friend. 
Monthly his gross sales income is to the total of Uganda shillings 340,000.
The future prospects for his business look good. Watson says he wants to diversify into selling other foods such as yams, cassava, ground nuts and maize.
He principally sells beans and sweet potatoes.
This business has enabled him supply the deficiencies in his teaching remuneration. Watson is a teacher by profession but he knows the drawbacks of reckoning on the low remuneration that teachers get.
Most teachers like him are partial to other modest sources of livelihood.
With this loan, Watson intends to purchase yams, cassava, ground nuts and maize to resell.

loans.use: to purchase yams, cassava, ground nuts and maize to resell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ilhomjon

texts.ru:
Илхомджон трудолюбивый, честный и добрый человек. Он всегда помогает всем. Он женат и любящий отец 4 детей. Он занимается услугами перевозкой пассажиров на местном городе. Он старается, чтобы пассажирам было комфортно и удобно на дорогу. Он с утра рано выходит на дорогу, дома вернется поздно вечером  уставшим. Он хочет, чтобы его дети жили в хороших условиях жизни и поэтому так усердно работает. Илхомджон хотел бы получит кредит в размере 2000$ США для покупки автошин 5 шт. и капитальный ремонт своего автомобиля. Илхомджон хочет заранее благодарить вас за вашу помощь и поддержку.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Ilhomjon is a hard-working, honest and kind person.  He always helps everyone.  He is married and is a loving father of four children.  He is involved in providing passenger transportation in the local town.  He tries to make sure that passengers are comfortable on the road.  He goes to work early in the morning and returns home tired late in evening.  He wants his children to live in good living conditions and works this diligently for it.  Ilhomjon wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $2000 for the purchase of five tires and to make major repairs to his car.  Ilhomjon wants to thank you in advance for your help and support.

loans.use: to purchase tires and to repair a car

loans.name: Somian

texts.en:
Somian , 41 years old, is married and a father of three children. He has been a wheat farmer for the past three years. He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy wheat seeds and also for land preparation. 

With the profits generated Somian plans to pay school fees for his children. He dreams of becoming a prominent farmer. 

Notwithstanding limited resources, Somian is an assiduous man who works with effort to reach his goals.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa is 42 years old. She lives in Tsakhkunk village, Sevan area, with her husband, who works as a cook at restaurant and her father, who is a  retiree. Larisa’s daughter is married and lives separately from her parents, and her son is serving in Armenian army. Larisa is a Russian teacher and she has worked at the nursery school and then at Ddmashen’s village school as a Russian teacher for a long time. 
Larisa has her own farm where she breeds cows, sheep and chickens. She also she grows wheat on her plot of land with her father’s help. Larisa also sells produce and thus helps her husband to support their family. 

This is Larisa’s 3rd loan from Nor Horizon. She needs a 1.000.000 AMD loan to buy some calves and also fodder for her farm animals.

loans.use: To buy some calves and also fodder for her farm animals

loans.name: Fouad

texts.en: Fouad is a 30-year-old man. He is married with two sons and one daughter. He works in agriculture raising sheep, which is the source of income for the family. Fouad wants to expand his project of raising sheep by purchasing more livestock to sell more products. He hasn't enough money to pay, so he needs to take out a loan of $1,000 from FATEN. With his FATEN loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will purchase more sheep and increase the size of sales from products. This will increase the family's income and result in better living conditions. Fouad is photographed in the sheep farm he owns.

loans.use: to purchase more sheep and expand the project.

loans.name: Roza

texts.en: Roza is 54 year old women, married with three children. She grows seasonal fruits and vegetables.  She has three years of experience in this field and has already demonstrated herself to be a good client with a positive credit history. Fresh fruits and vegetables are very popular among Azerbaijan people and  that’s why Roza would like to improve her business to increase sales. She usually sells her products in the local Bilasuvar bazaar. Roza applied for 1200 AZN loan in case to purchase more seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Hosea

texts.en: Hosea is 22 years old and single.  He runs a taxi business to earn a living.  He has been in the business for three years.  He also earns extra income from his car wash.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Hosea has learned how to keep business records and to  manage his business well.  He hopes to grow his business in the future for more income generation.  Hosea has requested for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy tires for his car.

loans.use: To buy tires

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence  lives in Uganda.  She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her sister). 

Florence has a business selling eggs.  She has been in this business for three years, and she works 7 days out of every week.  Florence sells her products in a shop, wholesale. Florence has requested for a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more trays of eggs. She also generates additional income through a small retail shop.

The main business challenges for Florence include seasonality and transportation.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to open up another shop selling eggs. Florence lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more trays of eggs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Burulsun

texts.ru:
Бурулсун 61-летняя пенсионерка, воспитавшая пятерых детей. Бурулсун, долгое время проработавшая учителем немецкого языка, смогла дать образование всем своим детям – двое из ее дочерей стали учителями, средняя дочь – врач, один сын работает столяром-мебельщиком, а младший – стал опорой и главным помощником Бурулсун в ведении бизнеса в сельском хозяйстве.  В 1991 году Бурулсун начала бизнес в разведении скота с суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS), и благодаря упорному труду увеличила поголовье скота до суммы в 100,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бурулсун обратилась в компанию «Бай Тушум  и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в реконструкцию кошары  и дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.  В будущем, Бурулсун хочет приобрести машину для своей семьи. 
ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" предоставляет кредиты по линии Кива для социально-уязвимых слоев населения. ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" является одной из лидирующих Микрофинансовых организаций Кыргызстана. "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" – это надежный финансовый партнер, осуществляющий вклад в развитие экономики Кыргызской Республики путем предоставления доступных микрофинансовых услуг в сельской местности и городах, способствующих созданию рабочих мест и отвечающий интересам своих клиентов и инвесторов.
texts.en: Burulsun is 61 years old, a retiree, who raised five children.  Burulsun, having worked as a German language teacher for a long time, was able to provide all of her children with education.  Two of her daughters became teachers, the middle daughter is a doctor, one son works as a furniture carpenter, and the youngest became the pillar and Burulsun's main helper in running the agricultural business.  Burulsun started her animal husbandry business in 1991 with the sum of 10,000 som (KGS) and, thanks to persistent work, increased the quantity of livestock to the value of 100,000 som (KGS).  Burulsun went to "Bai Tushum and Partners" to request a loan in the sum of 120,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of sheep in order to further develop her business.  She plans to invest the income from the loan into the repairs of sheep yards and future increase of quantity of livestock.  In the future, Burulsun wants to buy a car for her family.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Edward Karimu's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from a primary school in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 2,500,000 SLL in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, their school’s burser repays SMT/Kiva on their behalf from their monthly salaries. 

Edward is the leader of this group. The 58-year-old is married to a teacher. He has 10 children. Born in Largo village near Kenema, Edward has been in the teaching profession for 36 years. Edward has requested a loan of 1,000,000 SLL in order to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith lives in Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). 

Edith has a retail shop. She has been in this business for three years, and she works seven days out of every week. Edith sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. Edith has requested for a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil. 

She also generates additional income through tailoring. The main business challenges for Edith include seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to have a wholesale shop. Edith lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil.

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.ru:
Шахло разведенная женщина и любящая мать 4 детей. Она продает женскую и подростковую одежду на рынке более 10 лет. Шахло просит займ в размере $2800 долларов США на приобретение дополнительных товаров. Она хочет расширить ассортимент своих продаваемых товаров. Шахло стремится расширить свой бизнес, поскольку это единственный источник дохода для ее семьи. Она считает, что этот займ будет очень полезно для дальнейшего роста своего бизнеса.
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Shahlo is a divorced woman and the loving mother of four children. She  has been selling women’s and teens' clothing at a market for over 10 years. Ludmila is requesting a loan for $2800 in order to buy additional stock. She would like to expand her selection of goods. Ludmila’s goal is to grow her business as this is the only source of income for her family. She believes that this loan will be very beneficial for the growth of her business.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Behruz

texts.ru:
Бехруз  24 года. Он продает DVD диски. Он всегда  старается расширить ассортимент своих товаров. У него в магазине всегда новые фильмы и концерты популярных актеров и  певцов и другие жанры. Он также предоставляет компьютерные услуги, такие как аудио, редактирование видео кассеты и диски с записями семейных событий. Бехруз старается использовать современные технологи в своей работе, чтобы удовлетворить нужды и  потребности своих клиентов. Бехруз запрашивает займ в размере $2000 Долларов США. Он планирует закупить много дисков DVD для расширения ассортимента своих товаров. Бехруз благодарит всех за поддержку и обещает быть аккуратным с платежами займа.

texts.en:
Behruz is 24 years old. He sells DVDs. He always tries to expand his selection of goods. He always  offers the latest films, concerts by popular actors and singers and films in other genres. He also provides computer services, such as audio recording and editing of videotapes and DVDs with recordings of family celebrations. Behruz makes an effort to use modern technology in order to meet his clients’ needs and requirements. Behruz is requesting a loan in the amount of $2000. He plans to buy a large quantity of DVDS in order to expand his stock. Behruz thanks everyone for support and promises to make his loan payments promptly.

loans.use: to purchase DVDs

loans.name: Sulton

texts.ru: Султон проживает в районе Хуросон. Ему 59 лет. Он женат. У него 6 детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Двое его сыновей находятся в Российской Федерации. Сам Султон занимается торговлей. Он арендует торговую точку на рынке, где продает мужскую одежду и обувь. Этим видом бизнеса занимается уже 20 лет. Кредит берет для покупки школьной формы и обуви.
texts.en: Sulton lives in the Khuroson district.  He is 59 years old, married and has six children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Two of their sons are in the Russian Federation.  Sulton is involved in retail sales.  He leases a retail outlet at the market, where he sells men's clothing and shoes.  He has been involved in this business for twenty years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of school uniforms and shoes.

loans.use: to purchase school uniforms and shoes

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.ru:
Бахтиер владелец малого бизнеса с Южной части Таджикистана. Он является единственным кормильцем семьи. У него жена и 2 детей. Он продает мужские, женские и детские одежды на рынке. Бахтиер работает в этом бизнесе уже около 5 лет. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и открыть вторую точку продажу и таким образом увеличить свой прибыль. Бахтиер просит $2000 Долларов США для покупки одежды на предстоящий сезон. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и делать успехи и таким образом улучшить условие жизни своей семьи.

texts.en: Bakhtiyor owns a small business in the southern part of Tajikistan.  He is the sole provider for his family.  He has a wife and two children.  He sells men's, women's and children's clothing at the market.  Bakhtiyor has been working in this business for about five years.  He wants to expand his business and open a new sales outlet and, thus, increase his profits.  Bakhtiyor is requesting $2000 for the purchase of clothing for the upcoming season.  He wants to expand his business and achieve successes and, thus, improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Mahmasharif

texts.ru:
Maxмашариф занимается куплей и продажей мужских одежд и обуви более 2 года. Доступные цены, которые он предлагает своим клиентам позволяет ему привлечь много клиентов и расширить свою клиентуру. Maxмашариф работет с утра до позднего вечера чтобы улучшить условия жизни своей семьи. Maxмашариф запрашивает кредит в размере $2000 Долларов США для закупа новых товаров. Он имеет большие управленческие навыки. Мы считаем, что эти навыки помогут ему погасить свой займ в срок и достичь всех своих профессиональных и личных целей.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Mahmasharif has been buying and selling men's clothing and shoes for more than two years. His reasonable prices mean he has been able to expand his customer base. Mahmasharif works from morning until late at night to improve his family's standard of living. Mahmasharif is asking for a loan of $2000 to buy new goods. He has excellent management skills. We believe that this will help him to pay back his loans on time as well as to reach his personal and professional goals.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Samali

texts.en: Samali lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children and all go to school. She has one additional family member. She has a retail shop that she operates on a retail basis in a rented shop. She has been in business for the last four years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 700,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of rice, flour and sugar. Her inspirational goals are to have a wholesale shop, to educate her children to the university level and to buy a plot of land. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She lives in a rented house and her family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expense includes rent, food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, flour and sugar

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children and all go to school. She has two additional family members. She has a stall at the market selling tomatoes and onions. She has been in business for the last three years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more baskets of onions, tomatoes, and garlic. Her inspirational goal is to get her own shop at her home where her customers meet her. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She lives in a rented house and her family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more baskets of onions, tomatoes, and garlic

loans.name: Cyrus

texts.en: Cyrus is 23 years old and single. To earn a living, he runs a barber shop. He has been running the business for nine months and has employed one person to assist him. Previously, he used to work with youth groups doing community services. He joined Faulu Kenya so that he could access financial resources easily. He has also learned how to save his money and manage his business. He needs a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy a shaving machine.

loans.use: To buy a shaving machine

loans.name: Nabi

texts.ru: Наби проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст 52 года. Женат. У него трое детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Наби имеет высшее педагогическое образование. Он по профессии проработал 15 лет. На сегодняшний день Наби занимается торговлей топлива. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 10 лет. Кредит берет для закупа топлива.
texts.en: Nabi lives in the Khuroson district.  He is 52 years old, married and has three children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Nabi has a higher, pedagogical education.  He spent fifteen years working in that field.  Today, Nabi is involved in sales of fuel.  He has been in this business for ten years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of fuel.

loans.use: to purchase fuel

loans.name: Gulchahon

texts.ru: Гулчахон проживает в районе Хуросон. Ей 34 года. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Ее муж находится России. Сама Гулчахон зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности она занимается шесть лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Gulchahon lives in the Khuroson district.  She is 34 years old, married and has four children.  Her husband is in Russia.  Gulchahon earns a living by breeding cattle.  She has been involved in this business for six years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Pyahu Group

texts.es:
15 mujeres de la ciudad de Caaguazú se unieron con el ideal de conseguir más ingresos, y de esa forma poder enfrentar los gastos que diariamente aparecen en la casa. Ellas se definen como mujeres trabajadoras, luchadoras, emprendedoras y por sobre todo responsables. Desean crecer no solo en el ámbito económico sino también a nivel personal. Actualmente se encuentran en el segundo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya.
La señora Roselia es costurera, se dedica a este trabajo hace un buen tiempo, por lo mismo pudo formarse una buena cantidad de clientes. Comenta que personas del barrio y de zonas aledañas se acercan a ella para darle trabajo. Uno de sus proyectos es tener un taller grande donde pueda recibir grandes pedidos y de esa forma poder emplear a otras personas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, agujas y demás artículos necesarios para el taller de costura. Está agradecida por la oportunidad que la Fundación le da, ya que de obtener el crédito le será de mucha ayuda en sus proyectos.
texts.en:
Fifteen women from the city of Caaguazú joined together with the dream of earning more income, and by doing so, being able to ease household expenses that come up on a daily basis. They describe themselves as hardworking, enterprising women that are fighters and above all, responsible. They hope to grow not just financially, but also on a personal level. They are currently in their second loan cycle of Fundación Paraguaya's program for entrepreneurial women. 

Roselia, is a seamstress. She has made a living at this work for a good amount of time and as such she has been able to accumulate a good amount of customers. She says that people from the neighborhood and neighboring areas come to her with work. One of her projects is to have a large workshop where she can receive large orders and this way be able to employ other people. 

She is requesting a loan to buy fabric, thread, needles, and the rest of the items necessary for the sewing workshop. She is thankful for the opportunity the Fundación has given her.

loans.use: compra de telas, hilos, agujas para utilizarlos en el taller

loans.name: Gulpari

texts.ru: Гулпари проживает в районе Хуросон. Ей 37 лет. Она замужем. У нее пятеро детей. Её муж вместе с сыном находится в России. Сама Гулпари занимается купле - продажей мелко - рогатого скота. Она в основном откармливает и продает скот. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже пять лет. Кредит берет для закупа мелко - рогатого скота.
texts.en: Gulpari lives in the Khuroson district.  She is 37 years old, married and has five children.  Her husband and son are in Russia.  Gulpari is involved in buying and selling of small livestock.  She primarily fattens up and sells livestock.  She has been involved in this business for five years.  Gulpari is requesting this loan for the purchase of small livestock.

loans.use: to purchase small livestock

loans.name: Abuzuzanya C4571 Group

texts.en:
Jacques is 29 years old and married with three children between 2 and 10 years old. Jacques is the leader of this group, which is called "ABUZUZANYA" in the local language and he is the first person on the right side, in the second row. His business is well organized and is well known in this business of selling fruits such as bananas, avocado, etc. His business hours are from 7 am until 8 pm every day except Sunday. He has two years of experience and he currently employs one person to help him.

Jacques and his group have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase their businesses by buying various fruits such as bananas, avocado, pineapple, etc. for sale.  Jacques and his team will reinvest any profits in their businesses and save for their future.

loans.use: To purchase various fruits such as bananas, avocado, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 42 years old and single. She practices horticultural farming to earn a living.  She has been farming for 10 years.  In addition, she does dairy farming.  She has employed two people to assist her on the farm. She has been able to retain her business through the financial support of Faulu Kenya.  She has learned how to save her money. She hopes to have a well-established business in the future. She has requested a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a cow, animal feed and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy a cow, animal feed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en:
Immaculee is 31 years old and married with three children aged between 2 and 8 years old. Her carpentry business is well organized and well known.  Her business hours are from 7 am until 7 pm every day except on Sunday. She has seven years of experience and she currently employs four people to help her.

Immaculee has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase her business of carpentry by buying more wood to make goods such as chairs, doors and so on for sale. With any profits, Immaculee will reinvest in her business and save for the future.

loans.use: To buy more wood

loans.name: Amado

texts.es:
El Señor Amado tiene 52 años de edad, está casado con la Señora Lucila de 51 años de edad, ellos tienen la dicha de tener 7 hijos.
Don Amado es comerciante, cuenta con una despensa en su domicilio, se dedica a esto hace mas de 10 años con la ayuda de su señora. Comenta que tiene su negocio bien surtido pues siempre tiene mucha demanda. Uno de sus sueños es poder seguir ampliando su local, para que de esa forma tenga más capacidad para almacenar los productos.
Una de sus principales motivaciones para seguir trabajando son sus hijos, pues le gustaría darles un mejor futuro del que el tuvo, desea que tengan una mejor educación y mejor nivel de vida. Tiene como anhelo que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y se vuelvan profesionales en las carreras universitarias que hayan escogido
El solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, lácteos y otros, para el abastecimiento de su local. Está agradecido a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Amado is 52, and married to Lucila, who is 51. They have the happiness of having 7 children.  Amado is a merchant, with a small convenience store in his home. He has been working at this for more than 10 years, with his wife's help. 

He says that he keeps his store well-stocked, as he always has a lot of customers. One of his dreams is to be able to continue expanding his premises, to have more space to store products. 

One of his main motivations for continuing to work is his children, as he he would like them to have a better life than he has had.  He wants them to have a better education and standard of living. His strong wish is for his children to complete their studies, and become professionals with the university degree of their choice. 

He is applying for the loan to buy foodstuffs, drinks, dairy products, and other things to stock his store with. He's thankful to the Fundación for the opportunity it has given him.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs, drinks and other things to stock his store with.

loans.name: Fotima
