Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará cremas dentales especializadas, productos energéticos, vitaminas, hierro con ácido fólico, jabones detergentes que salieron en promoción en su revista y que tienen una gran demanda entre su clientela,  especialmente si los vende con precios de oportunidad. Su sueño y por el cual trabaja y se esmera, es tener más adelante su propia casa y proyectar con ella el crecimiento y la estabilización de su negocio.
texts.en:
Hilda, age 47, is a creative and enterprising woman who lives in the south of the city with her husband and 4 children between the ages of 16 and 24.
She sells products through specialized guides. She started this business two years ago because of her sister, who encouraged her to go into sales and supported her in her family's development. She says that even though the products that she sells (toothpastes, soaps, vitamins, minerals, etc.) are expensive, they are of high quality and this is why she has so many customers. Every day others are referred to her, and often her working capital is insufficient to respond to the high demand. This is why she has turned to this Kiva loan, her first loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, she will purchase specialized toothpastes, energy products, vitamins, iron with folic acid, soaps, and detergents that are on sale in her magazine and are in great demand from her customers, especially if she sells them at sale prices. Her dream, which she is striving toward, is to have her own home in the future and for her business to grow and stabilize.

loans.use: to purchase specialized toothpastes, energy products, vitamins, iron with folic acid, and soaps and detergents that are on sale in her magazine.

loans.name: Eskimo Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Eskimo conformado por tres personas trabajadora y emprendedoras una de ellas es Marisela de los Ángeles ella tiene una panadería desde hace 8 años la cual poco a poco ha ido creciendo logrando tener una ventas mensuales de 31,600 córdobas y su inversión es de 15,200.
Ella con el crédito comprara materia prima como azúcar, harina, manteca, levadura, suero, dulce, leñas y bolsas…etc. además de una inversión que está haciendo para ampliar su negocio en la construcción de un anexo. 

Los otros integrantes son Luz Nohemí quien vende comida de manera ambulante y Ninoska quien vende quesillos en el mercado.
texts.en:
The El Eskimo group is made up of three hard-working and enterprising people. Marisela de los Ángeles is one of them. She has had a bakery for 8 years, and it has grown bit by bit. She has monthly sales of 31,600 córdobas and she invests 15,200.
With this loan she will purchase basic materials such as sugar, flour, butter, yeast, whey, jam, firewood, bags...etc. She is also making an investment to expand her business through building an annex.
The other members are Luz Nohemí, who sells food as a street vendor; and Ninoska, who sells quesillo cheese in the market.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as sugar, flour, yeast, whey, jam, firewood and bags, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase computers, furniture, and toys for the center.

loans.name: Johanna Marcela

texts.es:
Johanna de 20 años es una joven emprendedora que aprovecha su conocimiento en estética y mecánica corporal, aprendido mediante sus estudios de cosmetología,  para ponerlo al servicio de una comunidad, a partir de la cual genera sus propios ingresos haciendo tratamientos faciales, y corporales. Su meta es llegar a un mercado menos doméstico como el actual y lograr contratos con empresas pues ha hecho a sus directores la propuesta de prestarle el servicio de prevención de riesgos profesionales, mediante órdenes de servicio; para lo cual requiere una silla masajeadora para realizar masajes relajantes que requiere. Su sueño es tener su propio centro de estética y de belleza en su propia casa y con ello lograr apoyar el bienestar de su familia. Su mayor desafío fue terminar sus estudios, pero ha contado con el apoyo de su madre y de sus familiares para lograr sacar adelante todo cuanto se propone. En la actualidad son muchos los sueños que quiere alcanzar, principalmente el de lograr estabilidad socioeconómica  con su negocio para enfrentar los retos que debe asumir en el futuro. 
Este es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará una silla masajeadora e insumos, lo cual servirá para iniciar la puesta en marcha de sus servicios empresariales, que son parte del éxito de esta inversión.
texts.en:
Johanna, aged 20, is a hard working young woman.  She takes advantage of her knowledge of beautician services and body mechanics, which she learned during her studies to be a cosmetologist, and puts them to good use for the benefit of the community by providing facials and body treatments.  This also allows her to earn her own income.

Her goal is to move to a less domestic market than where she is currently, and to take on contracts with businesses.  She has therefore made proposals to business directors that she provide a service for preventing occupational risks by means of her treatments.  For this, she needs a massage chair to provide the relaxing massages that her plan requires.

Her dream is to have her own aesthetic and beauty salon in her own home, and with this to be able to support the well-being of her family.  Her big challenge was finishing her education, but she had the support of her mother and relatives to be able to succeed at everything she put herself to.  Currently, there are many of her dreams that she wants to achieve.  Foremost of these is achieving socio-economic stability with her business, so as to 
meet the challenges that she must take on in the future.

This is her first financing through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which which she will buy a massage chair and supplies.  These will be used to start commissioning her services for businesses, which are part of the outcome for this investment.

loans.use: to buy a massage chair and supplies for treatments.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia Elena es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora propietaria de una pulpería desde hace 10 años. Ella mensualmente invierte la cantidad de 20,000 córdobas en productos y su venta es de 28,000 córdobas.
Ella con el crédito compra mercadería en granos básicos principalmente, chiverías, gaseosas…etc.
texts.en:
Silvia Elena is a hard-working woman and entrepreneur. She has owned a general store for the last 10 years. Every month she invests 20,000 cordobas in goods and makes sales of 28,000 cordobas.
With the loan, she wants to principally buy staples as well as snacks, sodas etc.

loans.use: to buy staples (rice, beans, oil, corn, flour), sodas, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es: Marcos de 48 años vive en el municipio de Soledad, a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla, con su esposa y sus dos hijos en las edades de 16  y 19 años respectivamente. Marco es pensionado de las fuerzas armadas de colombia, donde aprendió la decoración con nudos y la marquetería, con lo que a partir del momento en que finalizó su servicio, se dedicó a la elaboración de cuadros marineros y medallas condecorativas, las cuales, aprovechando el conocimiento tanto del mercado como del personal de la Base Naval, ha ejercido con mucho éxito para complementar los ingresos familiares. Él tiene un negocio que inició una vez salió pensionado y decidió generar ingresos simultaneos aprovechando el conocimiento obtenido  y los contactos con proveedores y clientes para potencializar las ventas y lograr compras de calidad.  Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará marcos pinturas, para lograr hacer adecuaciones en su local y proyectar una imagen de higiene y calidad en el servicio, con lo cual captar la atención de clientes potenciales y el confort de sus clientes reales. Porque su sueño es fortalecer su microempresa permanentemente mediante su expansión y con ello poder apoyar la profesionalización de sus hijos, potenciando su éxito.
texts.en: Marcos, age 48, lives in the Soledad municipality, 15 minutes from Barranquilla city with his wife and two children, ages 16 and 19.  Marco is a pensioner of the Colombian armed forces, where he learned knot decoration and marquetry. From the moment that he finished his service, he has worked making marine art and commemorative medals. He has had great success supplementing his family's income, thanks to his knowledge of the market and his personal knowledge of the naval base. He has a business which he started when he retired in order to make an income on top of his pension. He took advantage of the knowledge he had obtained and the contacts with suppliers and clients to boost his sales and make quality purchases. This Kiva loan is his first loan with the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. With it, he will purchase frames for paintings and make improvements to his store, in order to project an image of cleanliness and quality in his business. This will capture the attention of potential clients and create more comfort for his real clients. His dream is to strengthen his business permanently through its expansion, and to thus be able to support his children in becoming successful professionals.

loans.use: to purchase frames for paintings and to make improvements to his store.

loans.name: Uniendo Fuerzas Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Estela Luz tiene 51 años D. edad  y su familia está conformada por ella su esposo y 03 hijos independiente. Actualmente Estela trabaja en una fábrica en el área D. mantenimiento (limpieza) llevando 5 años en dicho rubro, ella decido trabajar ya que con lo que ganaba su esposo no alcanzaba para cubrir los gastos del hogar, es así que Estela deciD. apoyar a su esposo, Ella se siente muy feliz ya que gracias a su trabajo a logrado que sus hijos terminen D. estudiar y ahora son profesionales. Su deseo D. Estela es D. terminar D. construir su vivienda ya que piensa instalar una bodega surtida D. abarrotes, ya que nos manifiesta que desea tener tranquilidad para su vejez. Con el crédito solicitado aportara para la construcción D. su vivienda.

Estela Luz junto a la Alcancía Comunal “Uniendo Fuerzas” integrante es un grupo conformado por 07 personas responsables que desean seguir trabajando con el Programa- Prosperidad,  Estela esta ubicada primera lado izquierda vestida polo color lila, chompa color beis. 

La señora Mari Luz no logro llegar a tiempo para la foto por motivo D. trabajo.
texts.en:
Estela Luz is 51 years old and her family is maD. up of her husband and her 3 children who have moved out. Currently Estela has been working in a factory doing maintenance (cleaning) for five years. She decided to work since what her husband was earning was not enough to cover the household expenses. This is how Estela decided to lend her husband support. Estela feels very happy since, thanks to her work, she has managed to have all her children finish their studies and become professionals. Estela’s wish is to continue constructing her home, since she is thinking of installing a shop stocked with groceries; she wants to have tranquility in her old age. With the requested loan, she will contribute to the construction of her home. She joined the “Uniendo Fuerzas” (“Uniting Forces”) communal bank, which including her is a group maD. of 7 responsible people that want to continue working with the “Prosperidad” Program. Estela is located in the first row on the left hand siD. dressed in a purple polo and a beige sweater. 

Mari Luz did not arrive in time due to reasons related to her work.

loans.use: to contribute to the construction of her home.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité La Esperanza, es de la ciudad de Lambaré, actualmente está integrado por 13 mujeres, todas ellas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad. Las señoras integrantes del comité se destacan por el sacrificio y las ganas de progresar, muchas de ellas son madres solteras que inician su día a día desde muy tempranas horas, saliendo a recorrer las calles para hacer su ventas. Comentan que se unieron con el propósito de poder seguir creciendo económicamente, como así también en lo personal.
La señora Balbina se dedica a la venta de ropas usadas. Ella lleva bastante tiempo en este trabajo y comenta que tiene muchos clientes, lo cual le genera a su vez buenos ingresos. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora, honesta y responsable. Comenta que todo lo que realiza es por darle un mejor estilo de vida a su familia. Uno de sus sueños es poder tener un local propio donde pueda traer más prendas para vender y de esa forma atraer a más clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de segunda mano, para la posterior venta. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda, ya que de obtener el crédito le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
The communal bank La Esperanza is in the city of Lambaré. Currently it is comprised of 13 women, all are friends and neighbors in that city. The women who make up the communal bank stand out because of their sacrifice and desire to succeed. Many of them are single mothers who begin their day in the early hours, leaving to walk the streets to make their sales throughout all of Asuncion, Paraguay's capital. 

Balbina sells used clothes. She has worked for quite some time in this business, and she notes that she has many clients which in turn generates a lot of income. She sees herself as a woman who is very hard-working, honest, and responsible. She says that everything she does is to give her family a better quality of life. She is asking for a loan to buy second hand clothes for later resale. She thanks the Fundación for this unique opportunity, as receiving this loan will be a great help.

loans.use: Compra de prendas de segunda mano para la posterior venta

loans.name: Sofanor Gustavo

texts.es: Sofanor de 65 años vive en Malambo, municipio área metropolitana de la ciudad de Barranquilla, con su cónyuge y tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 29 a 32 años. Sofanor  vende refrescos y productos de fritanguera, negocio que inició después de ser empleado de una importante empresa de refrescos y tomó su experiencia como conductor y posteriormente como vendedor de refrescos, para finalmente, después de tener dificultades de salud, decidir  aprovechar los conocimientos de culinaria de su esposa,  iniciando su aventura de negocio, lo cual empezó a generar ingresos para el sustento de sus familia. Hoy preparan en su negocio empanadas, arepas, patacones y vende refrescos, mediante el sistema de distribución en el sector donde habita y en los barrios aledaños.  Su negocio físicamente está ubicado en un parque frente a su casa lugar de alta circulación de transeúntes y de vehículos públicos así como privados. En su negocio tiene una vitrina calentadora, 1 picadora, 1 estufa sencilla y 1 industrial, 2 molinos eléctricos y uno manual y con su creciente clientela todo esta infraestructura es insuficiente para responder a los niveles de producción requerido. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará una estufa industrial y materias primas para  aprovechar descuentos por compras de contado y en volumen. Su meta más adelante es diversificar su oferta de productos incluyendo la línea de embutidos la cual que se encuentra estudiando para conocer su potencialidad. Aunque tiene muchos propósitos su mayor desafío es su capital de trabajo y es por esta razón que desde ya está recurriendo a financiamiento con el fin de aumentarlo.
texts.en:
Sofanor, 65, lives with his wife in Malambo, a town in the metropolitan area of the city of Barranquilla, and has three children, ages 29-32.  Sofanor sells soft drinks and fried foods, a business he started after working for an important soft-drink company.  He used his experience as a driver and, later, soft-drink vendor to finally, after some health problems, decide to make use of his wife's cooking expertise to begin his business venture, which began to generate income to support his family.  Today they make turnovers, corn cakes, and fried plantains in their stall, and sell soft drinks, which he distributes in their neighborhood and in neighboring areas.

His stall is located in a park facing his house, a place with high traffic from pedestrians, public transportation, and private cars.  In the stall he has a  warming case, a grinder, a simple stove and an industrial stove, and two electric mills and one manual mill.  All this infrastructure is insufficient to respond to the required production levels of his growing clientele.  This is why he is requesting a Kiva loan, the first loan he has solicited from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With the loan he will buy an industrial stove and raw materials to take advantage of discounts for cash and bulk sales.

Sofanor's longterm goal is to diversify his offerings, including a line of sausages he is studying to find out its potential.  Although he has many goals, his greatest challenge is his working capital, and for this reason he is appealing for financing, to increase his capital.

loans.use: to buy an industrial stove and raw materials to take advantage of discounts for cash and bulk sales.

loans.name: Felipa Esperanza

texts.es: Felipa Esperanza tiene 66 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Hace más de 8 años que tiene este medio de vida. Tiene 6 hijos a su cargo y todos los días busca la forma de mejorar la atención que les proporciona a sus clientes. Uno de sus desafíos han sido los problemas de salud que ha tenido, pero siempre está luchando y buscando como sobrevivir. Ella se levanta temprano desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche que todavía llegan ciertos clientes a comprar. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su materia prima en granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, jugos, huevos, sardinas, café, gaseosas y jabón.
texts.en: Felipa Esperanza is 66 years old.  She owns a small grocery store, which has been her livelihood for 8 years.   She has 6 children under her care and everyday she looks for ways to improve the service she provides to her customers.  One of her challenges has been health problems that she has had, but she is always fighting and looking for ways to survive.  She arises early and works from 7:00 in the morning until 10:00 at night because certain customers still come in to shop.  The loan she is requesting is to increase her inventory of basic grains, sweets, soft drinks, juices, eggs, sardines, coffee, sodas, and soap..

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, sweets, soft drinks, juices, eggs, coffee, sardines, soda, and soap.

loans.name: Socorro Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Socorro del Carmen es una mujer trabajadora y esforzada quien hace 10 años inicio vendiendo chiverías y pocos productos actualmente tiene una pulpería en la que vende de todo un poco  desde granos básicos, gaseosa, pan, jabón…etc. En el negocio mensualmente vende 9,000 córdobas e invierte 7,000 córdobas.
Ella con el crédito comprará pan, gaseosa, avena, frescos y crema entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Socorro del Carmen is an energetic, hard-working woman.  Ten years ago, she began selling snacks and a few other products.  Currently, she has a small grocery store where she sells a little of everything from basic grains to soda, bread, soap…etc.  In her business, she earns 9,000 córdobas monthly in sales and invests 7,000 córdobas.  

With the loan, she will purchase bread, soda, oatmeal, soft drinks, cream, and other products.

loans.use: to buy bread, soda, oatmeal, soft drinks, cream, etc.

loans.name: Martha Luz

texts.es:
La señora Martha de la Luz es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora originaria de Masatepe. Ella es comerciante de ropa y de electrodomésticos desde hace 10 años ella vende mensualmente 22,000 córdobas e invierte 15,200 córdobas.
Ella invertirá el crédito en la compra de mercadería en especial pantalones, blusas, televisores, radios…etc. 
Esta clienta tiene más de 20 créditos con Adim en los cuales ha demostrado ser una excelente cliente.
texts.en: Martha de la Luz is a hard-working and enterprising woman originally from Masatepe. She has been a vendor of clothing and home appliances for the past 10 years. She brings in 22,000 Nicaraguan Córdobas (NIO) each month, 15,200 NIO of which she puts back into her business. She will invest this loan in merchandise, especially pants, shirts, televisions, radios, etc. She has taken out more than 20 loans from ADIM [Kiva field partner], through which she has shown herself to be an excellent client.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, in particular, pants, shirts, televisions, and radios.

loans.name: Rina Margarita

texts.es: Rina Margarita tiene su negocio que es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio, es la primera vez que realizara un financiamiento para su actividad, ella tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. El crédito que está solicitando es para la compra de ropa en general, calzado, cremas, perfumes, pinturas, joyas entre otros productos. el sueño de Rina es seguir creciendo con su actividad y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Rina Margarita has a general retail business. She has been in this business for 3 years and this is the first time she will be taking out additional financing.  She has 2 young children to look after. 

The loan she is seeking is for the purchase of assorted clothing, footwear, cosmetic creams, perfumes, paints, and jewelry among other merchandise. Rina's dream is to continue growing her business and increasing her income.

loans.use: to purchase assorted clothing, footwear, cosmetic creams, perfumes, paints, and jewelry among other merchandise.

loans.name: Fátima Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Fátima del Carmen es una mujer trabajadora y esforzada originaria de Niquinomo. Ella es docente y comerciante de prendas de oro, plata y bisutería desde hace 6 años donde vende aproximadamente 5,000 cordobas mensuales e invierte 4,000 cordobas mensuales.
Ella con el crédito comprará mercadería como pulseras, anillos, cadenas, brazaletes…etc.
texts.en: Fátima del Carmen is a hard-working and driven woman originally from Niquinomo. She is an elementary school teacher and has been a dealer of gold, silver, and costume jewelry pieces for the past 6 years, bringing in roughly 5,000 Nicaraguan Córdobas [NIO] monthly, 4,000 [NIO] of which she puts back into her business. With this loan, she will buy additional merchandise such as bracelets, rings, and chains.

loans.use: to stock gold, silver, and costume jewelry pieces.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a freezer for making ice for resale and to buy clothing for making batiks

loans.name: Ivet

texts.es: Ivet es una confeccionista de 47 años de edad que vive en el municipio de Malambo con su cónyuge y su hijo de 14 años de edad. Desde hace 12 años se dedica a la confección de ropa en las líneas femeninas masculinas e infantiles, a una clientela principalmente de mujeres adultas y jóvenes y también,  prestas el servicio de maquila en talleres de confección que así lo soliciten ubicados en el municipio de Malambo. Su infraestructura técnica le ha permitido independizarse gradualmente y desde hace muchos años no le falta trabajo, hasta ha tenido que prestar maquinas-fileteadoras para responder al acabado perfecto que sus clientes merecen. Su esposo es comerciante independiente y distribuye productos de consumo en tiendas del sector. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la línea de credikiva, con el que planea comprar una fileteadora con el fin de mejorar la calidad de sus productos y disminuir el tiempo de producción. Su sueño más adelante es mejorar y completar toda su infraestructura técnica, con tal de fomentar el empleo desde su taller y generar mayores ingresos que apoyen el bienestar de su familia, aunque su mayor desafío es el insuficiente capital de trabajo ante su creciente clientela y este es el propósito por el cual acude a su primer apalancamiento financiero
texts.en: Ivet is a 47-year-old garment manufacturer who lives in the Malambo municipality with her partner and 14-year-old child. She has made men's, women's, and children's clothing for 12 years. Her clientele are mainly adult and young women. She also provides services to clothing workshops in the Malambo municipality. Her technical infrastructure has allowed her to gradually become independent and she has not lacked for work for several years. She has had to borrow overlock sewing machines in order to do the work that her customers deserve. Her husband is an independent merchant and distributes consumer products to the local stores. She is currently applying for her first loan with the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, through Kiva. With it she plans to buy an overlock sewing machine with the goal of improving her products and decreasing production time. Her dream for the future is to improve and complete all of her technical infrastructure, in order to generate a better income to support her family's well-being. Her greatest challenge is having insufficient working capital faced with a growing customer base. This is why she has turned to her first loan.

loans.use: to purchase an overlock sewing machine with the goal of improving the quality of her products and decreasing production time.

loans.name: Dufatanyebahinzi No 2 Group

texts.fr:
Alex est commerçant de détails et il est membre du groupe Dufatanye Bahinzi No 2. Il est né au Rwanda et il a 29  ans, il est marie. Son niveau d’éducation est 2 ans de secondaire. 

C’est son troisième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour acheter des haricots, sorghos, des arachides et des maniocs pour revendre. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d‘améliorer son commerce, minimiser les prix pour attirer les clients. Dans les prochaines années, Alex voudrait être un grand distributeur des marchandises et être grossiste. Avec les profits il va payer le frais  des scolarités de ses enfants et payer le frais médicaux pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Alex is a retail merchant and a member of the group Dufatanye Bahinzi No 2. He was born in Rwanda and is 29 years old and married. He has two years of secondary education. 

This loan cycle is his third one with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy beans, sorghum, peanuts, and cassava for resale. 

His strategy for business growth is to improve his commerce and to minimize prices in order to attract customers. In the next few years, Alex would like to be a major distributor of merchandise and to be a wholesaler. With the profits, he is going to cover the schooling costs for his children and to cover the medical costs for his family.

loans.use: to buy beans, sorghum, peanuts, and cassava for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy large quantities of sweets and snacks.

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es: Mayra de 22 años vive en el municipio de Soledad y tiene una hija de 2 años de edad. Allí se dedica desde el año 2007, a vender mediante catálogos o exhibidas, mercancías variadas como perfumes, ropa, cosméticos por encargo, en la modalidad de crédito a plazos pactados a 15 días,  con sus clientes. Entre su clientela se encuentran empleados, personal de la policía, familiares, vecinos, amigos y los referidos que día a día crecen. Cuando se aventuró a emprender una actividad que le generara ingreso fue apoyada por un familiar quien le prestó dinero, asi fue como se incorporó a una importante empresa para vender mediante catálogos sus productos como lo hace hasta la fecha, pero ahora también compra en la zona comercial de Barranquilla, otras mercancías que no tiene su catálogo. Con su negocio ha logrado captar una creciente clientela y comprar su vitrina, para exhibir la mercancía en casa de su madre, con quien vive en compañía de su hermano y su pequeña hija, con la que sueña ver convertida en una profesional exitosa y es el principal motor de su vida. Su sueño y gran desafío es lograr un almacén bien posicionado, especializado en la línea cosmética y en ropa. Con su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, logrará tener un capital adicional para comprar ropa, cosméticos que tiene encargados y desea ser oportuna para no perder clientela. Su inversión resultará exitosa porque la hace sobre pedidos de sus más rentables clientes y en una época en la cual repuntan las ventas como el mes del amor y de la amistad, para el cual está preparada con su credikiva.
texts.en: Mayra, who is 22 years old, lives in the municipality of Soledad. She has a daughter, who is 2 years old. There, since 2007, she has sold a variety of merchandise such as perfumes, clothing, and cosmetics through orders placed from catalogs or at exhibits. She sells on credit, with agreements with her customers for payments in two weeks. Her customers include employees, police staff, relatives, neighbors, friends, and people referred to her, who increase every day. When she ventured to begin this business which would generate income for her, she was supported by a relative who lent her money. This was how she started up an important business to sell her products through catalogs, as she has done up to this date,  but now she also buys in the commercial zone of Barranquilla from other merchants whose catalog she doesn't have. With her business, she has succeeded in attracting a growing customer base and in buying a display case to exhibit her merchandise in the house of her mother, with whom she lives, along with her brother and her little daughter, whom she dreams of raising to be a successful professional and is the main motivation for her life. Her dream and great challenge is to have a well-located store specializing in cosmetic lines and clothing. With her Kiva loan, her first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, she will have additional capital to buy clothing and cosmetics for which she has orders, and she wants to do this in a timely manner so that she does not lose customers. Her investment will be successful since she still has orders from her most profitable clients and she will be prepared with her Kiva loan for the seasons in which sales rise, such as the month of love and friendship.

loans.use: to buy clothing and cosmetics for which she has orders that she wants to fill in a timely manner

loans.name: Miriam Amanda

texts.es: Miriam  D. 32 años D. edad vive   al sur D. la ciudad con su cónyuge y sus 4 hijos, que estudian y se encuentran  en las edades D. 4 a 12 años. Allí en su habitad, tiene un restaurante donD. se dedica a vender almuerzos caseros; su experiencia data D. 10 años, cuando fue empleada D. un pequeño restaurante muy cerca D. su vivienda, donD. se dedicaba a la preparación D. alimentos y también lo administraba. La propietaria D. este negocio no pudo continuar y le propuso a Miriam que lo comprara; desD. ese mismo momento en que decidió, ha logrado aumentar sus ingresos y el apoyo D. su hija mayor y D. su esposo han sido fundamentales para el desempeño del restaurante.  Sus clientes son L. vecinos del sector, pensionados, taxistas, empleados D. empresas ubicadas en el barrio y transeúntes en general. Su meta es lograr perfeccionar su actividad y ampliarlo para aumentar su rentabilidad, que en la actualidad no es menor del 35%. Su gran desafío es que su creciente clientela amerita nuevo capital D. trabajo, para comprar en volumen y D. contado sus materias primas,  con tal D. obtener descuentos y continuar siendo competitiva. Esta es la razón por la cual acuD. a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará insumos por volumen, y también sillas, hieleras, ollas recipientes y para hacer mantenimiento D. su nevera. Su mayor desafío es lograr tener un local propio y por ello gradualmente se esmera para en el futuro lograrlo.
texts.en:
Miriam is 32, and lives south of the city with her partner and their 4 school-age children, who are from 4 to 12 years old. She has a restaurant in her home, where she sells home-cooked lunches.

Her experience in this goes back 10 years, to when she worked in a small restaurant very close to her home, where she prepared meals, and also ran the place. The owner of this business couldn't continue with it, and proposed to Miriam that she buy it. From the time she decided, she has managed to increase her income.  

The support of her older daughter and of her husband have been key for the success of her restaurant.  Her customers are people in the area, pensioners, taxi-drivers, employees of companies located in the neighborhood, and passers-by in general.  

Her goal is to succeed in developing her business, and to expand it in order to increase its profitability, which presently is no less than 35%.  Her big challenge is that her growing clientele warrants new working capital to buy raw materials in volume, with cash; this in order to get discounts and keep being competitive.  This is the reason she applied for her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. 

She will use the loan to buy ingredients in bulk, and also chairs, coolers, pots, and to maintain her refrigerator. Her biggest challenge is to succeed in having her own place, and she's striving, little by little, to achieve that in the future.

loans.use: To buy ingredients in bulk, and also chairs, coolers, pots; and maintain her refrigerator.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.es: Ruby de 54 años de edad vive en Soledad, municipio cerca de la ciudad de Barranquilla y área metropolitana de esta ciudad. Ella tiene 5 hijos en las edades de 20 a 38 años y se dedica al tradicional oficio de la confección de prendas en las diversas líneas, femeninas, masculina e infantil, ella ofrece el servicio uno a uno tomando las medidas a sus clientes a quienes viste con elegancia y distinción, pero también tiene como clientes a colegios del sector y  les confecciona los uniformes de educación física y de diario. Su experiencia data desde cuando trabajó como empleadas en talleres y finalmente decidió generar su propio emprendimiento con su primera máquina sencilla, que compró para ofrecer este servicio y que gradualmente ha ido mejorando su infraestructura con el producto de su trabajo autónomo con el cual también ha logrado educar a sus 5 hijos, como mujer cabeza de familia. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materias primas e insumos como telas, correderas, hilos, adornos encajes, para ofrecer nuevos diseños y ampliar su mercado con nuevas modas. Su meta más adelante es adecuar un local para independizar su negocio de su vida familiar y lograr el tan añorado sosiego. Mientras esto ocurre Ruby trabaja manejando una utilidad neta del 32% y que planea reinvertir en materias primas y ahorrar para aumentar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Ruby, age 54, lives in the Soledad municipality, which is close to the city of Barranquilla and the metropolitan area of this city.  She has five children ranging in age from 20 years old up to 38.

She devotes herself to the traditional trade of making various lines of clothing for women, men, and children.  The service she offers is one to one.  She takes her customers’ measurements, and she dresses them with elegance and distinction.  The schools in her sector are also her customers.  She makes their physical education uniforms and their daily uniforms.

Her experience dates back to when she worked as an employee in seamstress shops.  She finally decided to start her own endeavor with her first basic machine, which she bought to offer this service.  She has gradually been improving her infrastructure with the profit from her self-employed work. With her profits, as a woman head of the household, she has also managed to educate her five children.

This is her fist Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy supplies like fabric, zippers, thread, and lace trimming in order to offer new designs and to expand her market with new styles.

Her goal for later on is to set up a place so that her business is independent of her family life.  Then she will achieve the serenity she has longed for so much.

While this is happening Ruby works with a net profit of 32%, which she plans to reinvest in supplies.  She also plans to save in order to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy supplies like  to buy supplies like fabric, zippers, thread, and lace trimming to make new designs and expand with new styles.

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion Group

texts.es:
14 mujeres D. la ciudad D. Asunción se unieron con el propósito D. generar mayores ingresos para sus Familias. D. dicha unión surge el comité denominado Mujeres en Acción, donD. todas ellas trabajan dentro D. un ambiente D. respeto, ayuda mutua y en especial D. responsabilidad. El grupo se halla en el décimo cuarto  ciclo dentro del programa.
La señora Gloria tiene una peluquería, por medio D. este negocio ella obtiene todos los fondos para ayudar a su familia, dándoles a ellos una vida digna y decorosa. Nos comenta que tiene muchas clientas que siempre acuden a su local, ya que Gloria siempre las atienD. con mucha amabilidad y cordialidad. Uno D. sus proyectos es agrandar su local, para que D. esa forma tenga más capacidad y pueda atender a más clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. insumos para la peluquería, como ser tintes, gel, juego D. tijeras, y otros necesarios para el negocio. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que le da.
texts.en:
Fourteen women from the city of Asunción came together with the idea to create more income for their families and from this gathering came about the communal bank called Mujeres en Acción [Women in Action] where all of them work within an atmosphere of respect, mutual help and especially responsibilities. This group is in the fourteenth cycle within the program.

Glora has a beauty salon and through this business she earns all of the money in order to help her family, giving them an honorable and decent life. She tells us that she has many clients that always come to her shop, and Gloria always serves them with lots of kindness and cordiality. One of her plans is to enlarge the premises in order to have more room and be able to serve more customers.  

She is asking for a loan in order to buy supplies for her beauty salon, such as hair dye, gel, set of scissors, and other necessities for her business. She thanks the Foundation for the opportunity it gives her.

loans.use: to purchase hair dye, gel, set of scissors and other necessities for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials and supplies for producing her finished products.

loans.name: Aida Luz

texts.es: Aida con su credikiva anterior, compró al por mayor y de contado, mercancías variadas y respondió a sus pedidos. Así mismo invirtió en cajas de refrescos y de cervezas con las cuales abasteció sus fines de semana a sus clientes. Ahora planea invertir un nuevo capital de trabajo a su negocio, con su Credikiva, pues conoce que el segundo semestre del año si tiene inventarios sus ventas y utilidades aumentarán significativamente. Ella envía el siguiente mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva: “Estoy agradecida con su financiación” esto es porque con el apoyo a su negocio, ha logrado mejorar sus ingresos, mejorar la educación de sus hijos y la estabilización económica de su microempresa. Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Aida, ingrese al siguiente enlace:  http://kiva.org/lend/199721
texts.en:
With her previous loan, Aida was able to buy a variety of merchandise in bulk and with cash so that she could fulfill her orders. At the same time, she also invested in cases of soft drinks and beer so that she could sell them to her customers on the weekends. Now she plans to invest a new infusion of operating capital into her business. With her Kiva loan, Aida will stock up on inventory because she expects to see a significant increase in sales and profits during the second half of the year. She sends the following message to Kiva lenders: “I am grateful for your financial support.”

With the assistance provided to her business, Aida was able to improve her income, improve her children’s education, and stabilize the finances of her micro-enterprise. To learn more about Aida’s story, please click on the following link: http://kiva.org/lend/199721

loans.use: to buy a variety of merchandise such as shoes, bags, perfumes, soft drinks, and beer.

loans.name: Kelis

texts.es: Kelis vive en el municipio de Soledad, muy cerca de la ciudad de Barranquilla, con sus dos hijos en las edades de 1 y 4 años. Allí tiene un negocio donde vende mercancía y distribuye también pasabocas , el cual inició desde el año 2007, cuando requirió buscar ingresos para el sostenimiento de sus dos hijos. Inició con un pequeño capital que le suministraron prestamistas informales a un alto costo; en un principio trabajó con mucho sacrificio y logró hacer un pequeño capital, el que hoy quiere incrementar con inyecciones de crédito, como las que ahora solicita a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización en la cual se encuentra aplicando a su credikiva. En su negocio la ayuda un trabajador y ahora tiene el sueño de convertir su casa en una infraestructura de dos pisos, para independizar su actividad productiva de su familia y lograr el sosiego que tanto anhela. Su mayor desafío, es el escaso capital con el que cuenta para lograr expandir su negocio y cumplir todos los sueños que en su mente brillan. Mientras esto ocurre, Kelis se esmera en trabajar y con ello logra que sus ventas le suministre el 24%, lo cual reinvierte para continuar capitalizando su negocio. Su credikiva lo aplicará en la compra al por mayor  de pasabocas, como chitos, papitas, tajaditas rosquitas, platanitos etc.
texts.en:
Kelis lives in the town of Soledad, which is near the city of Barranquilla. She has two children, ages 1 and 4. Kelis has a business selling merchandise and distributing snack foods. She started this business in 2007 because she needed to secure an income to support her two children. Kelis started out with a little bit of capital that she obtained from informal moneylenders at a high cost. At first, she worked with great sacrifice just to receive a small return. Today she wants to infuse more capital into her business, so she is submitting a request to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, the organization that is taking her Kiva loan application.

Kelis has the help of one employee in her business. Her dream at the moment is to remodel the infrastructure of her two-story house so that she can have a separate productive space for her family and achieve the peaceful life that she always wanted. The greatest challenge for her is the lack of capital to expand her business and fulfill all of the dreams that she had planned. In the meantime, Kelis strives in her work to attain a return on sales of 24%, which will be reinvested in the continuation of her business. Her Kiva loan will be used to buy snack foods in bulk such as cheese snacks, potato chips, plantain chips, donuts, banana chips, and other items.

loans.use: to buy snack foods in bulk such as cheese snacks, potato chips, plantain chips, donuts, banana chips, and other items.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: Verónica de 34 años de edad vive en la urbanización La Playa con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 5 y 15 años de edad. Ella tiene un negocio donde ofrece servicios de telecomunicaciones y de videojuegos llamados “Comunícate ya” negocio que inició después de haber recibido una liquidación de la empresa en la cual trabajaba, iniciando con dos equipos y dos mesas sencillas en la ciudad de Santa Marta  donde en ese momento residía y trabajaba acompañada de su hija mientras desarrollaba las actividades domésticas. . Cundo se mudó a la ciudad de Barranquilla emprendió el mismo negocio y gradualmente fue agregando otro computados, posteriormente servicios de internet video juegos, fotocopiaje, scaner, fax y transcripciones. En la actualidad su negocio se ha extendido y está adecuando su local para organizar su negocio y ofrecer un mejor servicio. Su meta más adelante es continuar estudiando, pues es bachiller y sueña con estudiar análisis y programación de computadores para conocer más del tema y perfeccionar su negocio. En la actualidad está aplicando su primer credikiva, financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará dos equipos de computación, dos mesas, dos sillas, pues bien la época de vacaciones y quiere ofrecer un servicio más efectivo pues su demanda se incrementará. Su mayor desafío es la falta de capital de trabajo para lograr rápidamente alcanzar sus metas y permanece trabajando para lograr con financiamiento de Kiva aumentar sus posibilidades de invertir y multiplicar su inversión. Actualmente sus indicadores financieros de rentabilidad sobre las ventas es de 56% maneja un margen de contribución de 64,28% y desde aquí planea su crecimiento.
texts.en: Verónica is 34 years old. She lives in the town of La Playa with her spouse and her two children, aged 5 and 15. She has a business offering telecommunications services and video games, called “Comunícate ya” ["Get in touch now"]. She opened the business after receiving severance pay from a company where she used to work. She started with two computers and two simple tables in the city of Santa Marta, where she lived at that time, and she worked alongside her daughter while also pursuing her household activities. When she moved to the city of Barranquilla, she set up the same business, and she gradually added more computers. Later, she added more services: online video games, photocopying, scanning, fax and transcriptions. Currently, her business has expanded and she is renovating her shop to better organize her business and offer better service. Her goal for the future is to continue studying, since she is a college student and dreams of studying computer programming and systems analysis so that she will know more about the subject and can improve her business. She is currently applying for her first Kiva loan, financed through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, with which she will buy two computers, two tables and two chairs, because vacation time is approaching and she wants to offer better service since demand will be increasing. Her greatest challenge is the lack of working capital that would let her achieve her goals rapidly and keep working. With the Kiva financing, she can increase her opportunities to invest and multiply her investment. Currently, her financial indicator of profitability on sales is 56%, and she maintains a contribution margin of 64.28%, and she is planning for growth on that basis.

loans.use: to buy two computers, two tables and two chairs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food products and a display case

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Unidas nace hace más de tres años mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar. Este grupo es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, en estos más de tres años de intenso trabajo han crecido tanto social como económicamente, son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras. 
Una de las integrantes, la señora Ignacia, se dedica a la venta de bebidas, por medio de este negocio puede mantener y sustentar a su familia, comenta que tiene muchos clientes y por consiguiente mucha demanda. Los días donde más pedidos tiene son los fines de semanas, pues los domingos casi no se trabaja y las personas aprovechan para compartir en familia. Desea, algún día poder ampliar su negocio, con lo cual podrá aumentar su capacidad de almacenaje.
El crédito es solicitado para la compra de bebidas, como ser cervezas y vino, para el abastecimiento del local. Está esperanzada en el crédito, pues le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The communal bank, "Mujeres Unidas," (United Women) was formed more than three years ago through the management and support of another communal bank that was working in the same place.  This group is from the city of San Lorenzo.  In more than three and a half years of hard work, they have grown both socially and economically.  They are known here as very hard-working women.

One of the members, señora Ignacia, sells drinks.  Through this business, she supports her family.  She tells us that she has many clients and consequently a lot of demand.  Her busiest days are on weekends.  On Sundays, most people don't work and they make the most of spending time with their families.  She hopes someday to be able to expand her business so she can increase her storage capacity.

The requested loan will be used to purchase drinks like beer and wine to supply her store.  She is hopeful for the credit because it will be of much use to her.

loans.use: to buy drinks to sell

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza de 54 años vive en el municipio de Malambo, área metropolitana de la ciudad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos en las edades de 19 a 29 años. En esta población tiene una miscelánea donde vende productos de papelería en general, vestidos prendas y muchos artículos que compran de contado y a crédito sus principales clientes, que son amas de casa y jóvenes ubicados en su barrio y en los aledaños de este. Su negocio lo aprendió desde hace 30 años,  desde cuando vivió en el municipio de Maicao, zona fronteriza caracterizada por la actividad comercial formal e informal. En un principio empezó vendiendo ropa y artículos de aseo que distribuía entre pocos clientes, pero desde que se mudó al municipio de Malambo, continuó con la actividad, con el fin de apoyar la gestión de su hogar que solo estaba a cargo de su esposo, de profesión electricista que en la mayor parte del tiempo debe viajar. Desde hace 4 años el negocio funciona en un espacio del lugar donde habita y  aunque inició sin infraestructura física, en la actualidad cuenta con dos vitrinas y una fotocopiadora donde ofrece servicios de fotocopiaje. Este es el primer financiamiento que hace para fortalecer su negocio, y con este se vinculará a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, pues vio en su credikiva una excelente oportunidad para iniciar su historial crediticio. Con su primer financiamiento por esta línea de Kiva, comprará cosméticos, fantasía, bisutería y papelería artículos que tienen muchos pedidos.
Su meta es multiplicar su negocio tener una infraestructura adecuada, para que  en un futuro se convierta en un almacén.
texts.en:
Esperanza is 54 and lives in the municipality of Malambo, a metropolitan area of the city.  She is married and has 4 children who range in age from 19 to 29.  She has a small general store where she sells office supplies, clothing, and many items that her customers buy from her with cash and on credit.  Her main customers are housewives and young people in her neighborhood and neighborhoods to the east.  She learned her business 30 years ago when she lived in the municipality of Maicao, a border area characterized by formal and informal commercial activity.  At first, she started selling clothing and toiletries that she distributed among a few customers.  When she moved to Malambo, she continued her business with the goal of helping with her family's finances.  Only her husband was contributing to their income.  He is an electrician and travels the majority of the time.  For 4 years, she has had her business in her home and although she started it without physical infrastructure, she currently has 2 display cases and a photocopier where she offers photocopying services.  This is her first loan, which she will use to strengthen her business.  With it, she will be connected to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She saw this as an excellent opportunity to start her credit history.  With her first loan, she will buy cosmetics, costume jewelry, and office supplies for which she has a lot of demand.

Her goal is to grow her business and to have adequate infrastructure so in the future she can turn it into a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, costume jewelry, and office supplies for which she has a lot of demand

loans.name: Yasunary

texts.es: Yasunary  de 35 años, vive en Soledad con su cónyuge y su hijo de 4 años de edad. Allí se dedica al comercio de calzado para damas, caballeros, accesorios femeninos, perfumes y relojes; negocio que inició hace 2 años cuando inició con la venta de calzado como su producto estrella, hoy ha adicionado accesorios, útiles escolares, joyas, juguetes productos de belleza y hasta dulcería. Su creciente clientela ha impulsado la necesidad de capital de trabajo para responder a pedidos especialmente en la época en que repuntan las ventas, como el mes del amor y de la amistad que se acerca, pero su desafío es conseguir recursos para inyectar capital a su negocio y poder responder oportunamente la demanda. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará calzado para damas, caballeros, accesorios femeninos, perfumes y relojes sobre pedidos, pues sus clientes quieren demostrar su cariño a sus seres queridos y amigos en esta fecha. Su meta más adelante es tener un almacén, donde exhiba sus productos y proyectarse en un futuro a varios puntos de ventas. Mientras esto ocurre sigue trabajando esforzadamente por sostener su negocio con indicadores financieros con potencial de crecimiento, como una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor del 25% una autonomía del 98,24%, una rotación de inventarios de 54 días, mientras sus cuentas por cobrar rotan cada 9 días, indicadores desde los cuales impulsará su crecimiento.
texts.en:
Yasunary is 35 and lives in Soledad with her husband and 4-year-old son.  There she sells women's and men's shoes, women's accessories, perfumes, and watches.  She started her business 2 years ago when she started selling shoes as her star product.  Today she has added accessories, school supplies, jewelry, toys, beauty supplies, and even sweets.  Her growing clientele has driven the need for working capital to respond to orders, especially in the time when her sales are picking up.  Since the holiday of the "Day of Love and Friendship" is coming up, her challenge is to get the necessary resources to inject capital into her business to be able to respond appropriately to the demand.  This is the reason she is turning to Kiva for her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy women's and men's shoes, women's accessories, perfume, and watches.  Her customers want to show their affection to their loved ones and friends on this date.

Her future goal is to have a grocery store where she can display her products and protect herself in the future with various points of sale.  She continues working hard to keep her business with the numbers that show the potential of financial growth.  She has a profitability of 25%, is 98.24% independent, and has an inventory turnover of 54 days.  Her accounts payable turnover is 9 days.  These are all indicators that will drive her growth.

loans.use: to buy shoes for women and men, women's accessories, perfume, and wathces

loans.name: Martha Segunda

texts.es: Martha de 46 años es madre de 3 hijos en las edades de 22 a 30 años y se dedica en el municipio de Soledad, donde vive,  a la confección de cortinas abullonados, cenefas y cojines, actividad que aprendió hace 30 años para apoyar la gestión de su hogar; ella inicialmente trabajó en un taller de muebles, donde cosía a mano y posteriormente adquirió una nueva experiencia en un almacén de costura de cortinas durante 13 años, hasta que en el año 1990, con el producto de su liquidación, comprara una maquina e iniciara su propia aventura de negocio y hasta la presente ha logrado ingresos para apoyar el bienestar de su familia. Martha tiene un año de estar vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que la ha apoyado con capital de crédito por eso su capital se ha incrementado y en la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva, segundo financiamiento con esta organización, el cual invertirá en la compra de materiales para rellenos, telas correderas y otros insumos además de un máquina familiar, que facilite el incremento de su producción y con ello sus ventas.  Su meta es incrementar la clientela y ofrecer oportunidades de ingresos a más operarias. Mientras esto ocurre se esmera en su trabajo manejando una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor del 16% desde la cual planea su incremento.
texts.en:
Martha is 46 and the mother of 3 children who range in age from 22 to 30.  She works in the municipality of Soledad, where she also lives.  She makes curtains, valances, and cushions, an activity that she learned 30 years ago to support her home.  She initially worked in a furniture shop where she sewed by hand and later acquired new experience in a sewing shop making curtains for 13 years.  In 1990, the shop was liquidated, and she bought a sewing machine and started her own business.  She has obtained good income to support her family's well-being.

Martha has worked with Fundación Santo Domingo for one year.  They have supported her with capital through a loan, and she is now applying for her second loan, which she will invest in the purchase of materials like padding, cords, and other supplies as well as a family sewing machine that will facilitate an increase in her production, and with it, her sales.  Her goal is to grow her clientele and to offer income opportunities to more workers.  She works very hard and maintains a profitability of no less than 16%, which is why she is planning her growth.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of materials like stuffing, fabric, cords, and other materials, as well as a family sewing machine.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es: Elvira es socia del Banco comunal Paraiso, tiene 59 años, ella tiene un máquina de escribir y redacta documentos, tiene 2 hijos mayores, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en el techado de su casa, con mucha alegría recuerda cómo empezó a trabajar en el Registro Electoral de Ayacucho antes ella enmicaba documentos y vendía lapiceros, porta DNI y canguros, poco a poco fue progresando, ella está muy feliz en Finca porque le ha brindado todo lo que otra entidad financiera no podría, agradece por los préstamos recibidos, que le han permitido educar a sus hijos, ahora la meta que tiene es poder techar su casa el 2ª piso, para tener habitaciones para alquilar.
texts.en:
Elvira is a member of the Paraiso Communal Bank, and is 59 years old.  She has a typewriter and types up documents.  She has two grown sons.

She will invest the loan she is requesting in the roofing of her home.  

She remembers with much joy how she started working at the Electoral Register in Ayacucho in earlier times.  She laminated documents and sold pens, ID card holders, and fanny packs.  Bit by bit she made progress, and she is very happy with Finca, as they have provided everything that the other financial institution was not able to.  She is thankful for the loans she has received, which have allowed her to educate her children.  

Now her goal is to be able to put a roof on the second floor of her house, so as to have accommodation to rent out.

loans.use: to put a roof on her house.

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es: Marilu e socia del Banco Comunal Paraiso, tiene 42 años y 3 hijos, tiene una Bodega y el préstamo lo utilizará para poder invertir en su negocio, en Finca tiene 10 años, ella siempre tuvo su Bodega, agradece a Finca por todo el apoyo, gracias a los préstamos que ha recibido a podido invertir en su casa, ahora se le hizo costumbre los ahorros y cada año hace algo para su casa o su familia, su deseo es tener otro negocio.
texts.en: Marilu is a member of the communal bank "Paraiso."  She is 42 years old and has 3 children.  She has a store, and she will use the loan to invest in her business.  She has been a member of Finca for 10 years, and she always had her store.  She thanks Finca for all of the support.  Thanks to the loans that she has received, she has been able to invest in her home.  Now she has gotten into the habit of saving, and every year she does something for her house or her family.  Her desire is to have another business.

loans.use: to buy products for her store.

loans.name: El Renacer De Chacrasana Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “El Renacer de Chacrasana” es un grupo conformados por 09 mujeres emprendedoras siendo Olinda una de las integrantes. Olinda tiene 41 años de edad es soltera  y tiene 01 hijo en etapa escolar. Olinda se dedica  a la venta de productos de belleza desde hace 02 años, este negocio surge a raíz de su separación, ya que ella tenía que trabajar para mantener a su hijo y es así que empezó a vender ofreciendo sus productos a sus amigos y conocidos de su zona, pero no solo se dedica a la venta de productos también nos cuenta que brinda servicio domestico de limpieza y cocina es así como Olinda ha superado los problemas ya que su mayor motivación es su hijo.  El deseo de  Olinda es de tener su casa propia ya que nos manifiesta que vive en casa de sus padres. El préstamo solicitado será invertido en productos de belleza como cremas, colonias, talcos, perfumes, entre otros. La Alcancía Comunal “El Renacer de Chacrasana”   agradece el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
"El Renacer de Chacrasana" Communal Bank is a group of nine women entrepreneurs, one of whom is Olinda.  Olinda, 41 and single, has one school-age child.  For two years Olinda has been selling beauty products, a job that presented itself because of her separation.  Since she had to work to support her child, she began selling her products to friends and acquaintances in her area.  She tells us that she not only sells beauty products, she also offers cleaning and cooking services.  In this way Olinda has overcome her problems, since her greatest motivation is her child.  Olinda's wish is to have her own house, since she tells us that she lives with her parents.

The requested loan will be invested in beauty products such as face cream, cologne, talcum powder, and perfume, among others.  "El Renacer de Chacrasana" Communal Bank is grateful for the support offered.

loans.use: To buy talcum powder, face cream, perfume, and cologne.

loans.name: Ruby Ester

texts.es:
Ruby está feliz con su anterior credikiva, porque gracias a este pudo aumentar sus ventas de bolsos, hamacas y mochilas en la Zona Turistica de Tolú; en la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará hilos, y artesanias para continuar su distribución de productos y aumentar su capital de trabajo, porque su sueño es tener un almacen bien posicionado en la carretera Troncal del Occidente que es la zona comercaial de San Jacinto. Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Ruby ingrese al siguiente enlace:
http://kiva.org/lend/204874
texts.en:
Ruby is happy with her previous Kiva loan because she was able to increase her sales of handbags, hammocks, and backpacks in the tourist district of Tolú. She is now applying for a new Kiva loan so that she can buy yarn and handicrafts in order to continue distributing her products and increase her operating capital. Her dream is to open a warehouse in a good location along the Troncal del Occidente Highway, which is in the commercial district of San Jacinto.

To learn more about Ruby’s story, please follow the following link: http://kiva.org/lend/204874

loans.use: to buy yarn and handicrafts.

loans.name: Visión Hacia El Futuro Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Visión Hacia el Futuro”  está conformado por 16 emprendedoras que se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran venta de ropa, venta de comida rápida, trabajo en fierros, entre otros. Todas ellas pertenecientes a la ciudad de Chillán.
Yareany integrante del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra al fondo del grupo en la tercera fila y tercera en el lugar de derecha a izquierda, además su cabello está tomado. Ella se dedica al rubro de preparación y venta de comida rápida. Comenzó hace un mes su negocio, por lo que se encuentra organizandolo. Sin embargo, ya cuenta con un gran número de clientela. Ella prepara las comidas en su casa y las vende directamente para llevar. Su horario es durante las tardes todos los días de la semana. 
Con el crédito comprará un microondas, insumos para sus preparaciones y envases de plástico para transportarlos. 
Sus metas son tener un local establecido e incluir venta de abarrotes y productos para un minimarket. 
Yareany vive junto a su marido y sus cuatro hijas de 15, 8, 4 y 1 año de edad. Sus sueños en el ámbito personal, son brindarles la posibilidad a sus hijos de una buena calidad en su educación y que puedan ser profesionales. Además de surgir con su negocio y generar mayores ganancias, para concretar sus sueños.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida del apoyo que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, para invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía del grupo del Banco comunal, ya que son amables y responsables.
Considera que las capacitaciones serán una gran asesoría, para los negocios de las demás emprendedoras y en especial para su negocio.
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Visión Hacia el Futuro,” it is made up of 16 entrepreneurs who are all in different lines of work like selling clothes, selling fast food, and metalworking among other things. They all live in the city of Chillán.

Yareany is an integral part of the communal bank. In the photo she's in the middle of the group in the third row and third from the right, and also her hair is short. She works in the preparation and sale of fast food. She began her business one month ago, at which time she organized it. However, she already has a a good number of clients. She makes food in her house and sells it immediately to go. 

With this loan she'll buy a microwave, ingredients for her food, and plastic containers to transport it. Her goals are to have an established location and to include the sale of groceries and minimarket items. 

Yareany lives with her husband and their three daughters aged 15, 8, 4 and 1 year old. Her dream in her personal life is to give her children the amazing gift of a good education so that they can become professionals. And so she moves forward with her business to generate greater profits and realize her dreams. 

She is very happy and thankful for the support which has been offered by Fondo Esperanza to invest in her business. Furthermore she feels very comfortable in the company of the communal bank members who are friendly and responsible. She believes that the business training will be a great asset for entrepreneurs who come later and especially for her own business. 

Chillán is a town in the central area in the south of Chile. The name of the town means "sun chair" in Mapudungun, the language of the Mapuches indigenous population. Chillán is known as the "Cradle of the Nation" or the "Land of Artists," since leading figures in the history of Chile were born there, for example the famous pianist Claudio Arrau.

loans.use: to buy a microwave, ingredients for her food, and plastic containers to transport it.

loans.name: Aifai

texts.en:
Aifai is 39 years of age and married with six children. She owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale.  She has one year of experience in this business. 

Aifai needs a loan of WST 1000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 230 talas or US $96 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Aifai joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Aifai's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Merys De Jesus

texts.es: Merys de 26 años de edad vive en el municipio de San Jacinto en el departamento de Bolívar, con su hijo de 2 años. Su negocio data desde cuando su hermano vendía mercancía proveniente del municipio de Maicao en el departamento de la Guajira y con toda esta experiencia Merys, hace 4 años empezó su aventura de negocio con poca mercancía, distribuyéndola a crédito entre su mercado inicial de familiares, vecinos y amigos. Gradualmente su creciente clientela empezó a reconocerla y a solicitarle, ropa, electrodomésticos menores etc. y  con esto ella amplió un poco su espectro. En la actualidad vende a crédito en plazos pactados uno a uno, con sus clientes, recupera su dinero semanalmente, mensual y quincenalmente, de acuerdo a lo convenido con ellos. Su credikiva es su primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará cortinas, abanicos, licuadoras y mercancías que tiene encargadas y con esta inversión estaría aumentando su capital de trabajo. Su sueño más adelante, es tener un almacén para vender al por mayor y con sus ingresos educar a su hijo, con un nivel de calidad para cumplir su gran propósito de ayudarlo a ser exitoso. Mientras esto ocurre, Merys trabaja en su negocio manejando una liquidez de 16 a 1 o sea que por cada $1COP tiene $16 COP para responder y  desde aquí, con sus inyecciones de capital de trabajo producto de sus credikiva, planea su crecimiento futuro.
texts.en:
Merys, 26, lives with her two-year-old son in the town of San Jacinto in the department of Bolívar.  Her business dates back to when her brother was selling merchandise that came from the town of Maicao in the department of La Guajira.  With this experience, Merys began her business venture four years ago with a small amount of merchandise, distributing it on credit to her initial market of family, neighbors, and friends.  Gradually her growing clientele began to recognize her and ask her for clothing, small electric appliances, and so on, and from there she expanded her range a little.  At present Merys sells on credit in terms agreed upon individually with her customers; she recovers her money weekly, twice a month, and monthly, in accordance with each agreement.

Her Kiva loan is her first funding from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  Merys will buy curtains, fans, blenders, and merchandise that has been ordered, and with this investment she would be increasing her working capital.  Her long-term dream is to have a store for selling wholesale and, with her earnings, educate her son at a level of quality that fulfills her objective to help him be successful.  In the meantime, Merys is working on her business managing a liquidity of 16 to 1, or better said, for every 1 Colombian peso she has 16 in reserve, and, from this point, with the injection of working capital from her Kiva loan, she is planning her future growth.

loans.use: to buy curtains, fans, blenders, and merchandise that has been ordered.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es: La señora Leonarda tiene 61 años de edad, estudio hasta el sexto año de primaria por que sus padres no tenían los recursos para mandarla a la escuela ya que eran 11 hermanos. Ella es casada y vive sola con su esposo ya que sus hijos son casados. Doña Leo como de cariño le dice la gente se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, perfumes y artículos para el hogar por catalogo desde hace 20 años, ella emprendió este negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su casa  y dice que a ella le gusta lo que hace ya que así a conocido a mucha gente que le ofrece a sus productos, además ella a ayudado a mucha gente a tener un empleo através de su negocio de venta de cosméticos por catalogo y eso la llena de orgullo en su trabajo. Leonarda esta pidiendo a la financiera un crédito para comprar perfumes, cosméticos etc., que tiene ya pedidos por sus clientas y que no ha podido sacar por que no ha tenido capital para comprar y venderlos a sus clientas. La meta que tiene la señora Leo es poner un local estable ya que ha su edad ya se cansa de andar en las calles ofreciendo sus productos de belleza.
texts.en:
Leonarda is 61 years old.  She only completed sixth grade in elementary school because her parents did not have the resources to send her to school because they were eleven siblings.  She’s married and lives alone with her husband because her children are married.  

Doña Leo, as people affectionately call her, has been selling cosmetics, perfumes and items for the home via catalogue sales for the last 20 years.  She started the business to help her husband cover household expenses and she says that she enjoys it because she’s met lots of people that way that she sells her products to.  Besides, she’s been able to help a lot of people to have employment through the catalogue cosmetics sales business and this fills her with pride in her work.

Leonarda is asking for a loan to buy perfume, cosmetics, etc. that she has pending orders for from her customers and that she’s been unable to get for lack of capital to buy them and then resell to her customers.  Leo’s goal is to set up a stable locale because at her age it’s tiring to wander the streets offering her beauty products.

loans.use: to buy perfume and cosmetics.

loans.name: Lanuola

texts.en:
Lanuola is 37 years of age and married with one child. Lanuola owns and operates a business venture selling specialty food products in the local community.  She has one year of experience in this business.

Lanuola needs a loan of WST 1000 to purchase raw ingredients such as box of chicken leg quarters, sausages and meat and an oven and cooking utensils needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Lanuola joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Lanuola's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma tiene 38 años de edad y es casada y tiene dos hijos ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, se dedica a vender pollo destazado (en partes), tiene su puesto afuera de su casa desde hace tres años, dice que emprendió su negocio para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos que tiene con sus hijos ya que estudian la primaria y no le alcanza entonces ella decidió ayudarle. Doña Irma esta pidiendo un crédito a la financiera para  seguir invirtiendo en su negocio de pollo, ella compra los pollos vivos y los pela y vende en partes, los compra en granjas que se dedican a criar pollos cerca de su localidad. La meta que tiene doña Irma es hacer otro puesto en una localidad donde su esposo le ayude a vender el pollo, ella esta muy contenta con el préstamo que le están haciendo por que gracias a este les podrá dar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y con las ganancias podrá comprarles los útiles escolares para el nuevo ciclo escolar.
texts.en:
Irma, 38, is married and has two children.  She’s a very hardworking woman who sells chicken in pieces.  She’s has a stand outside her house for the last three years.  She says that she started the business to help her husband with expenses he had because her children are in elementary school and he did not have enough so she decided to help him.

Irma is asking for the loan to continue investing in her chicken shop.  She buys live chickens that she plucks and sells in pieces.  She buys them from local farms that raise chickens.

Irma’s goal is to open another stand where her husband can help her sell chicken.  She is very happy with the loan she’s getting because thanks to it she’ll be able to provide her children with a better quality of life and she will be able to use profits to buy them their school supplies for the new school term.

loans.use: to buy live chickens.

loans.name: Aliitasi

texts.en:
Aliitasi is 30 years of age and married with five children. Aliitasi owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  She has one year of experience in this business.  

Aliitasi needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Aliitasi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Aliitasi's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.es: La señora Adelina tiene 52 años de edad, esta casada y tiene dos hijos que dependen de ella, doña Adelina se dedica a vender ropa de dama, caballero y niños desde hace 3 años, ella surte su ropa en la población de Moroleón Guanajuato ya que en ese lugar le dan buenos precios ya que la mayoría de las personas de ahí se dedican a vender ropa. Ella esta pidiendo un crédito para comprar ropa para damas, caballeros y niños dice que comprara pantalones de mezclilla, playeras, calcetas, calcetines, playeras, blusas, pants y chamarras de todo un poco para toda la familia. Doña Adelina esta muy contenta por el crédito que le están haciendo por que tendrá muy bien surtido de ropa para vender y así sus clientes le compran mas ropa, ella sale a vender a diario en las calles de su localidad a gente que es muy cumplida para pagar ya que les vende la ropa en pagos. La meta que tiene Adelina es rentar un local en el centro de la población para vender la ropa ya que abecés se cansa por andar cargando las bolsas muy pesadas de ropa.
texts.en:
Adelina, 52, is married and has two dependent children. Adelina has been selling women’s, men’s and children’s clothes for three years.  She stocks up on clothes in the town of Moreleón, Guanajuato, because prices there are good and most of the people there are clothes merchants.

She is asking for the loan to buy women’s, men’s and children’s clothes.  She says that she’ll buy denim pants, t-shirts, socks, stockings, blouses, pants and jackets.  She’ll get a little bit of everything for everyone in the family.

Adelina is very happy for the loan she’s getting because she’ll have a very good assortment of clothes to sell and this way her customers will buy more clothes.  She goes out daily to sell her wares in the streets of her locality and people are very good about paying on time because she sells them the clothes in installment plans.  Adelina’s goal is to rent a place downtown to sell clothes because sometimes she gets tired lugging the very heavy bags of clothes around.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is 33 years of age and married with three children. Luisa owns & operates a business venture, baking & selling bread in the local community.  She has one year of experience in this business.
