Luisa needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase baking equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Luisa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Luisa's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase baking equipment.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: Angélica tiene 20 años de edad, ella esta casada y todavía  no tiene niños ya que quiere tener su casa propia y tener su negocio bien establecido para darles una buena calidad de vida, estudio hasta el tercer año de preparatoria y dice que ya no pudo continuar con sus estudios debido a que se caso muy jovencita y su esposo ya no la dejo estudiar. Ella tiene un puesto de ropa desde hace 3 años y esta pidiendo un crédito para volver a surtir ropa para dama, niños y caballeros como playeras, jeans, chamarras trajecitos para niños y dama también ahorita quiere invertir en calcetas para niña y ropa interior para niño ya que pronto se viene el ciclo escolar y para venderles a los papas el uniforme que ocupan los alumnos. Ella ira a surtir a la ciudad de Moroleón Guanajuato ya que en esa ciudad dan bajos precios en la ropa y eso le conviene a ella por que le podrá gran un poco  mas a lo que venda ella. Angélica sale a ofrecer la ropa a sus conocidas en sus casas ya que no tiene un puesto establecido y es el sueño de ella mas adelante hacer o rentar un local para vender su ropa.
texts.en:
Angélica is 20 years old and married.  She doesn’t have any children yet because she wants to own her own home and have her business established so she can give them a good quality of life.  She studied up to the third year in preparatory school and says that she couldn’t continue with her studies because she married very young and her husband didn’t let her study any longer.  

She has had a clothing stand for three years and is requesting the loan to restock women’s, children’s and men’s clothing such as t-shirts, jeans, jackets, and outfits for children and women.  At this time, though, she also wants to buy socks for little girls and underwear for little boys because the new school term is about to start and she wants to sell their parents items for the school uniforms the students need.  She will go to the city of Moroleón Guanajuato to stock up as this city offers low prices for clothing and is convenient for her because she will be able to earn a bit more profit when she resells.  Angélica will go out and offer her clothing to acquaintances in their homes because she doesn’t have an established stand.  Her dream is to later make or rent a store to sell her clothing.

loans.use: to buy and sell women's, men's, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Paraiso, tiene 62 años, tiene un puesto de abarrotes en el Mercado Vivanco,  el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en comprar mas mercadería para su puesto de abarrotes, aparte de eso Rosa reparte ropa, ella es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 4 años y le gusta mucho las reuniones de su Banco Comunal porque se relaja y aprende mucho.
texts.en: Rosa is a member of the “Paraíso” (Paradise) communal bank.  She’s 62 years old and has a grocery stand in the Vivanco Market.  The loan she’s requesting will be used to buy merchandise for her grocery stand.  Besides that, Rosa also sells clothes.  She’s been a member of FINCA Perú for the last four years and she likes the communal bank meeting quite a bit because she relaxes and learns a lot.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store at wholesale.

loans.name: Maria Sofia

texts.en:
Maria Sofia is 21 years of age and she is a single woman with no children. Maria Sofia owns & operates a business venture selling food products in the local community.  She has one year of experience in this business. Maria Sofia needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase new items to expand products in her shop.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Maria Sofia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Maria Sofia's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product range in her shop.

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es: FabioL. tiene 26 años D. edad, elL. no estudio debido a que es sordomuda D. nacimiento, por eso no pudo ir a L. escueL. por que no entendía lo que decían los maestros debido a su discapacidad. ElL. tiene un negocio D. venta D. abarrotes, primero empezó vendiendo dulces en su casa dice que los tenia en su ropero y se los vendía a sus sobrinitos y uno D. ellos le ayudaba a cobrar y a vender, después se puso una mesita fuera D. su casa y empezó a venderles a los niños D. su colonia y ahorita poco a poco a través D. los créditos que le a otorgado L. financiera a podido comprar y hacer su tiendita D. abarrotes en su cuarto. Comenta a través D. señas y gracias a su esposo que nos traduce lo que quiere tratar D. decirnos, que hace como un año se caso y que su esposo le ha ayudado a entender y ha como comunicarse con las personas. ElL. es una mujer muy trabajadora y pese a su discapacidad no ha sido un obstáculo para salir adelante,  doña FabioL. esta pidiendo un crédito a L. financiera para L. compra D. productos como jabón, huevo, azúcar, leche, aceite, frijol, etc. L. meta D. FabioL. es hacer un local especialmente para su tienda D. abarrotes ya que L. tienda L. tiene en su cuarto.
texts.en:
FabioL., 26, did not go to school because she’s been deaf and mute since birth.  Because of this she was unable to go to school because her disability kept her from understanding what the teachers were saying.

She has a business selling groceries.  She started out selling candy at first at home.  She says that she’d keep it in her closet and sell it to her little nieces and nephews and one of them would help her sell and collect payments.  Later on, she set up a small table in her front yard and started selling to the neighborhood children and now, little by little, thanks to the loans from the financial institution she’s been able to buy and set up her little store in a room.  She speaks through gestures and her husband translates for us what she tries to say which is that she got married about a year ago and her husband has helped her understand and to communicate with people.

She is a very hardworking woman whose disability has not been an obstacle for her to het ahead. FabioL. is asking the financial institution for a loan to buy products like soap, eggs, sugar, milk, oil, beans, etc.  FabioL.’s goal is to build a locale specifically for her store because she currently has it installed in her room.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Alma Rosa

texts.es: La señora Alma tiene 33 años de edad ella es originaria de una población rica en historia y donde muy cerca se encuentra varios santuarios de la mariposa monarca migrante de Canadá. Ella es una mujer constante y trabajadora dice que empezó a vender sus productos desde hace 3 años por que su esposo y ella pasaban por una crisis económica muy fuerte y ella decidió ayudarle con los gastos del hogar ya que tienen 2 hijos menores de edad los cuales estudian la primaria. Alma se dedica a vender productos de belleza por catalogo de diferentes marcas y esta pidiendo un crédito a la financiera para seguir surtiendo los productos como perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, trastes para la cocina etc. ella esta muy contenta por el préstamo que le están haciendo por que así podrá que ofrecerle a sus clientas ya que tiene muchos pedidos pendientes por hacer. La meta que tiene Alma Rosa es seguir en el negocio y mas adelante invertir en zapatos por catalogo y ropa.
texts.en:
Alma, 33, is from a town rich in history and that has nearby several sanctuaries for the monarch butterfly that migrates from Canada.

She is a very steadfast, hardworking woman who says she started selling her products three years ago because her husband and she were going through a severe economic crisis and she decided to help him with household expenses since they have two minor children going to elementary school.

Alma sells beauty products of various brands via catalogue and is asking the financial institution for a loan to continue to stock up on products like perfume, creams, cosmetics, kitchenware, etc.  

She is very happy with the loan she’s getting because she’ll be able to have stock for her customers since she already has several pending orders to fill.  Alma Rosa’s goal is to stay in business and later go into catalogue shoe and clothes sales.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Carmen Delpilar

texts.es:
La señora Carmen, es socia del banco comunal Las Colinas del Distrito Yarinacocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 41 años, está casada, tiene dos hijos y su esposo se desempeña como mecánico.
Lleva tres años trabajando con Manuela Ramos y se dedica a la venta de desayunos desde las 6 a las 10 am, una empleada le ayuda con la atención al cliente.
Con su nuevo préstamo de PEN 2,000.00 invierte en tres juegos de mesa y sillas para dar más comodidad a sus clientes, ademàs va a comprar platos tendidos, vasos, un balde para refresco y dos ollas medianas.
Con los ingresos que tiene puede ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del colegio de sus hijos y puede contribuir al bienestar de toda la familia.
Le gustan las sesiones educativas que reciben las socias de parte de las promotoras y agradece mucho a Manuela Ramos las oportunidades y todo lo que ha logrado hasta el momento.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the “Las Colinas del Distrito Yarinacocha” (The Hills of Yarinacocha District) in Ucayali Department.  She’s 41 years old, married and has two children.  Her husband works as a mechanic.

She’s been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for three years.  She sells breakfasts from 6am to 10am; she has an employee that helps with customer service.

She will use her new, PEN 2000, loan to buy three sets of dining tables and chairs to provide more comfort for her customers.  She will also buy flat dishes, glasses, a bucket for beverages and two medium pots.

With her income she’ll be able to help her husband with her children’s school expenses and contribute to the entire family’s wellbeing.

She likes the educational sessions the members get from their advisors and is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for the opportunities it has provided and for everything she’s accomplished to date.

loans.use: to buy sets of dining tables and chairs, dishes, glasses and pots.

loans.name: Jarintzi

texts.es: Jarintzi tiene 23 años de edad ella actualmente estudia la universidad en la ciudad de Morelia Michoacán, es soltera y aparte de ser estudiante ella vende cosméticos y zapatos por catalogo desde hace 2 años  y dice que emprendió su negocio para ayudar a sus papas con los gastos de la escuela ya que sus libros que ocupa son un poco caros y también para pagar los gastos personales que tiene. Jary como de cariño le dicen sus conocidos esta pidiendo un crédito para la compra de productos de belleza y zapatos que sus clientas le han encargado, uno de sus sueños de Jari es terminar su carrera y mas adelante tener un negocio de venta de zapatos, ropa y accesorios para dama.
texts.en:
Jarintzi, 23, is attending university in Morelia, Michoacán.  She’s single and besides being a student she’s sold cosmetics and shoes via catalogue for the last two years.  She says she started the business to help her parents with her school costs because the textbooks she needs are a bit expensive and also to pay for her personal expenses.

Jary, like her acquaintances affectionately call her, is asking for a loan to buy beauty products and shoes that her customers have ordered from her.  One of Jari’s dreams is to complete her career and later on have a business selling shoes, clothes and women’s accessories.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and shoes.

loans.name: Mavaega

texts.en:
Mavaega is 53 years of age and married with seven children. Mavaega owns & operates a business venture, selling food products in the local community.  She has one year of experience in this business.  Mavaega needs a loan of WST $1950 to purchase new items to expand products to be sold in her shop.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Mavaega joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Mavaega's 3rd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand range of products to be sold in her shop.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es: Candelaria de 39 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con su cónyuge y su hijo de dos meses de nacido. Allí tiene un negocio de Papelería y miscelanea, que inició para apoyar con ingresos el bienestar de su hogar y hoy se ha convertido en su proyecto de vida. En su negocio Candelaria vende detalles para el hogar, útiles de papelería y otras mercancías. Su experiencia data desde el año 1996 en su antiguo barrio donde habitaba, y del que una vez posicionada, debió mudarse e instalar su negocio en un espacio de la nueva casa de su madre, donde le ha ido muy bien y ahora tiene planes de crecimiento, mediante financiamientos, como el credikiva, que es el primer crédito que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará detalles para la temporada de amor amistad que se acerca y  es la época en que sus ventas repuntan todo el mes de Septiembre, por efecto de esta celebración. Candelaria vende en su negocio de contado principalmente, por eso sus cuentas por cobrar son bajas y este es el primer crédito que hace a una organización, con la cual iniciará su historial crediticio. Su sueño es tener una papelería de gran tamaño con servicios adicionales como fotocopiaje, transcripción de documentos etc; pero su gran desafío es cumplir con su sueño y por eso trabaja persistentemente con tal de alcanzar sus metas
texts.en:
Candelaria, 39, lives in the city of Cartagena with her spouse and her son, born two months ago. There she has a stationery store which she began in order to generate income to help with household expenses and that has now become her life’s work. 

In her business, Candelaria sells particulars for the home, stationary accessories and other merchandise. Her experience dates from the year 1996 in the old neighborhood she lived in and from which, once situated, she had to move to set up her business in a space in her mother’s new house. There, it has done very well. She now plans to expand through financing, such as this kiva loan, which is the first loan she has had from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.

She will use the loan to buy particulars for the season of love and friendship that is approaching, which is the time when, during September, her sales begin to rise, due to the coming festivities.

Candelaria’s business sales are principally in cash, consequently her accounts receivable are low. This is her first loan request to an organization and with it she will initiate her credit history. 

Her dream is to have a large stationary store with additional services such as photocopying, document transcription, etc., but her great challenge is to fulfill her dream. For this reason, she is working persistently to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy particulars, such as home accessories, stationary and other merchandise for the coming season of love and friendship.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise that he sells the most of, like women's accessories, clothing, cosmetics, and perfume

loans.name: Abelardo Antonio

texts.es:
Abelardo, de 43 años de edad, esta casado, es padre de tres hijos , el se dedica a vender billetes de lotería , lleva 4 años en este negocio. El se inicio en este negocio debido a que su padre enfermo el tuvo que asumir el negocio en ese entonces el tenia 38 años de edad, antes de este negocio el se dedicaba a la venta de helados y refrescos de manera ambulante actividad que todavía realiza solo los fines de semana. 
Solicito el préstamo para comprar billetes de lotería y raspaditas. El espera poder vender más billetes al ofrecer más numeraciones de lotería. Su meta próxima es comprarse una moto para agilizarse mas rápido y vender sus billetes de lotería. En lo futuro  a el le gustaría vender el premio mayor de lotería y así poder comprarse una finca.
texts.en:
Abelardo, 43, is married and the father of three children.  He sells lottery tickets.  He’s been in this business for four years.  He started in this business because his father became ill and he had to take over the business.  Back then he was 38 years old.  Prior to this business he was an ice-cream and soft-drink vendor, something he still does but only on weekends.

He asked for the loan to buy lottery tickets and Scratch-Offs.  He hopes to be able to sell more tickets by having more numbers available.  His next goal is to buy a motorcycle to get around more quickly and sell his lottery tickets.  In the future, he’d like to sell the grand prize ticket and be able to buy himself a farm.

loans.use: To buy lottery tickets and Scratch-Offs.

loans.name: La Milagrosa Group

texts.es:
El comité denominado La milagrosa es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, cuenta actualmente con 14 integrantes, donde todas ellas trabajan dentro de un ambiente de cooperación y mutuo respeto. Han pasado un intenso trabajo por lo que han crecido tanto social como económicamente, son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras.
La señora Romina tiene una mercería, allí vende todo tipo de productos, como ser frazadas, edredones, ropas, calzados, artículos para regalos y demás artículos. Comenta que mediante este negocio ella ha podido salir adelante, generando los recursos necesarios para mantener a su familia y darles de esa forma una vida digna y decorosa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de los artículos que vende en su negocio, como ser frazadas, sabanas, artículos para regalos y demás. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda, pues de tener el crédito le será de mucha ayuda en los proyectos que tiene.
texts.en:
The La Milagrosa Communal Bank is from the city of San Lorenzo.  It currently has 14 members, all of whom work in an environment of cooperation and mutual respect.  They have worked extremely hard, which has led to their social and economical growth.  They are recognized locally as very hardworking women.

Romina has a notions store where she sells all kinds of things, like blankets, comforters, clothes, shoes, gifts, and other items.  She remarks that this business has allowed her to get ahead by generating the income she needs to support her family and give them a decent, respectable life.  

She is asking for a loan to buy the items she sells in her store, such as blankets, sheets, gift items, and the like.  She thanks Fundación Paraguaya for providing her with this opportunity, as getting the loan will help her greatly with her plans.

loans.use: to buy sheets, blankets, gift items, and the like

loans.name: Yulissa

texts.es: Yulissa es socia del Banco Comunal Paraiso, tiene 34 años, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en su recreo (lugar campestre para eventos), es socia de FINCA Peru hace 2 años y recuerda que antes vendía comida en su casa, ahora ella se compró un terreno y su meta es poder construir para poder tener una instalación mas adecuada para su Recreo y eventos. Da gracias a Finca por todo lo que le han enseñado en su Banco Comunal.
texts.en: Yulissa is a member of the “Paraíso” (Paradise) communal bank.  She’s 34 years old and asked for the loan to invest in her “Recreo” (a place in the countryside for events).  She’s been a FINCA Perú member for two years and reminds us that she used to sell food at home but now she bought a piece of land and her goal is to be able to build on it to have a more adequate installation for her recreo and for events.  She thanks Finca for all they’ve taught her in her communal bank.

loans.use: to do some building improvements.

loans.name: Martha Luz

texts.es: Martha Luz de 45 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 4 a 14 años. Allí tiene un negocio llamado “Confecciones Aldescu”, que inició desde hace 10 años, como una alternativa de ingresos para apoyar la gestión de su hogar y complementar los gastos que hasta el momento estaban a cargo solamente de su esposo. Muy pronto su negocio que nació de una manera doméstica ofreciendo el servicio de costura, fue creciendo y ya sus clientes no  le llevaban solo las telas e insumos para obtener un vestido sobre medidas, sino que ella lo fabricaba a todo costo  y  también exhibía las prendas por tallas; gradualmente fue agregando mercancías como cosméticos, labiales, perfumes entre otras y sus ventas se incrementaron. En la actualidad aprovecha las épocas en las cuales repuntan sus ventas, surtiendo su negocio de lo que conoce que sus clientes requieren. Esta es la razón por la cual solicita su credikiva, primer financiamiento que  hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materias primas para fabricar vestidos, perfumería, cosméticos, calzado entre otros artículos, pues se acerca el día del amor y de la amistad y aprovechará para hacer su gran venta.  Porque su sueño es tener un local amplio para ubicar su taller, generando empleos y posicionado en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Martha Luz is 45 years old and lives in the city of Cartagena with her husband and three children who range in age from 4 to 14. There she has a business called “Confecciones Aldescu”, which she started 10 years ago as a way to help support her household and cover some of the expenses since only her husband was contributing at the time. Soon after her business was started, she began offering sewing services from her home. Her business grew, but her customers did not provide her with the fabrics and supplies that she needed to make a particular dress, so she began producing at all costs and also started exhibiting dresses of different sizes. Martha gradually acquired more merchandise such as cosmetics, lipsticks, perfumes, and other items so that she could increase her sales. At the moment, she is taking advantage of the time of year when her sales rebound by stocking her business with products that she knows her customers will need.

For this reason Martha is requesting a Kiva loan, her first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the money to buy raw materials for making dresses, as well as perfumes, cosmetics, shoes, and other items in time for the Day of Love and Friendship (the Colombian equivalent to Valentine’s Day). Martha will take advantage of this time to make many sales. Her dream is to have a larger space where she can relocate her workshop so that she can create jobs and position herself within the community.

loans.use: to purchase sewing materials, perfumes, cosmetics, shoes, and other items.

loans.name: Felix Obtavio

texts.es:
Félix Obtavio  tiene 37 años de edad, vive en unión libre junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos de 11 y 7 años en el Cantón Pueblo Viejo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS  se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Marañón por la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo,  esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol.

Félix se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Compra sus productos en Comercial  Agro insumos Karlita y los vende en el comercial Castillo.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y fréjol compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es incrementar el negocio.

Le gusta practicar el deporte y escuchar música.
texts.en:
Félix Obtavio is 37 and lives with his common-law wife and their two children, ages 11 and 7, in Pueblo Viejo Canton.

The members of the Unidos Somos Communal Bank are located in the Marañón area of Puerto Pechiche Parish in Pueblo Viejo Canton.  This solidarity group works in short-growth cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice, and beans.

Félix works in agriculture, planting corn, rice, and beans.  He buys his products from Comercial Agroinsumos Karlita and sells them in Comercial Castillo.

He is requesting the loan to plant corn, rice, and beans, and to buy supplies and fertilizer for the crops.  The support from the loan would help him economically to supplement his needs in confronting challenges like disease, illness, and changes in the weather.  His dream is to expand the business.

Félix likes to play sports and listen to music.

loans.use: to plant corn, rice, and beans, and to buy supplies and fertilizer for the crops.

loans.name: Taliuta

texts.en:
Taliuta is 29 and married with two children. Taliuta owns & operates a business venture, raising pigs for sale.  She has one year of experience in this business.  Taliuta needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Taliuta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Taliuta's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.

loans.name: Santiago Leonardo

texts.es:
Santiago Leonardo tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero vive con los padres en el Cantón Pueblo Viejo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS  se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Marañón por la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo,  esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol.

Santiago se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Compra sus productos en Comercial  Agro insumos Karlita y los vende en el comercial Castillo.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y fréjol compra de insumos, abonos y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es incrementar el negocio.

Le gusta practicar el deporte en especial el indor.
texts.en:
Santiago Leonardo is 23 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the canton of Pueblo Viejo.

The members of the Communal Bank “Unido Somos” (We Are United) meet in the neighborhood of El Marañón in the parish of Puerto Pechiche, which is part of the canton of Pueblo Viejo. The Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn, rice, and beans.

Santiago is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and beans. He buys his supplies at the Agro Karlita Commercial Center and sells his products at the Castillo Commercial Market.

Santiago is requesting a loan for planting corn, rice, and beans. He plans to buy farming supplies, composts, and fertilizers for his crops. With the financial support of this loan, he will be able to purchase what he needs. Among the challenges he faces are pests, diseases, and changes in weather. His dream is to increase his business.

Santiago enjoys practicing sports, especially indoor soccer.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies, composts, and fertilizers for his crops.

loans.name: Rodrigo Salomon

texts.es:
El señor Rodrigo es soltero y tiene 29 años. Se dedica a la confección de prendas de toda clase. Él se dedica a este trabajo hace ya mucho tiempo, pues lo aprendió de sus padres que se dedican a los mismo. Hace aproximadamente 4 años pudo adquirir su propia máquina de coser y así aumentar la producción de la familia como también independizarse un poco más y obtener mayor ganancia.
El se define como un joven muy trabajador, lleno de creatividad e invensión, tiene muchos planes que le gustaría cumplir en un futuro no muy lejano. Dentro de sus metas está tener un propio taller de costura donde pueda el mismo abrirse camino al mercado y tener aun un margen más amplio de ganancias.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, que es el insumo fundamental que utiliza en su taller de costura, además de eso quiere comprar agujas e hilos, también a ser utilizados dentro del taller.
texts.en:
Sr. Rodrigo is 29 years old and single. He produces all types of clothing. Rodrigo has been in this trade for a long time since he learned from his parents, who are in the same profession. Approximately four years ago, he acquired his own sewing machine so that he could help his family increase production. He also does some work on his own in order to earn more income.

Rodrigo defines himself as a hardworking young man who is full of creativity and invention. He has many plans that he would like to accomplish in the not-too-distant future. Among his goals are to have his own sewing workshop so that he can gain entrance into the marketplace and increase his profit margin.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy fabrics, an essential supply used in his workshop. In addition, he wants to buy needles and thread since these items are also used in his work.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, needles, and thread.

loans.name: María Jesús

texts.es: María es socia del Banco Comunal Paraiso, tiene 38 años y 2 hijos, su negocio es un Bar- Restaurante, el prñestamo que solicita lo invertirá en su negocio, es socia de FINCA Peru hace 1 año y le gusta mucho por el apoyo que le brindan y además de todo lo que puede aprender aquí, ella empezó siendo ayudante de cocina, mecera, y así pudo aprender y ahorra para tener su propio Restaurante, ahora la meta que tiene es poder tener una Ferretería.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Communal Bank “Paraiso” (Paradise). She is 38 years old and has two children. María owns a bar and restaurant, so she is requesting a loan to invest in her business. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for one year and greatly enjoys the support that she has received. In addition, she has learned much since joining the organization. María started out as a kitchen assistant and waitress, but she was able to learn and save up money to have her own restaurant.

Now her goal is to open a hardware store.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stationery, Valentine and friendship cards, sandals, accessories, and other products that have high turnover.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María Elena tiene 37 años de edad vive en unión libre junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de once y siete años de edad en el Cantón Pueblo Viejo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Marañón por la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo,  esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol.

María se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Compra sus productos en Comercial  Agro insumos Karlita y los vende en el comercial Castillo.
Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz,arroz y fréjol compra de semillas, insumos, abonos y fertilizantes, urea, líquidos para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos fuera de las plagas. 

Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es incrementar el negocio y poderse comprar una moto.
Le gusta bailar y compartir momentos agradables con su familia.
texts.en:
María Elena is 37 years old and lives with her common-law husband and two children (ages 11 and 7) in the canton of Pueblo Viejo.

The members of the Communal Bank “Unido Somos” (We Are United) meet in the neighborhood of El Marañón in the parish of Puerto Pechiche, which is part of the canton of Pueblo Viejo. The Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn, rice, and beans.

María is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and beans. She buys her supplies at the Agro Karlita Commercial Center and sells her products at the Castillo Commercial Market.

María is requesting a loan for planting corn, rice, and beans. She plans to buy seeds, compost, farming supplies, and fertilizers for her crops.

With the financial support of this loan, she will be able to purchase what she needs. Among the challenges she faces are pests, diseases, and changes in weather. Her dream is to increase her business so that she can buy a motorcycle.  

María Elena enjoys dancing and sharing pleasant moments with her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and supplies to maintain her crops in good condition

loans.name: Susana Eufemia

texts.es:
Susana Eufemia tiene 30 años de edad vive en unión libre junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de seis y un año de edad en el Cantón Pueblo Viejo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS  se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Marañón por la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo,  esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol.

Susana se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Compra sus productos en Comercial  Agro insumos Karlita y los vende en el comercial Castillo.
Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y fréjol compra de semillas, insumos, abonos y fertilizantes para los cultivos. 

Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es poder comprarse una casa y tierra para poder aumentar el negocio.

Le gusta bailar y el deporte en especial el índor.
texts.en:
Susana Eufemia is 30 years old and lives with her common-law husband and two children (ages 6 and 1) in the canton of Pueblo Viejo.

The members of the Communal Bank “Unido Somos” (We Are United) meet in the neighborhood of El Marañón in the parish of Puerto Pechiche, which is part of the canton of Pueblo Viejo. The Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn, rice, and beans.

Susana is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and beans. She buys her supplies at the Agro Karlita Commercial Center and sells her products at the Castillo Commercial Market.

Susana is requesting a loan for planting corn, rice, and beans. She plans to buy seeds, farming supplies, composts, and fertilizers for her crops.

With the financial support of this loan, she will be able to purchase what she needs. Among the challenges she faces are pests, diseases, and changes in weather. Her dream is to buy a house and land so that she can increase her business.

Susana enjoys dancing and sports, especially indoor soccer.

loans.use: to buy seeds, farming supplies, composts, and fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase perfumes in bulk.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
El señor Lucio tiene 56 años, está casado con la señora Pastora de 53 años, tienen 3 hijos, un varón de 23 años que trabaja con ellos como encargado de la venta de sus productos y está cursando el último año de la carrera de Administración de Empresas, y dos hijas, una de 19 años que esta cursando el primer año de Psicología y otra de 16 que esta realizando sus estudios secundarios.
Él cliente se dedica a la confección de uniformes para empresas y colegios, confecciones en Ao Po'i y remeras, camisas, pantalones y camperas. Comenta que le va muy bien en su negocio, puesto que gracias a esto ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia y darles una vida y educación decorosa. Desea poder seguir ampliándose y ganar aún más mercado.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos e insumos en forma mayorista, de esa manera estaría abaratando el costo de sus productos y obtendría mayor ganancia por la venta de los mismos.
texts.en:
Sr. Lucio is 56 years old and married to Sra. Pastora, age 53. They have three children, a son and two daughters. His 23-year-old son works with him and is in charge of selling his products. He is also finishing his last year of study toward in a degree in Business Administration. One of his daughters is 19 years old and in her first year of study toward a degree in Psychology. His other daughter is a 16-year-old high school student.

Lucio produces uniforms for businesses and schools. He also manufactures garments made of “Ao Po'i” (a cotton cloth that is unique to Paraguay) as well as t-shirts, shirts, trousers, and jackets. He says that he has done very well in his business. As a result, he has been able to move his family forward and provide them a decent life and an education. He wants to continue expanding and acquiring more market share.

Lucio is requesting a loan to buy fabrics, thread, and supplies in bulk. He will be able to save on the cost of these products, thereby allowing him to generate more profit from his sales.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, and supplies in bulk for making uniforms and other garments.

loans.name: Nella

texts.en:
Nella is 52 years of age and married with one child. She owns and operates a business, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has 7 years of experience in this business. Nella needs a loan of WST 1250 to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $129 per week) to improve her family's general living conditions.

Nella joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Nella's 6th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Josefa Johanna

texts.es:
Josefa Johanna tiene 28 años de edad vive en unión libre junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos de doce, diez y un año de edad en el Cantón Pueblo Viejo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS  se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Marañón por la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo,  esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol.

Josefa se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Compra sus productos en Comercial  Agro insumos Karlita y los vende en el comercial Castillo.
Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y fréjol compra de semillas, insumos, urea y  abonos agrícolas, fertilizantes líquidos  para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos. 

Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima.

 Su sueño es poder comprarse una finca para poder aumentar el negocio y tener mayores utilidades. Le gusta practicar el en especial el índor.
texts.en:
Josefa Johanna is 28 years old and lives with her common-law husband and three children (ages 12, 10, and 1) in the canton of Pueblo Viejo.

The members of the Communal Bank “Unido Somos” (We Are United) meet in the neighborhood of El Marañón in the parish of Puerto Pechiche, which is part of the canton of Pueblo Viejo. The Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn, rice, and beans.

Josefa is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and beans. She buys her supplies at the Agro Karlita Commercial Center and sells her products at the Castillo Commercial Market.

Josefa is requesting a loan for planting corn, rice, and beans. She plans to buy seeds, urea, compost, farming supplies, and liquid fertilizers for her crops.

With the financial support of this loan, she will be able to purchase what she needs. Among the challenges she faces are pests, diseases, and changes in weather. Her dream is to buy a farm so that she can increase her business and have more profits.

Josefa enjoys practicing sports, especially indoor soccer.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, compost, farming supplies, and liquid fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Azucena

texts.es:
Doña Azucena, originaria de la ciudad de Granada, tiene 54 años de edad, es madre de tres hijos, es comerciante se dedica ala venta de ropa. Ella inicio vendiendo poca mercadería tales como trajes para niños, ropa interior, luego que tuvo un año de iniciado su negocio, hizo un préstamo que le ayudo a incrementar su mercadería y vender un poco mas ella vio buenos resultado así que decidió continuar. 
Requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería y surtir su negocio de nuevos productos. Con esta inversión de capital espera poder vender mas, hacer mas clientes y mejorar sus ingresos. Su próxima meta es hacerle reparaciones a su local para hacerlo mas seguro.
texts.en:
Doña Azucena is originally from the city of Granada. She is 54 years old and the mother of three children. Azucena is a merchant who sells clothing. She started out selling a few items such as children’s outfits and undergarments. A year into her business, she took out a loan to help increase her inventory. She began selling a little more and saw good results, so she decided to continue in this manner.

Azucena is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise so that she can restock her business with new products. With this investment of capital she hopes to sell more, attract more customers, and improve her earnings. Her next goal is to make repairs to her shop to make it more secure.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise so that she can restock her business with new products.

loans.name: Kuini

texts.en:
Kuini is 25 years of age and married with two children. She owns and operates a business planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business.  Kuini needs a loan of WST 1000 to purchase weed killers.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Kuini joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Kuini's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed killers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy men's and women's sweaters and men's overalls.

loans.name: Alicia Yisenia

texts.es:
Alicia Yisenia tiene 35 años de edad vive en unión libre junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos de catorce,  trece y ocho años de edad en el  Cantón Pueblo Viejo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS  se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Marañón por la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo,  esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol.

Alicia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Compra sus productos en Comercial  Agro insumos Karlita y los vende en el comercial Castillo.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y fréjol compra de semillas, urea,  insumos y  abonos agrícolas, fertilizantes líquidos  para los cultivos. 

Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima.

 Su sueño es poder agrandar la casa que tiene  para poder vivir  mejor y cómoda con la familia .En su  tiempo libre le gusta escuchar música mientras se ocupa de los quehaceres de la casa.
texts.en:
Alicia Yisenia is 35 years old and lives with her common-law husband and three children (ages 14, 13, and 8) in the canton of Pueblo Viejo.

The members of the Communal Bank “Unido Somos” (We Are United) meet in the neighborhood of El Marañón in the parish of Puerto Pechiche, which is part of the canton of Pueblo Viejo. The Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn, rice, and beans.

Alicia is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and beans. She buys her supplies at the Agro Karlita Commercial Center and sells her products at the Castillo Commercial Market.

Alicia is requesting a loan for planting corn, rice, and beans. She plans to buy seeds, urea, compost, farming supplies, and liquid fertilizers for her crops.

With the financial support of this loan, she will be able to purchase what she needs. Among the challenges she faces are pests, diseases, and changes in weather. Her dream is to expand her house so that she can live better and more comfortably along with her family.

During her free time, Alicia enjoys listening to music while she is busy with the household chores.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, compost, farming supplies, and liquid fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Sii Elizabeth

texts.en:
Sii is 37 years of age and married with four children. Sii owns & operates a business planting & harvesting taro for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business.  Sii needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Sii joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Sii's fifth loan with SPBD. The reason why she restart her loan from ST$1000 because she was resting for a while.

loans.use: to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Sra. Elizabeth pertenece al Banco Comunal “Noche de Luna II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y  Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 27 años y un hijo de un año. Se dedica a la venta de  cosméticos de diferentes líneas de productos de belleza y cuenta con una clientela fija. Además posede un motocarro que le permite a ofrecer transportes dentro de la cuidad. Ambas actividades le generan muchas ganancias. 
El nuevo préstamo de PEN 2,500.00 lo utilizará para el mantenimiento de las llantas de su vehículo motorizado quiere comprar más cosméticos y tener en stock: como colonias, perfumes talcos, desodorantes. Elizabeth es una  mujer trabajadora, su sueño es tener algún día su restaurante con comidas criollas y una tienda con alquiler de motocarros. Está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de poder mejorar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de su vida y esta de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Elizabeth is a member of the Communal Bank “Noche de Luna II” (Night of the Moon II) which is located in the District of Tarapoto, Province and Department of San Martín. She is 27 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has a one-year-old son. Elizabeth sells cosmetics from different beauty product lines and has an established customer base. In addition, she owns a motorcar for providing transportation services around the city. Both of these activities generate plenty of income.

This new loan of 2500 PEN will be used to pay for maintenance, such as tires for her vehicle. Elizabeth also wants to buy more cosmetics to add to her inventory such as colognes, perfumes, talcum powders, and deodorants. She is a hardworking woman. Her dream is to someday open a restaurant that serves Creole dishes and a shop for renting out motorcars. Elizabeth is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping women like her to have opportunities to earn more income and to improve the quality of life of their families.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of her vehicle and to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Karina Silvana

texts.es:
Karina Silvana tiene 22 años de edad es casada vive con el esposo y con su hijo de dos años en el Cantón Pueblo Viejo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS  se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Marañón por la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo,  esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol.

Karina se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Compra sus productos en Comercial  Agro insumos Karlita y los vende en el comercial Castillo.
Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y fréjol compra de semillas, urea,  insumos y  abonos agrícolas, fertilizantes líquidos  para los cultivos. 

Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima.

 Su sueño es poder agrandar y comprarse una finca para poder trabajar  mejor y mejorar su economía para bienestar de la familia  .En su  tiempo libre le gusta escuchar música y practicar el deporte en especial el basketh
texts.en:
Karina Silvana is 22 years old, married, and lives with her husband and two-year-old son in the Canton Pueblo Viejo.

The members of the Communal Bank “Unido Somos” (We Are United) meet in the neighborhood of El Marañón in the parish of Puerto Pechiche, which is part of the canton of Pueblo Viejo. The Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn, rice, and beans.

Karina is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and beans. She buys her supplies at the Agro Karlita Commercial Center and sells her products at the Castillo Commercial Market.

Karina is requesting a loan for planting corn, rice, and beans. She plans to buy seeds, urea, compost, farming supplies, and liquid fertilizers for her crops.

With the financial support of this loan, she will be able to purchase what she needs. Among the challenges she faces are pests, diseases, and changes in weather. Her dream is to expand by purchasing a farm so that she can do better work and improve the financial well-being of her family.

During her free time, Karina enjoys listening to music and practicing sports, especially basketball.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, compost, farming supplies, and liquid fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Sueana

texts.en:
Sueana is 61 years of age and married with five children. Sueana owns & operates a business venture catching & selling ocean-caught fish .  She has many years of experience in this business. Sueana needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase an additional fishing net to replace the old one and fishing equipments. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Sueana  joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Sueana 's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase an additional fishing net to replace the old one and fishing equipment

loans.name: Hanamoa

texts.en:
Hanamoa is 45 years of age and married with three children. Hanamoa owns & operates a business venture, baking & selling a variety of baked goods in the local community.  She has many years of experience in this business.  Hanamoa needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase baking equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Hanamoa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Hanamoa's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase baking equipment

loans.name: Monica Narcisa

texts.es:
Mónica Narcisa tiene 33 años de edad vive en unión libre con el esposo y con los tres hijos de doce, nueve, un año de edad en el Cantón Pueblo Viejo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS  se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Marañón por la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo,  esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol.

Mónica se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Compra sus productos en Comercial  Agro insumos Kar ita y los vende en el comercial Castillo.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y fréjol y comprar semillas, urea,  insumos y  abonos agrícolas, fertilizantes líquidos  para los cultivos. 

Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima.

 Su sueño es poder comprarse maquinaria para poder tratar y trabajar el terreno. En su  tiempo libre le gusta dedicarse a los quehaceres de la casa.
texts.en:
Mónica Narcisa is 33 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their three children (ages 12, 9, and 1) in the canton of Pueblo Viejo.

The members of the Communal Bank “Unido Somos” (We Are United) meet in the neighborhood of El Marañón in the parish of Puerto Pechiche, which is part of the canton of Pueblo Viejo. The Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn, rice, and beans.

Mónica is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and beans. She buys her supplies at the Agro Karlita Commercial Center and sells her products at the Castillo Commercial Market.

Mónica is requesting a loan for planting corn, rice, and beans. She plans to buy seeds, urea, compost, farming supplies, and liquid fertilizers for her crops.

With the financial support of this loan, she will be able to purchase what she needs. The challenges she faces include pests, diseases, and changes in weather.

Her dream is to buy machinery so that she can treat and work the land. During her free time, Mónica enjoys performing the household chores.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, compost, farming supplies, and liquid fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Tasileta

texts.en:
Tasileta is 52 years of age and married with eight children. Tasileta owns & operates a business venture selling lavalavas (bottom-half wrap-around prints worn by both men and women).  She has many years of experience in this business.  Tasileta needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Tasileta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Tasileta's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bedspreads, bed sheets, towels, and lingerie.

loans.name: Faatutu

texts.en:
Faatutu is 33 years of age and married with four children. Faatutu owns & operates a business venture selling BBQ.  She has many years of experience in this business. Faatutu needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase additional products to sell such as chicken leg quarters, sausages, mutton, tomato sauce and plastic plates.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Faatutu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Faatutu's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as chicken leg quarters, sausages, mutton, tomato sauce and plastic plates.

loans.name: Amalia Rufina

texts.es:
Amalia Rufina tiene 59 años de edad es casada vive con el esposo y con sus dos hijos de treinta y ocho, treinta años en el Cantón Pueblo Viejo perteneciente a Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS  se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Marañón por la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo,  esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol.

Amalia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Compra sus productos en Comercial  Agro insumos Karlita y los vende en el comercial Castillo.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y fréjol y comprar semillas, urea,  insumos y  abonos agrícolas, fertilizantes líquidos  para los cultivos. 

Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima.

 Su sueño es poder comprarse un terreno para sembrar y poder producir mucho más  . En su  tiempo libre le gusta dedicarse a los quehaceres de la casa.
texts.en:
Amalia Rufina is 59 years old and married.  She lives with her husband and two children, ages thirty-eight and thirty, in the Canton Pueblo Viejo, part of the Ventanas Provincia de los Rios. 

The members of the V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS (We are united) are located in El Marañón district in the Puerto Pechiche parish, which belongs to the Canton Pueblo Viejo.  Members of this group work in agriculture, cultivating crops with short growing seasons: corn, rice, and beans.

Amalia works in agriculture, planting corn, rice and beans.  She buys her products in the farming supply store Karlita and sells in the Castillo store. 

She requests the loan in order to plant more corn, rice, and beans and to purchase seeds, urea, supplies, and natural and liquid fertilizers for her crops. 

The support of the loan would allow her to meet her financial needs, facing challenges such as plagues and diseases and the variability of the weather.

Her dream is to be able to purchase land in order to plant and produce much more.  In her free time, she likes to take care of household tasks.

loans.use: to plant corn, rice, and beans and purchase seeds, urea, supplies, and natural and chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials and supplies in bulk and to remodel the physical infrastructure of his business.

loans.name: Rosaura Cristina

texts.es:
Rosaura Cristina tiene 31 años de edad es casada vive con el esposo y sus dos hijos de once y nueve años de edad en el Cantón Pueblo Viejo perteneciente a Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS  se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Marañón por la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo,  esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol.
Rosaura se dedica a la agricultura a la 
siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Compra sus productos en Comercial  Agro insumos Karlita y los vende en el comercial Castillo.
Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y fréjol y comprar semillas, urea,  insumos y  abonos agrícolas, fertilizantes líquidos  para los cultivos.

Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima con la ayuda del crédito será más fácil para adquirir los insumos.
 Su sueño es poder comprarse un terreno para sembrar y poder producir mucho más. En su  tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Rosaura Cristina is 31 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and two children, ages 11 and 9, in the Pueblo Viejo canton, which is in Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.

The UNIDO SOMOS (We Are United) communal bank is located in the El Marañón precinct of Puerto Pechiche parish, which is in Pueblo Viejo canton. This communal bank works in agriculture, sowing corn, rice and beans on the short growth cycle (less than six months).

Rosaura works in agriculture, growing corn, rice and beans. She buys her products at the Karlita agricultural supply center and sells at Castillo shopping center. She is asking for the loan to sow corn, rice and beans and to buy seeds, urea, farm supplies and organic and liquid fertilizers for the crops.

The loan will give Rosaura the financial help to provide for her needs. Facing challenges like pests, diseases, and weather changes will be easier with the loan's help because she will be able to buy the supplies she needs.

Rosaura's dream is to buy land that she can plant and produce much more. She likes to play sports in her free time.

loans.use: to sow corn, rice and beans and to buy seeds, urea, farm supplies, compost and fertilizers.

loans.name: Belgica Raquel

texts.es:
Bélgica Raquel tiene 34 años de edad es casada vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos de diecisiete y quince años de edad en el Cantón Pueblo Viejo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS  se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Marañón por la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo,  esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y fréjol y comprar semillas, urea,  insumos y  abonos agrícolas, fertilizantes líquidos  para los cultivos.

Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima con la ayuda del crédito será más fácil para adquirir los insumos.
 Su sueño es poder comprarse una finca. En su  tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte.

Bélgica Raquel is 34 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and two children, ages 17 and 15, in the Pueblo Viejo canton.

The UNIDO SOMOS (We Are United) communal bank is located in the El Marañón precinct of Puerto Pechiche parish, which is in the Pueblo Viejo canton. This communal bank works in agriculture, sowing corn, rice and beans on the short growth cycle (less than six months).

Bélgica works in agriculture, growing corn, rice and beans. She buys her products at the Karlita agricultural supply center and sells at Castillo shopping center. She is asking for the loan to sow corn, rice and beans and to buy seeds, urea, farm supplies and organic and liquid fertilizers for the crops.

The loan will give Rosaura the financial help to provide for her needs. Facing challenges like pests, diseases, and weather changes will be easier with the loan's help because she will be able to buy the supplies she needs.

Her dream is to buy her own farm. She likes to play sports in her free time.

loans.use: to sow corn, rice and beans and to buy seeds, urea, farm supplies and organic and liquid fertilizers.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es: Delfina de 57 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Cartagena y tiene una remontadora de calzado, negocio que inició hace más de 10 años, inicialmente ubicado en el centro de la ciudad y el estado la apoyó para dejar de ser ambulante y organizarse comprando maquinarias, con las que fabrica hoy calzado especialmente sandalias, últimamente adicionó otro negocio de vender dulces para aumentar sus ingresos, aprovechando la clientela doméstica que la visita. Su sueño es ampliarlo y necesita responder al desafío de acceder a un nuevo capital de trabajo, para lograr invertir en materiales e insumos para fabricar nuevos diseños y agregar mayor surtido de dulcería, su inversión tendrá éxito pues solo existen 2 remontadoras incluyendo la de ella y no son suficientes para la demanda de este gran sector. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con la cual inicia su camino ascendente, hacia el logro de sus propósitos.
texts.en:
Delfina is 57 years old and lives in the city of Cartagena. She has a shoe shop that she started more than 10 years ago. Her business was initially located in the central part of the city. The government provided her support so that she could become a street vendor and purchase machines for producing the shoes that she offers today, especially sandals. Lately she started another business selling candy so that she could increase her income, thereby taking advantage of the local customers who visit her. Her dream is to expand her business, but she needs to respond to the challenge of accessing a new source of operating capital. This would allow her to invest in materials and supplies for producing new designs and acquiring a larger inventory of candy. A successful investment is guaranteed since her business is only one of two shoes shops that are in existence. However, her capital is insufficient to meet the demand in this growing sector.

For this reason Delfina is applying for a Kiva loan, her first form of financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. This loan will start her upward path toward achieving her goals.

loans.use: to purchase materials and supplies for producing new shoe designs and to acquire a large inventory of candy to sell.

loans.name: Jenny Marisol

texts.es:
Jenny Marisol tiene 33 años de edad vive en unión libre con su esposo y con sus cuatro hijos de diecisiete, dieciséis, trece, once y cuatro años en el Cantón Pueblo Viejo perteneciente a Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS  se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Marañón por la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo,  esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol.

Jenny se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Compra sus productos en Comercial  Agro insumos Karlita y los vende en el comercial Castillo.

Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima con la ayuda del crédito será más fácil para adquirir los insumos.
 Su sueño es poder comprarse un terreno. En su  tiempo libre le gusta salir a bailar.
texts.en:
Jenny Marisol is 33 years old. She lives with her husband and their four children (17, 16, 13, 11 and 4) in the Pueblo Viejo canton, which is in Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.

The UNIDO SOMOS (We Are United) communal bank is located in the El Marañón precinct of Puerto Pechiche parish, which is in Pueblo Viejo canton. This communal bank works in agriculture, sowing corn, rice and beans on the short growth cycle (less than six months).

Jenny works in agriculture, growing corn, rice and beans. She buys her products at the Karlita agricultural supply center and sells at Castillo shopping center. She is asking for the loan to sow corn, rice and beans and to buy seeds, urea, farm supplies and organic and liquid fertilizers for the crops.

The loan will give Jenny the financial help to provide for her needs. Facing challenges like pests, diseases, and weather changes will be easier with the loan's help because she will be able to buy the supplies she needs.

Her dream is to buy her own land. Jenny likes to go out dancing in her free time.

loans.use: to sow corn, rice and beans and to buy seeds, urea, farm supplies and organic and liquid fertilizers.

loans.name: Melina

texts.en:
Melina is 41 years of age and married with four children. Melina owns & operates a business venture selling baked goods in the local community.  She has one year of experience in this business. Melina needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Melina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Melina's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa vive en el barrio Nelson Mandela de la ciudad de Cartagena, allí se dedica a la venta de sandalias masculinas, zapatillas para damas, abarcas, y adicionó también la venta de ropa interior y exterior;  como ingresos complementarios, los fines de semana distribuye pasteles y bollos de contado y en todas estas actividades es  apoyada por su cónyuge. Su meta inmediata es lograr tener un capital de trabajo adicional, para comprar calzado que tiene encargado por sus clientes. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, ya que su capital de trabajo se torna insuficiente para atender la demanda, a propósito de las fiestas que se acercan en el mes de septiembre, como el día del amor y de la amistad, época en el que ocurre un importante repunte en las ventas y Teresa necesita aprovecharla para invertir y ganar dinero.  Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización con la cual planea su crecimiento desde sus indicadores financieros actuales, que son apropiados al tipo de actividades que desempeña y desde los cuales se estudió su potencial crecimiento.
texts.en:
Teresa lives in the Nelson Mandela neighborhood of Cartagena where she works selling men's sandals, women's shoes, sandals, and where she recently began selling clothes and undergarments.  For extra income, she sells cakes and rolls for cash on the weekends.  Her partner supports her in all of her business activities.  

Her immediate goal is to get more work capital in order to buy shoes that she has on order for her customers.  This is the reason she is applying for a Kiva loan, as her work capital is no longer sufficient to meet her business's demand because of the the holidays coming up in September.  During these holidays, such as Columbian Valentine's Day, there is a significant upturn in sales and Teresa needs to take advantage of it to invest and earn money.  

This Kiva loan is the first financing she is seeking with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She plans to grow with this organization from her current financial indicators, which are in line with the kind of business she does and from which she has studied her potential for growth.

loans.use: to buy a higher volume of shoes that she has on order for her customers

loans.name: Noataga

texts.en:
Noataga is 31 years of age and married with five children. She owns and operates a business selling straw mats and mattresses to tourists and local community members.  She has 1 year of experience in this business.  Noataga needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase raw materials to make mats and mattresses.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Noataga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Noataga's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make mats and mattresses.

loans.name: Luisana Virginia

texts.es:
Luisana Virginia tiene 25 años de edad vive en unión Libre con el esposo y su hija de cuatro años de edad en el Cantón Pueblo Viejo perteneciente a Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS  se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Marañón por la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo,  esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol.

Luisana se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Compra sus productos en Comercial  Agro insumos Karlita y los vende en el comercial Castillo.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y fréjol y comprar semillas, urea,  insumos y  abonos agrícolas, fertilizantes líquidos  para los cultivos.

Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima con la ayuda del crédito será más fácil para adquirir los insumos.
 Su sueño es poder comprarse un terreno para sembrar y poder producir mucho más. En su  tiempo libre le gusta dedicarse a los quehaceres domesticos.
texts.en:
Luisana Virginia is 25 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their four-year-old daughter in the canton of Pueblo Viejo, which is part of Los Ríos Province.

The members of the Communal Bank “Unido Somos” (We Are United) meet in the neighborhood of El Marañón in the parish of Puerto Pechiche, which is part of the canton of Pueblo Viejo. The Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn, rice, and beans.

Luisana is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and beans. She buys her supplies at the Agro Karlita Commercial Center and sells her products at the Castillo Commercial Market.

Luisana is requesting a loan for planting corn, rice, and beans. She plans to buy seeds, urea, compost, farming supplies, and liquid fertilizers for her crops.

With the financial support of this loan, she will be able to purchase what she needs. Among the challenges she faces are pests, diseases, and changes in weather. The help from this loan will make it easier for her to acquire supplies.

Her dream is to buy a piece of land so that she can plant and produce more crops. During her free time, Luisana enjoys doing the household chores.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, compost, farming supplies, and liquid fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Vaitapu

texts.en:
Vaitapu is 41 years of age and married with five children. She owns and operates a business selling baked goods in the local community.  She has 2 years of experience in this business.  Vaitapu needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell such as chicken leg quarters for making barbecue.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Vaitapu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Vaitapu's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell.

loans.name: Monica Patricia

texts.es:
La Sra. Mónica Patricia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Rumbo al Triunfo II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Està casada, tiene 35 años y cuatro hijos estudiantes del nivel secundario.

Desde hace 15 años trabaja en una empresa privada de elaboración de yogurt hasta las 6 de la tarde. Cuando tubo a sus hijos se vio en la necesidad de trabajar màs y apoyar en la economía de su hogar, empezó a vender refrescos, chupetes y dulces en la calle con que no tuvo mucho exito. Por eso tomó la decisión de invertir el cápital inicial de PEN 300.00 en una parrilla y empezó vender pollos y carnes asadas. Ha aumentando la variedad en sus comidas como juanes, arroz chaufa y refrescos de frutas. Trabaja actualmente en ambas actividades y le va muy bien, además de su rica preparación, ha salido adelante con sus hijos a los que mantiene y educa.
Con el nuevo préstamo de PEN 1,700.00 comprará productos para implementar un negocio con pollos vivos, carnes de res, especias, sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, aceites en litros, racimos de plátanos, sacos con carbón para asar sus parrillas, utensilios de cocina así que mesas y sillas para así captar nuevos clientes y mantener satisfechos .
Mónica Patricia es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora, su sueño es contar con un negocio en su propia casa, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindar la oportunidad a mujeres como ella y así poder hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Sra. Mónica Patricia is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Rumbo al Triunfo II” (Women Headed to Victory II) which is located in the District of Tarapoto, Province and Department of San Martín. She is 35 years old, married, and has four children who are high school students.

For the past 15 years, Mónica has worked at a private company that makes yogurt. Her job schedule lasts until 6pm. When she had her children, Mónica saw the need to work more in order to support the household finances. She began selling soft drinks, lollipops, and sweets on the street, but she did not have much success. For that reason, Mónica made the decision to invest her initial capital of 300 PEN in a grill and began selling chicken and roasted meats. She expanded her menu by adding “juanes” (a traditional Peruvian specialty of chicken and rice wrapped in banana leaves), fried rice, and fruit drinks. Mónica currently works both jobs and has done very well. In addition to preparing her rich foods, she has been able to help her children get ahead by supporting them and providing them an education.

With this new loan of 1700 PEN, Mónica will buy products to keep her business in operation such as live chickens, beef, spices, sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, liters of oil, bunches of bananas, sacks of charcoal for her grill, cooking utensils, as well as tables and chairs in order to attract new customers and keep them satisfied.

Mónica Patricia is a determined and enterprising woman. Her dream is to have a business in her home. She is extremely grateful to Manuela Ramos for providing opportunities to women like her so that they can make their dreams a reality.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, cooking utensils, and various ingredients.

loans.name: Niuia

texts.en:
Niuia is 66 years of age and married with seven children. She owns and operates a business selling snacks and cooked food to local communities.  She has 2 years of experience in this business.  Niuia needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Niuia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Niuia's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as snack foods and meat.

loans.name: Ines Marlene

texts.es:
Ines Marlene tiene 37 años de edad vive en unión libre junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos de dieciseis, trece y de once años de edad en el Cantón Pueblo Viejo perteneciente a Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS  se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Marañón por la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo,  esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol.
Ines se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Compra sus productos en Comercial  Agro insumos Karlita y los vende en el comercial Castillo.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y fréjol y comprar semillas, urea,  insumos y  abonos agrícolas, fertilizantes líquidos  para los cultivos.

Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima con la ayuda del crédito será más fácil para adquirir los insumos.
 Su sueño es poderse comprar una casa.En su  tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Ines Marlene is 37 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their three children (ages 16, 13, and 11) in the canton of Pueblo Viejo, which is part of Los Ríos Province.

The members of the Communal Bank “Unido Somos” (We Are United) meet in the neighborhood of El Marañón in the parish of Puerto Pechiche, which is part of the canton of Pueblo Viejo. The Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn, rice, and beans.

Ines is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and beans. She buys her supplies at the Agro Karlita Commercial Center and sells her products at the Castillo Commercial Market.

Ines is requesting a loan for planting corn, rice, and beans. She plans to buy seeds, urea, compost, farming supplies, and liquid fertilizers for her crops.

With the financial support of this loan, she will be able to purchase what she needs. Among the challenges she faces are pests, diseases, and changes in weather. The help from this loan will make it easier for her to acquire supplies.

Her dream is to buy a house. During her free time, Ines enjoys practicing sports.
