loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, compost, farming supplies, and liquid fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Fotu

texts.en:
Fotu is 46 years of age and married with two children. Fotu owns & operates a business venture planting & harvesting taro for sale.  She has four years of experience in this business. Fotu needs a loan of WST $2,000 to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Fotu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Fotu's fourth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina is 36 years of age and married with two children. Tina owns & operates a business venture planting & harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale.  She has two years of experience in this business.  Tina needs a loan of WST $1,500 to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Tina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Tina's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Rosa Maclovia

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa es socia del banco comuna Sector 3 María, vive en las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca,  esta ciudad  es de clima frió, su gente es muy carismática, amable y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones. La arquitectura de Cuenca se mezcla entre lo colonial y lo moderno lo que le hacen una ciudad muy especial.

Doña Rosa tiene 39 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 18, 16, 14 y 12 años de edad, todos sus hijos estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo se dedica a la construcción y labora como albañil, la casa es de su propiedad construida en su unión conyugal.
  
La Señora. Rosa se dedica al cuidado de su hogar y como pasa en casa se dedica a la cría de pollos y cuyes a los que los vende en la ciudad o en su comunidad. 

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su segundo crédito y lo va a invertir para la compra de alimento para sus pollos.
 
Su meta es tener ganado y crecer en la cría de animales.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa is a member of the Sector 3 Maria communal bank. She lives in the outskirts of the city of Cuenca. This city has a cold climate and its people are very charismatic, friendly and maintain their culture and traditions. The architecture of Cuenca is a mix of colonial and modern, which makes it a very special place.

Rosa is 39, married and has 4 children who are 18, 16, 14 and 12 years of age. All of her children are in school in the city. Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer. The house they live in is their own and is a product of their union.

Sra. Rosa is a housewife and, as she spends her days at home, she also raises chickens and guinea pigs which she sells in the city or in her neighborhood.

This is her second loan as a member of the communal bank and she will use it to buy chicken feed.

Her goal is to have cattle and to expand her animal raising business.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Nuris Alicia

texts.es:
Nuris es comerciante, tiene tres años trabajando en su propio negocio, una pulperia que inicio con ahorros propios. Casada, su esposo labora como conductor de acarreo comercial, es madre de dos hijos, estudiantes de primaria.
Nuris es una mujer muy activa y como objetivo ha sido la construccion de su casa, como el apoyo  a su esposo con los gastos de alimentacion. Pues todo esta ah altos costos.
Sus ventas han aumentado al fortalecer su inventario, con prestamo que Afodenic, ha dado en seis ciclos, los cuales introdujo mas productos de consumo, y logro la captacion de mas clientes.
Hoy con este nuevo prestamo, comprara: seis quintales de arroz, cinco quintales de azucar, cuatro vidones de aceite, cuatro quintale de frijoles, y golosinas. Siendo el mas vendido.
texts.en:
Nuris is a shopkeeper. She owns and works in a grocery store, which she started with her own savings 3 years ago. She is married and her husband works as a commercial driver hauling cargo. She has 2 children; both attend primary school.

Nuris is a very industrious woman. Her goal has been to build her house and to help her husband with food costs, as everything costs a lot. With the help of a loan from Afodenic, she was able to strengthen her inventory and increase sales. She did this in 6 loan cycles. During this time she introduced more consumer products and managed to attract more customers.

Now, with this new loan she is going to buy: 6 quintals (a quintal is 100 pounds) of rice, 5 quintals of sugar, 4 drums of oil, 5 quintals of beans and candy, as it is the best seller.

loans.use: to buy bulk grains to strengthen her inventory and increase sales.

loans.name: Rita Faiva

texts.en:
Rita is 47 years of age and married with four children. Rita owns & operates a business venture providing general alteration & tailoring services to local community members.  She has four years of experience in this business. Rita needs a loan of WST $1,500 to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Rita joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Rita's fourth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Clara Virginia

texts.es:
Clara Virginia tiene 52 años de edad vive en uniuón libre junto a su esposo y ha sus tres hijos de veinte y cinco, veinte y dos, catorce años de edad en el Cantón Pueblo Viejo perteneciente a Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS  se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Marañón por la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo,  esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol.

Clara se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Compra sus productos en Comercial  Agroinsumos Karlita y los vende en el comercial Castillo.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y fréjol y comprar semillas, urea,  insumos y  abonos agrícolas, fertilizantes líquidos  para los cultivos.

Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima con la ayuda del crédito será más fácil para adquirir los insumos.
 Su sueño es poder comprarse maquinaria para poder trabajar en los terrenos. En su  tiempo libre le gusta escuchar música.
texts.en:
Clara Virginia, 52, and her husband have three children, 25-, 22-, and 14-years old, respectively.  They live in Pueblo Viejo, a canton in Ecuador's Los Rios province.

The members of the UNIDOS SOMOS community bank, in Pueblo Viejo, are farmers.  They grow maize, rice and beans.

Clara, too, grows maize, rice and beans.  She buys her supplies from Agroinsumos Karlita, a farming supply company, and sells her crop at Castillo.

Clara is applying for a loan to buy supplies for her farming business.  She needs seeds, fertilizer and other supplies for her next crop.

The loan will help her to support her family.  She faces problems such as insects and plant diseases, as well as the vagaries of the weather.  Theloan will make it easier for her to buy the supplies she needs for the business. Her dream is to buy a tractor for the farm.  In her spare time, she likes to listen to music.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her next crop of maize, rice and beans.

loans.name: Los Favoritos Group

texts.es:
LOS FAVORITOS”  es u grupo recién formado lo integran 07 socios  que viven en la zona D. Puente piedra,  al norte D. lima Perú.  la Sra. Leslie es la presidenta  recién nombrada  espera aportar para que el grupo pueda prosperar, ella se dedica a la venta D. tamales  aprendió a prepararlos cuando asistía a una iglesia por algún tiempo trabajo para ellos pero después se independizo para hacerlo por cuenta propia  ella tiene el apoyo D. sus esposo y sus hijos, la preparación D. los tamales la realizan e su casa semanalmente preparan 200 tamales  los que reparten sábados y domingos,   ya tienen compradores fijos que se han convertido en sus clientes.  Este trabajo  que realizan  les permite tener un ingreso adicional  así pueden avanzar con algunos acabados en su casa que esta en plena construcción también están ahorrando por que mas adelante quieren comprar una cocina semi industrial para preparar por mas cantidad  también quieren repartir volantes para poder alcanzar mas clientela su préstamo le será D. mucha ayuda ya que lo utilizaran  para comprar ollas nuevas y utensilios D. cocinas algo muy indispensable para seguir trabajando.
  
 *La Sra Leslie es la 3ra D. la foto
texts.en:
LOS FAVORITOS is a new community bank and its 7 members live in Puente Piedra, north of Lima, Peru.  Sra. Leslie was recently named group president and she hopes to ensure that all of the members prosper.  She operates a business making and selling tamales.  She joined a church project where she learned the business and now she works independently.  Her husband and children support her efforts.  She prepares the tamales at home once a week, making 200 of them and delivering them on Saturdays and Sundays.  Some of her buyers have become regular customers.  The business provides her with an extra income that, in turn, allows her to pay for some on-going work on her house.  She is also saving for a "semi-industrial" kitchen that will allow her to make more tamales and she wants to print flyers so that she can advertise her business to potential customers.  The loan will be a big help because she will be able to buy new pans and other kitchen utensils that she needs to work.

Sra. Leslie is 3rd in the photo.

loans.use: COMPRA DE OLLAS NUEVAS Y UTENSILIOS DE COCINA.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 57 years of age and married with three children. She owns and operates a business selling baked goods in the local community.  She has 3 years of experience in this business.  Ana needs a loan of WST $1750 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Ana joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Ana's 3rd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ana Mariana

texts.es:
La Señora. Ana es socia del banco comuna Sector 3 María, vive en las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, su gente es muy carismática, amable y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones. La arquitectura de Cuenca se mezcla entre lo colonial y lo moderno lo que le hacen una ciudad muy especial.

La Señora Ana tiene 62 años es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos quienes son todos mayores de edad, cuatro de sus hijos son casados e independientes, sus dos hijas solteras traban y ayudan económicamente. Su esposo es jubilado y pasa en casa, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

Doña Ana es de profesión costurera, realiza el arreglo de todo tipo de prendas de vestir. Se dedica al cuidado de su hogar y también cría cerdos, cuye y pollos a los que los vende  en su comunidad.

En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 7 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en sus dos negocios, va a comprar telas e hilos para su taller y alimento para sus cerdos. 

Su meta es crecer en todas sus actividades.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana, 62, is a member of the Sector 3 Maria community bank.  She lives on the outskirts of Cuenca, a city with a cold climate, but happy and friendly people who value their culture and traditions.  The local architecture is a mix of colonial and modern, one of the things that makes Cuenca very special.  

Sra. Ana is married and has 6 children, all grown.  Four of the children are married and independent.  Her two single daughters work and help out with family expenses.  Her husband is retired and spends his time around the house.  They own the house where they live.

Dona Ana is a seamstress.  She makes all kinds of clothing.  She runs the house and still finds time to raise pigs, cuye and chickens, all of which she sells locally.

She has been a member of the community bank for 7 years and she will use this loan to supply her two businesses.  She will buy fabric and threads for her sewing business and feed for her pigs.

Her goal is to grow both businesses.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her sewing business and feed for her livestock business.

loans.name: Jose Vidal

texts.es:
José casado, su esposa ama de casa, el cliente de profesión soldador sus planes es iniciar su propio taller de soldadura. Trabaja para una empresa privada desde hace tiempo. En la zona donde vive  existe  inseguridad. Siendo un factor importante para la familia el cliente requiere mejora la infraestructura de la vivienda.
Con el préstamo  comprar materiales de construcción como: cementó, arena, piedrines, perlines, bloques, piedras canteras, laminas de zinc, golosas, estribu, ladrillos, entre otros materiales para la construcción de un cuarto el cual quedara en la parte trasera de la propiedad. obteniendo comodidad, seguridad para su familia.
Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo al desarrollo de su nivel social.
texts.en:
José is married and his wife is a housewife.  He works as a welder.  His plan is to start his own welding shop.  He has been working for a private company for a long time.  There is insecurity in the area where he lives.  This being an important factor for his family, he needs to improve the infrastructure of his house.

With the loan José will buy construction materials such as cement, sand, gravel, purlins, cinder blocks, quarry stones, zinc metal sheets, screws, braces, and bricks, among other materials for the construction of a room on the back part of his property to obtain comfort and security for his family.

He thanks the bank for its support in the development of his social standing.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Sara Priscila

texts.es:
Sara Priscila tiene 36 años de edad vive en unión libre junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos de dieciciete y quince años de edad en el Cantón Pueblo Viejo perteneciente a Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS  se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Marañón por la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo,  esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol.

Sara se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Compra sus productos en Comercial  Agro insumos Karlita y los vende en el comercial Castillo.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y fréjol y comprar semillas, urea,  insumos y  abonos agrícolas, fertilizantes líquidos  para los cultivos.

Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima con la ayuda del crédito será más fácil para adquirir los insumos.
 Su sueño es poder comprarse una camioneta para poder trasladar el producto que se cosecha. En su  tiempo libre le gusta dedicarse de los quehaceres domésticos.
texts.en:
Sara Priscila, 36, is in a common-law marriage, and lives with her husband and their 2 children, ages 15 and 17.  They live in the Pueblo Viejo canton, which is part of Los Rios province. The members of the "Unidos Somos" (We are United) communal bank live in Puerto Pechiche parish, in El Marañon district, which is part of the Puerto Viejo canton.

This members of the communal bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and beans.  Sara works in agriculture, and grows corn, rice, and beans. 

She buys her supplies at Karlita Agricultural Supply, and sells her produce at Castillo market.

She is applying for the loan to grow corn, rice and beans and to buy seed, urea, agricultural supplies, manure, and liquid fertilizer for her crops. The support of the loan would help her to cover her financial needs.  

She faces challenges such as pests, crop diseases, and variations in the climate.  With the help of the loan, it will be easier for her to acquire the necessary agricultural supplies. Her dream is to buy a truck to transport the products that she harvests. In her free time she likes to do housework.

loans.use: To grow corn, rice, beans and to buy seed, urea, agricultural supplies, manure, and liquid fertilizers.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Don Miguel  vive en a una localidad pequeña en donde las personas son de una sola religión, la iglesia es  grande y muy bonita. El vive en unión libre con la señora Andrea y con quien procreo  cuatro hijos quienes aun están a su responsabilidad.

     Solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en sus camionetas dando mantenimiento  ya que los meterá en  trasportes  ya que el confía que le dará un mejor resultado, aun así también  con las ganancias que vaya obteniendo  pondrá su negocio de  abarrotes.

   Su inspiración por esta actividad comenzó por si mismo  ya que tiene dos carros que  a utiliza para servicio particular y  mejor lo trabajara en  servicio a pasajero.

  Lo que más desea es que con esta actividad y el préstamo  logre su objetivo para continuar trabajando y sacar adelante  a su familia.
texts.en:
Don Miguel lives in a small town where the people are of a single religion. The local church is large and very beautiful. He lives with his common-law wife Sra. Andrea and they have four children who are their responsibility.

Miguel is requesting a loan to invest in the maintenance of his trucks so that they will operate well whenever he gets into them. With his earnings, he also plans to establish a grocery business.

His inspiration for starting his own business resulted from the fact that he has two vehicles that he uses for providing transportation services. In his work, Miguel tries to provide the best service to his passengers.

What he desires most from his business and this loan is to achieve his goal of being able to continue working so that his family can move forward.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his two vehicles.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Sina is 43 years of age and married with five children. She owns and operates a business planting and harvesting breadfruit for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business. Sina needs a loan of WST $2200 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 650 talas or US $271 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Sina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Sina's 4th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora Cecilia, viven unión libre con el señor  Guillermo  y con quien procreo cinco hijos quienes aun están a su responsabilidad, ella vive en un lugar en donde las personas hablan la lengua tzotzil.

    Se dedica a bordar y elaborar camisas de mantas,  y solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de  más material y poder  trabajar más días a  la semana, en esta actividad lleva  veinte años y cuatros meses en la que comenta que le va bien  ya que con ello apoya a su esposo con los ingreso de la  casa.

    Su importación por esta actividad fue por si sola ya que en ese lugar donde ella vive todas las personas se dedican a bordar y costuras camisas y blusas de manta y le gusta mucho trabajar con ello.

    Su más grande deseo es que como esta pequeña actividad y el préstamo pueda  continuar trabajando para  apoyar a sus hijos dándole una buena educación y con el tiempo terminen una profesión.
texts.en:
Sra. Cecilia lives with her common-law husband Sr. Guillermo and their five children who are under their responsibility. She resides in a place where the people speak the Tzotzil language.

Cecilia produces embroidered shirts and blankets. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of more materials so that she can work more days each week. Cecilia has been practicing her trade for 20 years and 4 months. She says that she has done very well and has the support of her husband with the household income.

This business is important to her because she can work alone. She also lives in a place where everyone knows how to embroider and sew shirts, blouses, and blankets. Cecilia enjoys her work tremendously.

Her greatest wish for her small business and this is loan is to be able to continue working so that she can support her children and provide them a good education. In time, she hopes that they will pursue a profession.

loans.use: to buy blankets and thread for making embroideries.

loans.name: Lupe

texts.en:
Lupe is 39 years of age and married with two children. Lupe owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. She has many years of experience in this business. Lupe needs a loan of 2500 WST to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 650 talas or US $271 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Lupe joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Lupe's 4th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Juana Elisa

texts.es:
Juana Elisa tiene 31 años de edad vive en unión Libre junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de diez y siete años de edad en el Cantón Pueblo Viejo perteneciente a Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS  se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Marañón por la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo,  esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol.

Juana se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Compra sus productos en Comercial  en el mercado de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y fréjol y comprar semillas, urea,  insumos y  abonos agrícolas, fertilizantes líquidos  para los cultivos.

Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima con la ayuda del crédito será más fácil para adquirir los insumos.
 Su sueño es poder comprarse un terreno para hacer una casa para la familia. En su  tiempo libre se ocupa de los quehaceres domésticos.
texts.en:
Juana Elisa is 31 years old and lives with her common-law husband and two children (ages 10 and 7) in the canton of Pueblo Viejo, which is part of Ventanas Province in Los Ríos.  

The members of the Communal Bank “Unido Somos” (We Are United) meet in the neighborhood of El Marañón in the parish of Puerto Pechiche, which is part of the canton of Pueblo Viejo. The Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn, rice, and beans.

Juana is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and beans. She buys her supplies wholesale and sells her products at a market in Ventanas.

Juana is requesting a loan for planting corn, rice, and beans. She plans to buy seeds, urea, compost, farming supplies, and liquid fertilizers for her crops.

With the financial support of this loan, she will be able to purchase what she needs. Among the challenges she faces are pests, diseases, and changes in weather. Acquiring this loan will help her secure supplies more easily.  Her dream is to buy a plot of land so that she can build a house for her family. 

During her free time, Juana Elisa enjoys keeping herself busy by performing the household chores.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, compost, farming supplies, and liquid fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Fuatino

texts.en:
Fuatino is 27 years of age and married with two children. She owns and operates a business planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale.  She has 1 year of experience in this business. Fuatino needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Fuatino joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Fuatino's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Doña María, es originaria de un lugar muy lindo en donde las personas todas  son de una misma religión,  es casada  y en total tuvo nueve  hijos quienes  ya todos están casados.

   Ella desde que tenia trece años practica el bordado de mantas, en donde elabora  camisa, pantalones y formalizo  hace veinte años   en la que nos comenta que le  va bien ya que con  esos ingresos  a sacado adelante a su familia junto con su esposo don Andrés quien trabaja en el campo y desean tener lo mas necesario.

    Comenta que aprendió esta actividad por su propia creatividad para apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa, así tener lo más necesario  para cuando ya estén más grandes de edad.
    
   Lo que desea es que con esta actividad y el préstamo  logre seguir trabajando  hasta que dios le preste vida.
texts.en:
Doña María is originally from a very beautiful place where all of the people are of the same religion.  She is from the neighborhood of Jerusalén.  María is married and has nine children, all of whom are married.

She has been making embroidered blankets for 13 years, but she has had a formal business for 20 years.  María says that she has done very well.  She and her husband Don Andrés have been able to move their family forward.

María says that she learned this skill as a result of her own creativity so that she could help her husband with the household expenses.  As a result, they have more than they need, so they are accumulating savings for when they are older.  

What she wants most from her business and this loan is the ability to continue working until God determines otherwise.

loans.use: to buy blankets and thread for making embroideries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a variety of cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: Gatai

texts.en:
Gatai is 25 years of age and married with no children. Gatai owns and operates a business venture, selling specialty food products in the local community.  She has 2 years experience in this business.  Gatai needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 290 talas or US $121 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Gatai joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Gatai's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Armando Pedro

texts.es:
Armando Pedro tiene 25 años de edad vive en unión Libre junto a su esposo y su hija de un año de edad en el Cantón Pueblo Viejo perteneciente a Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS  se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Marañón por la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo,  esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol.

Armando se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Compra sus productos en Comercial  Agro insumos Karlita y los vende en el comercial Castillo.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y fréjol y comprar semillas, urea,  insumos y  abonos agrícolas, fertilizantes líquidos  para los cultivos.

Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima con la ayuda del crédito será más fácil para adquirir los insumos.
 Su sueño es poder ampliar la casa que en la actualidad posee para el bienestar de la familia. En su  tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Armando Pedro is 25 and lives in a common law relationship with his wife and their one year old daughter. They live in Pueblo Viejo canton, on the border of Ventanas canton, in Los Rios province.

The members of the UNIDOS SOMOS Communal Bank are located in the El Marañón area of Puerto Pechiche district in Pueblo Viejo canton.  This group works in short cycle agriculture, planting corn, rice and beans.

Armando plants corn, rice and beans. He buys his products at Karlita Agricultural Supply and sells them at the Castillo Market. 

He is requesting a loan to plant corn, rice and beans and to buy seeds, urea, agricultural supplies, manure and liquid fertilizer for his crops. 

The loan will help him to provide financially for his needs. He confronts challenges such as pest infestations and diseases and changes in the weather.  It will be easier to obtain supplies with the help of this loan. 

His dream is to be able to expand the house he currently has in order to make his family more comfortable. In his free time he enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to plant corn, rice and beans and buy seeds, urea, agricultural supplies, manure and liquid fertilizer.

loans.name: Guadalupe Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Guadalupe  vive en una localidad muy especial para ella ya que las personas que radican en ese lugar  tienen  una manera de trabajar y comenta que es la tradición de su localidad. Vive en unión libre con el señor Juan.

   Ella es ama de casa y solicito  el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra  de mantas e hilos para elaborar camisas y bordarlas en esta actividad lleva seis años y cuatros meses y comenta que la va bien ya que lea dado un buen resultado día con día.
   
   Aprendió esta actividad por una compañera  quien desde pequeña  fueron amigas y decidieron  comenzar de poco apoco e idearon empezar a borda, desde entonces lo viene practicando y ha visto un buen resultado.
   
      Lo  que más desea es que con esta  pequeña actividad  pueda seguir trabajando para ir mejorando día con día su estado económica así cuando sea  madre de familia pueda darle los más necesario.
texts.en:
The place where Guadalupe lives is very special to her since the people that inhabit this community have a certain way of working that is very traditional to their location.  She lives with her boyfriend Juan.

She is a housewife and requests the loan to invest it in purchasing fabric and thread to make shirts and embroider them.  She has worked at this trade for 6 years and four months and she comments that it is going well since she has had good results day after day.  

She learned this trade from a childhood friend and they decided to start little by little, coming up with the idea to begin to embroider.  Since then, she has been practicing and has seen good results.  

What she wants most is that with this small trade she will be able to continue working in order to improve her financial state day by day, so that when she becomes a mother she will be able to give her children what they need.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of fabric and thread to make embroidered shirts and blouses.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
La señora Catalina vive en un lugar muy bonito en donde ella aprendió a elaborar camisas de mantas, ella es casada y a su responsabilidad tiene a  cuatro hijos.

     Ella es la segunda vez que solicita un préstamo en fundación y es para  invertirlo en  la compra  de  mataras para elaborar blusas y camisa artesanales hechas a mano, en esta actividad lleva cinco años y cuatro mese en donde comenta que le va  bien ya que con ello a mejorado  su ingresos económico.

     Su inspiración por esta actividad comenzó desde muy pequeña pero lo practicaba muy poco  y hace cinco años se  asocio con otras compañeras para trabajar este tipo de actividad y luego salir a venderlo en la ciudad de Tuxtla Gutiérrez y san Cristóbal y comenta que le va bien.
 
     Lo que más desea es que con esta actividad  pueda seguir trabajando y así tener sus propios a horros para  sacar adelante a su pequeña familia  y así también  tener un lugar especial para trabajar.
texts.en:
Señora Catalina lives in a very beautiful place, where she learned to make shirts from handwoven manta cotton.  She is married, and is responsible for four children.

This is the second time that she has requested a loan from the Foundation, and it is to be invested in purchasing materials to make hand-made artisinal blouses and shirts.  She has been doing this work for the last five years and four months.  She says it's been going very well for her, and that with it she has been able to improve her financial income.

Her inspiration for doing this work began when she was very young, but she wasn't doing it very often.  Five years ago she got together with other partners to do this type of work, and then sell it in the cities of Tuxtla Gutiérrez  and San Cristóbal. She says it has been going very well.

What she most wants to is to be able to continue doing this kind of work, and so have her own savings in order to move her small family ahead in life, and also to have a specific premises for her work.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of handwoven Manta cotton and thread for making fabric shirts.

loans.name: Mouena

texts.en:
Mouena is 41 years old, married, and has five children. She owns & operates a business selling specialty food products in the local community.  She has 2 years of experience, and needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 290 talas or US $121 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Mouena joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Mouena's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Angel Esteban

texts.es:
Angel Esteban tiene 46 años de edad es casado vive con la esposa y sus cinco hijos de ceinte y dos, veinte y uno, dieciocho, quince y cinco años de edad en el Cantón Pueblo Viejo perteneciente a Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS  se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Marañón por la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo,  esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol.

Angel  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Compra sus productos en Comercial  Agro insumos Karlita y los vende en el comercial Castillo.

Solicita el crédito para poder sembrar maíz, arroz y fréjol y poder comprar semillas, urea,  insumos y  abonos agrícolas, fertilizantes líquidos  para los cultivos.

Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima con la ayuda del crédito será más fácil para adquirir los insumos.
 Su sueño es poder comprarse una finca y poder sembrar aún más para aumentar los ingresos. En su  tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Angel Esteban is 46 years old, married, and lives with his wife and five children (22, 21, 18, 15, and 5 years old) in the Pueblo Viejo canton in Ventanas in the Los Rios province.

The members of the community bank Unido Somos are located in the El Marañón area of the Puerto Pechiche parish in the Pueblo Viejo canton.  This group works with short cycle farmers who plant corn, rice, and beans.

Angel is a farmer who plants corn, rice, and beans.  He purchases his products at the Karlita Agricultural Supply store and sells them at Castillo's store.

He is asking for this loan because in order to plant corn, rice and beans, he needs to buy seeds, urea, supplies, manure, and liquid fertilizer for the crops.

The support of this loan will help him financially be able to meet the needs of his family.  He faces challenges such as plagues, diseases, and climate variation, and with the help of the loan, it will be easier to purchase supplies.  

His dream is to be able to purchase a farm and plant more crops to increase his income.  In his free time, he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, urea, supplies, manure, and liquid fertilizer.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
La Sra. Raquel pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres rumbo al triunfo II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 30 años y no tiene hijos. Es una mujer muy activa que trabaja en una empresa de fabricación de Yogurt por las mañanas y en su negocio de venta de salchipapas, pollo broster y salchipan por las noches. Su esposo le apoyó en la compra de un carrito salchipapero y poco a poco fue incrementado sus ventas y ganando clientela quiénes son sus familiares, vecinos, y personas transeúntes. Cuenta el apoyo de su mamá y con ambas actividades podìa mejorar su calidad de vida.
Con este préstamo de PEN 2,000.00 Raquel comprará productos e ingredientes como papas por sacos, aceite por galones, paquetes de sal, carnes de pollo, verduras y condimentos; además utensilios de cocina, baldes, y cientos de envases descartables que utiliza en su negocio. Raquel es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora. Su sueño es tener un negocio en su propia casa vendiendo sus productos y además dedicarse a otros negocios para mejorar económicamente. Agradece mucho al Movimiento Manuela Ramos el brindar de la oportunidad de recibir un préstamo y así poder realizar sus sueños.
texts.en:
Raquel belongs to the “Mujeres Rumbo al Triunfo II” (Women Headed for Triumph II) Communal Bank in the District of Tarapoto, Province and Department of San Martin. She is 30 years old, lives with her partner, and has no children. Raquel is a very active woman who works mornings in an enterprise that makes yoghurt, then works evenings in her own business making kebabs. Her husband helped her buy a kebab cart, and little by little her sales  grew, as she gained customers, including her relatives, neighbors, and transient people. She counts on the help of her mother and by means of both activities, she has improved her quality of life.

With this loan of 2,000 new sols, Raquel will buy products and ingredients such as potatoes by the sack, oil by the gallon, packets of salt,  chicken, vegetables, condiments; and utensils for the kitchen, pails, and hundreds of disposable bottles she will use in her business.

Raquel is a hard-working and enterprising woman. Her dream is to have a business in her own home selling her products and, in addition, dedicating herself to other businesses to improve economically. She is very grateful to the Movimiento (Movement) Manuela Ramos for offering this opportunity to receive a loan and thus, to be able to realize her dreams.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as salt and potatoes and kitchen utensils, to use  at her kebab-vending cart.

loans.name: Cecilia Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora. Cecilia es socia del banco comuna Sector 3 María, vive en las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, su gente es muy carismática, amable y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones. La arquitectura de Cuenca se mezcla entre lo colonial y lo moderno lo que le hacen una ciudad muy especial.

La Señora. Cecilia tiene de 32 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 13 y 8 años de edad que estudian en colegio y escuela. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su padre con quien comparte los gastos, la casa de su papá es propia.
 
Nuestra socia es costurera y labora en un taller de lunes a sábados todo el día, en esta actividad lleva un año trabajando. En su casa se dedica a la cría de pollos.
 
En el banco comuna se encuentra hace 7 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en su alimento.
 
Su meta es tener un local de venta de pañales.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a member of the community bank Sector 3 Maria.  She lives in the outskirts of the city of Cuenca.  The city has a cold climate and the people are very charismatic, friendly, and maintain the culture and traditions.  The architecture in Cuenca is a mix of colonial and modern, which makes the city very special.

Cecilia is 32 years old and is a single mother of two children who are 8 and 13 years old and both attend school.  She does not have her own home, so she lives in her father's house and shares the expenses.  Her father owns the house. 

Cecilia is a seamstress and works in a workshop from Monday to Saturday all day.  She has done this work for one year.  In her home, she works raising chickens.  

She has been a member of the community bank for seven years, and with this new loan, she will purchase chickens and feed for them.   Her goal is to have a store that sells diapers.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and feed for them.

loans.name: Alberto Noe

texts.es:
Alberto Noe tiene 27 años de edad vive en unión libre junto a su esposa y a su hija de dos años de edad en el Cantón Pueblo Viejo perteneciente a Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS  se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Marañón por la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo,  esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol.

Alberto se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Compra sus productos en Comercial  Agro insumos Karlita y los vende en el comercial Castillo.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y fréjol y comprar semillas, urea,  insumos y  abonos agrícolas, fertilizantes líquidos  para los cultivos.

Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima con la ayuda del crédito será más fácil para adquirir los insumos.
 Su sueño es poder comprarse un terreno para sembrar y poder producir mucho más. En su  tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Alberto Noe is 27 years old.  He lives in a civil union with his wife and two-year-old daughter in the Pueblo Viejo Canton, which is part of Ventanas, in the de los Ríos Province.

He is a member of the Communal Bank "UNIDO SOMOS", ("We Are United"), which is located in the El Marañón district in the Puerto Pechiche parish, which is part of the Pueblo Viejo Canton.  This bank works with short-cycle agricultural growing of corn, rice, and beans.  

Alberto works in agriculture, growing corn, rice and beans. He buys his products at the Karlita agricultural supply trading center, and sells them at the Castillo trading center.  

He is requesting the loan to grow corn, rice and beans, and to buy seeds, urea, supplies, and agricultural manure and liquid fertilizers for his crops.  The support of the loan will help him financially with meeting his needs.  He has faced challenges such as pests and illnesses, and the variability of the climate.  With the help of the loan, it will be easier for him to buy supplies.

His dream is to be able to buy another field for planting and to be able to produce a much greater amount of crops.

In his free time, he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to grow corn, rice and beans, and to buy seeds, ureas, supplies, and agricultural manure and liquid fertilizers.

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras De La Ensenada Group

texts.es:
La jugueria MEDILU es de propiedad de la Sra. Mercedes son 07 años que tiene su negocio  propio empezó como la mayoría informalmente y de forma ambulatoria  le parece increíble haber progresado tanto  tardo 12 años para tener su propio puesto de venta en el mercado Virgen del Carmen un lugar cerca de su lugar de residencia  fue su padre quien la ayudo económicamente con el fin de que pueda estar  junto a sus hijos y no descuidarlos, ella fue progresando poco a poco ahora esta agradecida debido que gracias a su trabajo ayuda a sus hijos que siguen estudios superiores especialmente a una de sus hijas, en su jugería ella vende toda clase de jugos, ensaladas de frutas y otros alimentos. Mas adelante quiere que su negocio se expanda y siga creciendo quiere poner  una fuente de soda en su propia casa, donde cuenta con un ambiente adecuado  para tener su negocio formal,  su crédito le servirá para la compra de  frutas al por mayor  , ella es secretaria del grupo “ LAS TRIUNFADORAS DE LA ENSENADA “

* La Sra MERCEDES es la 3ra parada.
texts.en:
The MEDILU juice shop is the property of Mercedes, who has owned it for 7 years now. Like most businesses, it began informally as a street-vending enterprise. It seems incredible to have progressed so much. Mercedes has waited 12 years to have her own sales post in the Virgen del Carmen Market, a location close to her place of residence. 

It was Mercedes' father who aided her economically so that she could be with her children and not leave them uncared for. She has been progressing little by little and now, and she is grateful that due to her hard work, she can help her children to continue their higher studies, especially one of her daughters.

At her juice stand Mercedes sells all kinds of juices, fruit salads, and other foods. Further along, she wants to expand her business and continue growing. She hopes to install a soda fountain in her own house, where she can count on an adequate ambience and launch a formal business.

Mercedes' loan will be used to buy fruit at wholesale. She is secretary of the communal bank group “Las Triunfadoras de la Ensenada.”

*In the photo Mercedes is the 3rd person seated.

loans.use: to buy fruit at wholesale to sell.

loans.name: Miriama

texts.en:
Miriama is 55 years old, married, and has one child. She owns & operates a business selling baked goods in the local community.  She has 1 year of experience, and needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make her baked goods.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 220 talas or US $92 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Miriama joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Miriama's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Fernando Bismark

texts.es:
Fernando tiene 27 años de edad vive en unión libre junto a su esposa en el Cantón Pueblo Viejo perteneciente a Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS  se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Marañón por la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo,  esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol.

Fernando se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Compra sus productos en Comercial  Agro insumos Karlita y los vende en el comercial Castillo.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y fréjol y comprar semillas, urea,  insumos y  abonos agrícolas, fertilizantes líquidos  para los cultivos.

Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima con la ayuda del crédito será más fácil para adquirir los insumos.
 Su sueño es poder comprarse maquinaria para poder trabajar en los terrenos. En su  tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Fernando is 27 years old.  He lives in a civil union with his wife in the Pueblo Viejo Canton which is part of Ventanas, in the de los Ríos Province.

He is a member of the Communal Bank "UNIDO SOMOS" ("We Are United"), which is located in the El Marañón district in the Puerto Pechiche parish, which is part of the Pueblo Viejo Canton.  This bank works with short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and beans.

Fernando works in agriculture, growing corn, rice and beans.  He buys his products at the Karlita agricultural supplies trading center, and sells them at the Castillo trading center.

He is requesting the loan to buy corn, rice and beans, and to buy seeds, urea, supplies, and agricultural manure and liquid fertilizers for the crops.

The support of the loan will help him financially to meet his needs.  He faces challenges such as pests and illnesses, and the variability of the climate.  With the help of the loan, it will be easier for him to buy supplies.

His dream is to be able to buy machinery for working his fields.

In his free time, he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy corn, rice and beans, and to buy seeds, urea, supplies, and agricultural manure and liquid fertilizers.

loans.name: Pupu

texts.en:
Pupu is 56 years old, married, and has four children. She owns & operates a business providing men's tailoring services to local community members.  She has 7 years of experience, and needs a loan of WST $2000 to purchase additional fabric & materials.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve and expand the business.

Pupu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Pupu's 3rd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabric & materials

loans.name: Juana Yadira

texts.es: Juana casada, sus hijos ya son independiente, su esposo le ayuda económicamente, sus planes en establecer un comideria. Trabaja como cocinera desde hace un tiempo. Tiene el proyecto de seguir mejorando la infraestructura de su vivienda tiene un aparte de los materiales pero necesita completarla para iniciar con su construcción. El préstamo será invertido en la compra de materiales de construcción como. Cemento, arena, piedrines, piedras cantera, bloques, láminas de zinc entre otros materiales para la construcción de un cuarto que será de gran beneficio ya que obtendrá comodidad y protección.
texts.en: Juana is married.  Her children live on their own and her husband helps her financially.  Her plans are to open an eatery.  She has been working as a cook for a long time.  Her project is to continue improving her housing's infrastructure.  She has some of the materials, but she needs the rest to start construction.  The loan will be invested in the purchase of construction materials like cement, sand, gravel, quarried rock, blocks and sheets of zinc, among other construction items.  The additional room will be a great benefit since it will provide Juana with comfort and protection.

loans.use: to build a room.

loans.name: Anau Folola

texts.en:
Anau is 56 years old and married with four children. Anau owns and operates a business venture, selling food products in the local community.  She has 2 years of experience in this business.  Anau needs a loan of WST 1500 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2011, Anau joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Anau's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lia Vanessa

texts.es: Lia es una joven de 20 años de edad que vive en el municipio de Soledad, donde tiene un negocio llamado “Peluquería Ludys”, el cual funciona hace 6 años ofreciendo servicios de corte de cabello, masajes, peinados y servicios para mejorar la imagen personal y profesional de hombres, mujeres, jóvenes y niños. Lia planea adecuar el espacio físico donde funciona su peluquería, ponerle rejas, puertas, ventanas, lámparas, y también requiere adicionar un secador y comprar en mayor volumen, champo, enjuagues y otros insumos de belleza. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Snto Domingo, pues con ello su capital de trabajo aumentaría y lograría descuentos por compras en volúmenes y de contado, que trasladaría en más ingresos y precios competitivos. Su sueño es lograr el confort de sus clientes, el crecimiento de su peluquería tal cual se requiere para lograr posicionarla en su mercado y agradar a su clientela.
texts.en:
Lia, age 20, is a young woman who lives in the town of Soledad where she has a business called “Peluquería Ludys”. For the past six years Lia has been offering haircuts, massages, styling, and other services to improve one’s personal and professional image. Her customers include men, women, teenagers, and children. Lia will equip her physical space so that she can operate her salon. She plans to install bars, doors, windows, and lamps. Lia also needs an additional hair dryer and supplies in large volumes such as shampoos, conditioners, and other beauty supplies. For this reason she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first form of financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.

This loan will increase her operating capital so that she can obtain discounts when making bulk purchases with cash, which will result in more income and competitive prices. Her dream is to make her customers more comfortable. The growth of her salon requires her to achieve a better position in the marketplace and to expand her customer base.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer, shampoos, conditioners, and other beauty supplies.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana de 35 años vive al sur de la ciudad con sus dos hijos en las edades de 4 y 5 años, los cuales son el motor de su vida y por los que se esfuerza todos los días, con tal de verlos convertidos en personas exitosas. Ella tiene su negocio que consiste en comercializar papelería, juguetería, ropa infantil, artículos de aseo fantasía y artículos de belleza, ropa, calzado y en general productos por los que sus clientes preguntan y ella registra en su cuaderno,  para comprarlos y siempre responderles oportunamente.
Su vida comercial inició desde el año 2001, pues siendo una persona natural del sector donde habita, aprovechó esta fortaleza para iniciar una actividad que le generara ingresos mientras también atendiera a su familia. Así mismo mediante otra actividad como la oferta de servicios de telecomunicaciones, genera otros ingresos. Su negocio cuenta con una buena infraestructura donde se destaca el orden en sus vitrinas, estantería y muebles exhibidores y 8 equipos de comunicacion, para el ejercicio de su actividad. Su principal mercado son los habitantes de la comunidad donde está ubicado su negocio y especialmente maneja clientela de mujeres y jóvenes, a quienes vende de contado y a crédito. Su creciente clientela, hace que su capital de trabajo se torne insuficiente para atender muchas veces la demanda del mercado y es esta la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará productos de belleza al por mayor, y papelería pues son los artículos de más alta rotación y que le generan mayor rentabilidad. Ella requiere obtener descuentos comprando de contado y en una importante cantidad de estos productos . Su meta más adelante es independizar su vida productiva de su vida familiar,adecuando su vivienda para tener el sociego que tanto anhela. además de ofrecerles una educación de calidad a sus hijos. Mientras Ana trabaja para cumplir su sueño, maneja en su negocio un margen de contribución  no menor del 46,48%, una rotación de cuentas por cobrar de 9 días, mientras sus inventarios rotan cada 139 días, con una margen de utilidad del 12,4% que con sus credikivas futuros planea aumentar imprimiéndolo un buen manejo, para que su rotación sea mas rápida.
texts.en:
Ana is 35 years old and lives to the south of the city with her two children, ages 4 and 5. They are her motivation in life so she strives to do her best every day so that they can become successful people. Ana has a business that consists of selling stationery, toys, baby clothes, premium toiletries, beauty products, clothing, shoes, and general products that are requested by her customers. She records the orders in her notebook and then buys the products, always responding in a prompt manner.

Ana started her business in 2001 as a native of the local area. Relying on her inner strength, she established a business in order to generate income while taking care of her family. In addition, Ana operates another business providing telecommunication services as an extra form of income. Her business has a good infrastructure that includes display cases, shelving, furniture displays, and eight communication stations to keep her venture running. Her primary market consists of residents of the community where her business is located, especially women and young people. Ana conducts her sales for cash or on credit. Due to her growing customer base, Ana’s operating capital has become insufficient on several occasions when she needed to keep up with the demands of the marketplace.

This is the reason why she is requesting a Kiva loan, her first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the money to buy beauty products in bulk, stationery, and other products that have high turnover so that she can generate more profits. Ana wants to obtain discounts by purchasing these products with cash and in large quantities. Her goal moving forward is to become independent in her business life and productive in her family life. She wants to remodel her home so that she can live the peaceful life that she craves. In addition, Ana wants to provide a quality education for her children. Meanwhile she continues to work to fulfill her dream. Ana manages her business with a contribution margin of no less than 46.48%, an accounts receivable period of 9 days, inventory turnover of 139 days, and a profit margin of 12.4%. With her future Kiva loans, she plans to put more emphasis on good management so that she can have faster turnover rates.

loans.use: to buy beauty products in bulk, stationery, and other products that have high turnover.

loans.name: Mappi Aracely

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Portoviejo.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mappi, tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, dos mayores de edad y la menor de 14 años, todos estudian los mayores un seminario de computación y la menor en colegio, todos sus hijos viven aun con ella. Su esposo es taxista y labora con su taxi propio.

Nuestra amiga es estilista y aunque en su casa tiene un pequeño salón de belleza en el cual ofrece sus servicios de arreglo y belleza aunque la mayor parte de sus trabajos los realiza a domicilio,  ella hace cortes de cabello, tinturados, manicure, pedicura, entre otras cosas, lleva diez años que se dedica a esto y es un trabajo que le encanta realizar.
 
Este crédito es para comprar tintes y esmaltes para su salón de belleza y dos llantas para el taxi de su esposo. Este es el quinto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la rapidez con que salen los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son tener un restaurante ya que también le encanta cocinar.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of the real tamarinds, the members of the communal bank "Nueva Portoviejo" (New Portoviejo) have a meeting every two weeks.

This is where we meet Señora Mappi.  She is 49 years old, married and with her husband has three children.  Two are grown and the youngest is 14 years old.  All of her children are in school.  The two oldest study in a computing seminar, and the youngest is in high school.  All of them still live with her.  Her husband in a taxi driver who works with his own taxi.

Our friend is a stylist and although she has a small beauty parlor in her home, where she offers her styling and beauty services, the majority of her work is done at her customers'  homes.  Señora Mappi offers hair cuts, tinting, manicures and pedicures, among other services.  She has made her living in this way for ten years, and it's a job she loves to do.
 
This loan is for the purchase of dyes and nail polish for her beauty parlor and two tires for her husbands' taxi.  This is Señora Mappi's fifth cycle in the communal bank, and she likes it because of how quickly she gets her loans.

Señora Mappi's dream is to have a restaurant, since she also loves to cook.

loans.use: to purchase dyes, nail polishes and two tires.

loans.name: Roque Roberto

texts.es: Roque de 53 años vive al sur de la ciudad con su esposa y sus dos hijos en las edades de 8 a 11 años. Allí tiene un negocio de ebanistería desde hace más de 20 años, donde fabrica muebles para el hogar salas comedores, puertas, gabinetes para baños, y para cocinas. Su experiencia de negocio la tomó desde cuando fue empleado de una carpintería y posteriormente decidió darle curso libre a su espíritu emprendedor dándole nacimiento a su propio taller, en el que hasta la presente trabaja. Su meta es lograr la sostenibilidad de este con una buena rentabilidad que en la actualidad se encuentra en un  42,91%. Su mayor desafío es su capital de trabajo que es insuficiente para extenderse en el mercado, y esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el cual comprará en la compra de materias primas e insumos para fabricar gabinetes de cocina y para baños, que es el producto de mayor rotación en su negocio y siempre sus clientes deben esperar hasta que él logre recuperar su inversión.
texts.en:
Roque is 53 years old and lives to the south of the city with his wife and two children, ages 8 and 11. There he has managed a cabinetmaking business for more than 20 years. He makes furniture such as dining rooms sets, doors, as well as cabinets for bathrooms and kitchens. His business experience was acquired while he was employed at a carpentry shop. After he took a course that was offered for free, Roque discovered his entrepreneurial spirit and decided to open his own workshop, where he continues to work to this day. His goal is to achieve sustainability and a good level of profitability, which is currently at 42.91%. The greatest challenge he faces is having insufficient capital to extend his market, which is why he is applying for a Kiva loan.

This is his first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Roque will use the money to buy raw materials and supplies for making kitchen and bathroom cabinets. He hopes the end result will be better product turnover in his business and having a constant stream of customers so that he will be able to recoup his investment.

loans.use: to buy materials and supplies for making cabinets.

loans.name: Joel De Jesus

texts.es: Joel  de 45 años vive al sur de la ciudad con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 6 a 14 años; allí desde el año 2009 tiene un negocio llamado “Tienda el paisa”, donde vende Ranchos, víveres, licores, refrescos y artículos de la canasta familiar, principalmente de contado, aunque maneja créditos con sus clientes más fieles. Cuando inició en su negocio vendía solamente verduras, con un capital que su hermana le prestó. Así fue como le cedieron la casa en la cual vive y con el trabajo de su capital, logro adecuar el expendio de verduras y poco a poco ir agregando otros productos dirigidos al consumo de las familias que viven en su barrio y alrededor. Su meta más adelante es estabilizar su negocio, hasta lograr convertirlo en una unidad de venta de mayor tamaño, con productos diversificados, obedeciendo principalmente a lo que sus clientes necesiten. Su credikiva, al cual está aplicando, es su primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con él  comprará víveres, verduras y artículos de la canasta familiar en mayor volumen, con el fin de tener su negocio bien surtido y comprar con descuentos por lograr adquirir los artículos de contado. Su mayor desafío es no tener el capital suficiente para lograr responder rápidamente a la clientela, con los productos que más compran y justamente con su credikiva logrará hacerlo.
texts.en:
Joel is 45 years old and lives to the south of the city with his wife and three children, who range in age from 6 to 14. Since 2009, he has owned a business called “Tienda El Paisa” where he sells snacks, food, liquor, soft drinks, and products used for preparing family meals. He conducts mainly cash sales, but he extends credit to his most loyal customers. When he started his business, Joel only sold vegetables using capital that he borrowed from his sister. Using his home as his business location, Joel allocated his operating capital toward the sale of vegetables. He gradually added other products that are consumed by families who live in his neighborhood and the surrounding areas. His goal for the future is to stabilize his business and convert it into a larger store that offers a diversity of products that his customers need.

Joel is applying for a Kiva loan, his first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use the money to buy food products, vegetables, and household goods in large volumes so that he can have a well-stocked business. By purchasing these goods with cash, he will be able to receive discounts. His greatest challenge is not having enough capital to respond quickly to his customers by acquiring the products that they purchase the most. He will be able to accomplish this using his Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy food products, vegetables, and household goods in large volumes.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La Sra. Elena pertenece al Banco Comunal “Noche de Luna II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Tiene 49 años, està y tiene cinco hijos de los cuales su hijo de 19 años vive con ella. El es estudiante de nivel superior en la carrera de Contabilidad. 
Elena es una mujer sacrificadora, siempre saliendo adelante por sus hijos. Desde hace 14 años se dedica a la venta de comidas preparadas y poco a poco incrementó su negocio de parrillas y asados de pollo, carne y juanes. Empezó con un capital inicial de PEN 300.00 y está muy satisfecha con sus logros obtenidos, cuenta con gran apoyo por parte de su esposo e hijo. Tiene una amplia clientela que es el público consumidor, le buscan por la amabilidad y el buen trato que les brinda. Con el nuevo préstamo de PEN 1,200.00 va a comprar productos para la compra de carbón y ingredientes como sacos de arroz, azúcar, aceites y además le gustarìa implementar sillas y mesas para así captar nuevos clientes, su negocio está bien ubicado. Su sueño es integrar a su negocio presente la venta de abarrotes y verduras para el consumo diario. Está muy feliz por ser parte del Movimiento Manuela Ramos y està agradecida por las oportunidades que le da.
texts.en:
Sra. Elena belongs to the communal bank “Noche de Luna II” (Night of the Moon II) in Tarapoto District, which is in the Province and Department of San Martín. She is 49 years old, married and has five children.  Her 19 year old son lives with her.  He is an upper level student majoring in Accounting.
Elena is a self-sacrificing woman, always trying to get ahead for the sake of her children.  For 14 years, she has made her living selling prepared food and growing her grilling and roast chicken, meat and juanes (a local dish of stuffed bijao leaves) business.  Sra. Elena started with an initial capital of PEN 300.00 (roughly $112 USD), and she is quite satisfied with how far she has come.  She has both her husband's and her son's support.  She has a large clientele amongst the purchasing public.  They seek her our for her friendlessness and the good service she offers.  With the new loan of PEN 1,200.00 ($450 USD), Sra. Elena will purchase products like charcoal and ingredients like sacks of rice, sugar and oils, and in addition, she would like to install tables and chairs to help attract new customers.  Her business is in a good location.  Her dream is to add grocery and fresh vegetable sales to her current business.  She is very happy to be with Movimiento Manuela Ramos (The Manuela Ramos Movement) and is grateful for the opportunities they offer her.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like rice, olives, charcoal and tables and chairs.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
LA Sra. Sebastiana, forma parte del grupo Primavera, es una socia responsable y muy trabajadora.
Ella se encuentra actualmente con un fuerte dolor en las piernas a consecuencia del frío, pero eso no ha evitado que ella salga a trabajar todos los días.
La Sra. Sebastiana se dedica a la venta de golosinas en un pequeño puesto de forma ambulatoria, poco a poco ha ido aumentando su mercadería pero le gustaría lograr tener una bodega muy surtida.
El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de golosinas y  bebidas gaseosa.
texts.en:
Sra. Sebastiana is a member of the Primavera (Spring) group.  She is a responsible and hard-working member.
Sra. Sebastiana currently has a strong pain in her legs, because of the cold weather.  But that hasn't kept her from going out to work every day.
She makes her living selling sweets from a small street-side stand.  Little by little, she has increased her merchandise, but she would like to one day have a well-stocked grocery.
The requested loan will be invested in the purchase of sweets and carbonated beverages.

loans.use: to purchase sweets and carbonated beverages to stock up her kiosk.

loans.name: María De Lourdes

texts.es:
En la  parroquia Calderón de la ciudad de Portoviejo,  cada quince días se  reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Desarrollo Femenino. Este lugar se lo conoce por su rica gastronomía y su vegetación, es este lugar la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y comercio en general.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 33 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 11, 8 años y el último de 4 meses de nacido, los dos mayores  estudian en escuela. El marido es albañil.
 
Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo de la marca Leonisa y de productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja cuatro días a la semana pero por horas ya que este es un trabajo en el cual no tiene horario fijo, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Tiene tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende es la ropa intima de mujer ya que estas son muy solicitadas por las damas.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa interior. Este es el quinto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. 

Sus sueños son tener una boutique.
texts.en:
In the Calderón Parish of the city of Portoviejo, the members of the communal bank "Desarrollo Femenino" (Women's Development) meet every two weeks.  This is a place known for its delicious cuisine and for its vegetation.  The majority of the people who live here make their livings in agriculture and general sales.

This is where Señora María lives.  She is 33 years old and lives with her partner.  Together they have three children who are 11 and 8, and the youngest is just 4 months old.  The two oldest go to school.  Her husband is a bricklayer.

 
Señora María is a housewife who, to have her own money, makes a living selling Leonisa brand clothing from a catalog and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories).  She works four days a week, but hourly, as this is a job that does not have a set schedule.  She sells her products on credit and collects payments on a weekly basis.  She has been making her living with this work for three years, and it has been going very well for her.  What she sells the most of is lingerie, as that is in high demand from the ladies.

This loan is for the purchase of perfumes, lotions, cosmetics and undergarments.  This is Señora María's fifth cycle with the communal bank.  She likes the bank because it is easy to make the payments. 

Señora María's dream is to have a boutique.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lotions, cosmetics and undergarments.

loans.name: Madres Ladereñas Group

texts.es:
Ana melva tiene 2 trabajos uno es la venta D. comidas y el otro es el cuidado D. una persona adulta ella comparte ambos trabajos por que es una manera D. solventar los gastos D. su familia que es numerosa  tiene 04 hijos que aun están en edad escolar y lo que gana le sirve para ayudarlos en gastos D. materiales y pasajes a sus lugares D. estudio, sus hijos colaboran con ella en el negocio D. la comida ya sea en la preparación como en el reparto, esto lo hace por las noches preparando diversos platos  D. comida  sus comensales son los vecinos del barrio y personas  que acuden a su negocio, ella lo que mas desea es poner su propio restaurante para eso quiere habilitar una parte D. su casa para iniciar su negocio y también formalizarlo para poder trabajar tranquila, lo que  hará con su préstamo que EDAPROSPO le esta otorgando será comprar sus insumos al por mayor  D. esa manera podrá ahorrar  en la preparación D. sus comidas ella a su vez forma parte del grupo “MADRES LADEREÑAS “ que pertenecen a la zona norte D. lima laderas D. chillón Lima Perú.

  * La Sra Ana melva vist chompa rosada y pantalon azul esta sentada y tambien aparece una socia como pasiva .
texts.en:
Ana Melva has two jobs. One is selling food and the other is caring for an adult. This is how she covers her large family's costs; she has 4 children who are still school-aged. Her income helps with the costs of materials and transportation to their schools. Her children help her with the food business, both with preparation and distribution. She prepares the food at night, making diverse dishes. Her guests are her neighbours and other people. What she most desires is to open her own restaurant, and so she wants to fit out part of her house to start this business. This will allow her to work comfortably. With her EDAPROSPO loan, she will purchase ingredients wholesale. This way, she will be able to save. She is part of the "Madres Laderenas" group, belonging to the northern zone of Lima called Laderas D. Chillon, Lima, Peru.

*Mrs. Ana is seated, wearing a pink sweater and blue pants, and a passive member is also photographed.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food.

loans.name: Mariana Azucena

texts.es:
En la  parroquia Calderón de la ciudad de Portoviejo,  cada quince días se  reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Desarrollo Femenino. Este lugar se lo conoce por su rica gastronomía y su vegetación, es este lugar la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y comercio en general.

En este lugar vive la señora Mariana, tiene 45 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos, dos mayores de edad y dos de 16 y 11 años tres de ellos estudian en universidad y uno en colegio. El marido es comerciante. 

Nuestra amiga para ayudar a su marido el cual no gana lo suficiente para mantener el hogar se dedica  a preparar hayacas (plato típico del campo manabita que es muy apreciado por las personas de otras ciudades), ella todos los días prepara las hayacas que luego manda a entregar con su esposo hasta la ciudad de Manta  al mismo tiempo que el realiza sus ventas de verduras y frutas en el mercado. Lleva más de 20 años en este negocio.

Este crédito es para comprar víveres necesarios para preparar estos productos. Lleva más de 5 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que les da el banco. 

Su sueño es gozar de buena salud.
texts.en:
In the Calderon parish of Portoviejo city, the Desarollo Femenino ["Women's Development"] Communal Bank meets every fifteen days. This region is known for its rich gastronomy and its vegetation. The majority of its inhabitants are farmers and general merchants.

Mariana lives here. She is 45 and in a common-law marriage from which she has four children. Two of them are grown and the other two are 16 and 11. Three of them are in university and the other is in school. Her husband is a merchant.

In order to help her husband, who does not make enough money to maintain the household, our friend makes hayacas (a traditional dish from the Manabi countryside that is highly prized by those from other cities). Every day she prepares hayacas that she later sends with her husband to Manta city while she sells fruits and vegetables in the market. She has had this business for over 20 years.

This loan is for purchasing the necessary supplies to prepare these products. She has been in the Communal Bank for over 5 years and she likes it because of the help that the bank gives them.

Her dream is to have good health.

loans.use: to purchase supplies.

loans.name: Mercedes Maribel

texts.es:
En la  parroquia Calderón de la ciudad de Portoviejo,  cada quince días se  reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Desarrollo Femenino. Este lugar se lo conoce por su rica gastronomía y su vegetación, es este lugar la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y comercio en general.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mercedes, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  16,13 y 8 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en  escuela. Su esposo es mecánico industrial.

Nuestra amiga realiza el crédito para ayudar a su esposo el cual tiene un taller mecánico en el cual realizan diversos trabajos como construcción de carrocerías para todo tipo de carros, pero  nos cuenta nuestra amiga que ellos mas trabajan  con carrocerías y pintura de autobuses,  para realizar estos trabajos ellos tiene que contratar hasta dos o tres operarios a los cuales los pagan un sueldo. Su esposo lleva más de 20 años dedicado a esta actividad.
 
Este crédito es para comprar pinturas, hierro, sueldas y otros productos necesarios para realizar sus trabajos. Lleva 9 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ha podido ayudar a su esposo en su trabajo.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante y que no les falte trabajo.
texts.en:
In the Calderon parish of Portoviejo city, the Desarollo Femenino ["Women's Development"] Communal Bank meets every fifteen days. This region is known for its rich gastronomy and its vegetation. The majority of its inhabitants are farmers and general merchants.

Here we meet Señora Mercedes. She is 43, married, and has three children from this relationship. They are 16, 13 and 8. The oldest two are in high school and the youngest is in elementary school. Her husband is an industrial mechanic.
