Gina joined GDMPC earlier this year. She applied for a loan of 5,000 PHP from the cooperative to purchase additional ingredients needed in food preparation. She personally does the cooking and accepts consignments to add to the daily income. Gina hopes to sustain her family with spare funds to sustain the business operation. She plans to expand her business area and offer alternative foods to choose from.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients needed in food preparation.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is 32 years old, married, and has four children. He lives in his permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Charles owns 3 motorcycles that he hires out to earn a living. His dream is to own as many motorcycles as possible and hopes that from the profits made he will be able to buy land. Charles needs the loan to buy a motorcycle for transportation purposes.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for transportation purposes.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Фируза жительница города Исфары. Она не замужем. Ей 22 года. Она живет вместе с родителями. У нее среднее образование. Фируза занимается торговлей на рынке. В основном продает салфетки, полотенце, спальное белье и скатерти. Кредит берет для расширения своей деятельности. Она хочет закупить сухофрукты.
texts.en: Firuza lives in the city of Isfara.  She is 22 years, not married and lives together with her parents.  She has a secondary education.  Firuza is involved in sales at the market.  She primarily sells napkins, towels, bedding and table cloth.  She is requesting this loan in order to expand her business.  She wants to buy dried fruits.

loans.use: to purchase dried fruits

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
Guadalupe is 52 years old and married. The family manufactures lampakanay products to earn a living. (Lampakanay is a semi-aquatic herb with durable fibers extracted to make various products.) Her husband also is working as a carpenter, but that job is irregular in nature so they focus much attention on developing the business. From this plant, Guadalupe, along with the whole family, creates various ropes, mats, braided furniture and many other products. The business has existed for over 5 years of time, and a total of PHP 5,000 is normally generated in a month.

A month ago, Guadalupe joined GDMPC. She is currently applying for a loan of PHP 7,000 from the cooperative to purchase additional raw materials to cope with orders that are to be completed soon. She aims to increase sales on succeeding operations and lay aside exact funds to elevate productivity as well as quality.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a 37-year-old single mother of four children, living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She operates a boutique in Fort Portal town and it's from this business that she has earned her living for 11 years. Her major challenge has always been untimely debt settlements, which in turn affects her business plans. Her dream is setting up another boutique. Rose needs the loan to buy shirts, trousers, dresses and skirts for resale.

loans.use: To buy shirts, trousers, dresses and skirts for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase 8 sheep and fodder.

loans.name: Mardelia

texts.en:
Mardelia is a 59-year-old-widow. She has four children: Mahmud, 38; Fatmawati, 36; Sawaludin, 32; and Martini, 31. Three of them are married and live separate from Mardelia.  

In order to cover her daily needs Mardelia is running a room rental business. She has been running this business for years. She and her husband built two small rooms, each constructed with palm branch walls and a zinc roof. After several years she built four new rooms to be rented, constructed with brick walls. After the death of her husband, Mardelia initiated a kiosk business to generate more income. 

Mardelia wants to renovate the two rooms that were constructed with palm branch walls and zinc roofs, as they are not feasible for rent anymore. Therefore she is requesting a loan of IDR 3,000,000 from TLM. She is expecting to get the loan soon so she can buy building materials, which are zinc, cement and sand to renovate her rental rooms.

loans.use: To purchase building materials to renovate two rental rooms.

loans.name: Shirin

texts.en: Shirin is a 45-year-old married man with two children. His primary financial income comes from breeding sheep. This is very hard work and requires a lot of physical effort, as most of the time Shirin spends in the open air grazing sheep. His wife is a housekeeper and helps him look after the sheep. He usually buys lambs, raises and fattens them, and resells them for profit in the central Bilasuvar bazaar. He sells sheep for meat. As mutton is very popular among Azerbaijani people, Shirin would like to purchase more animals and increase his profit. This will allow him to improve his family's living conditions. This will be his second loan from AqroInvest and he promises to pay on time.

loans.use: to purchase eight sheep and four goats

loans.name: Sum

texts.en:
From Kompong Speu Province, Mr. Sum is 48 years old and married. He has four single children. Three of his children are working in a garment factory as sewing workers. They regularly get a formal salary from their occupations of around $80 USD per month.      

Mr. Sum has been working in the farming business since 1979. He and his wife assist each other in the crop-planting business. They normally earn a revenue of $1.66 USD per day.  Mr. Sum will use a loan from Kiva's partner HKL to buy cows to help him in the farm field as his cows are getting old now. 

In the future, Mr. Sum wishes to build a new house that is bigger than his current house. Mr. Sum is in the photo with his wife under their house.

loans.use: to buy cows to support him on the farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more chickens and turkeys.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a 43-year-old single woman with seven children; all are living in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a dream of educating her children up to university. Joyce has been earning her living by selling bananas, which she has been farming for the last 10 years, and she has also started building rental houses. Her major challenge has been inadequate capital to add onto her savings to complete her rental houses, and that is why she needs the loan -- to add onto her savings and complete the houses.

loans.use: To buy materials for the construction of rental units and house renovation.

loans.name: Azer

texts.en: Azer is a 37-year-old man who has been engaged in livestock breeding for the last six years. He buys calves, raises and fattens them, and then resells grown cattle in the central Bilasuvar bazaar. His monthly profit is about $150 and he wishes to increase it to $300. He would like to purchase more livestock, and for this purpose, he needs a 1,000 Azerbaijani New Manat (AZN) loan. Azer promises to pay it back in an accurate manner.

loans.use: to purchase three calves.

loans.name: Aynura

texts.en: Aynura is 30; she is married with two children. She breeds cattle and sells them for meat profit. As veal is very popular in Azerbaijan, Aynura thinks she chose the proper way to earn money. Her monthly profit is about $150. She applied for a 1,000 Azerbaijani New Manat (AZN) loan to purchase two cattle and fodder. She already took a loan from AqroInvest and completed it successfully.

loans.use: to purchase two cattle and fodder.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a 55-year-old widow with four children living in a semi permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her dream is to educate her children. She has been a farmer for 15 years, growing mainly maize and bananas for sale. Her main constraint has been high labor costs. Her desire is to buy land and practice mechanised farming. Josephine needs the loan to add to her savings so she can buy another piece of land for farming purposes.

loans.use: to buy land for farming purposes.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Алишер проживает в городе Худжанд. Он женат. У него трое детей. Ему 50 лет. Он уже шесть лет как занимается животноводством. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота. Алишер хочет увеличить количество скота, чтобы в дальнейшем продать по более выгодной цене.
texts.en: Alisher lives in the city of Khujand.  He is 50 years old, married and has three children.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for six years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle.  Alisher wants to increase the quantity of livestock in order to sell it at more profitable price in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 54-year-old married woman with four children who she lives in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her major dream is to build a permanent residential house for rental purposes. 

Rose sells used clothes and has been in business for five years. She has a desire to diversify her income generating activities by venturing into food sales as well. Rose needs this loan to buy maize, cassava flour, and groundnuts (peanuts) for resale.

loans.use: To buy maize, cassava flour, and groundnuts.

loans.name: Zamina

texts.en: Zamina is a 37-year-old entrepreneur with three years of experience in livestock breeding. She sells cattle for meat. She usually sells animals to the local vendors at a profitable price. She buys pregnant cows or small calves, raises them, and after 5-6 months sells them in the central bazaar at profit. Zamina is married and has two children. Her monthly income is about $120 US. She would like to purchase more cattle and for this purpose she applied for 500 Azerbaijani manats.

loans.use: to purchase one cow

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 26-year-old married man with two children. His dream has been to acquire his own motorcycle rather than being hired to work for others. He lives in a semi-permanent house in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has been a hired motorcycle rider for four years. The challenge he always faces is to remit the agreed money to his boss even when he has not earned that day. John needs the loan to buy a motorcycle for transportation purposes.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for transportation purposes.

loans.name: Gulpari

texts.en: Gulpari is 40. She is married and has two sons. Her husband works as a taxi driver, but the main financial income in their family comes from Gulpari's poultry business. She usually sells chicken in the central Bilasuvar bazaar and her monthly income is about 100 USD. She would like to increase her profit so she applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN. This will help to purchase more chicken and improve the quality of life in her family. Gulpari has already demonstrated herself as a good client with a positive credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens and turkeys

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice has been selling clothes for the last five years in Makueni town. She is 34 years old and married to Jones. They have two children.

She was introduced to KADET by a friend who is a KADET client. She has been loaned KES 50,000. She intends to use the loan to add more stock of trousers, blouses, skirts and sweaters.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and stock all varieties of clothes.

loans.use: To buy more trousers, blouses, skirts and sweaters.

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia is married and her husband deals in traditional Punjabi foods called samosay and pakoray. He has very good taste in his food and people from different areas of the city come to him to buy his products. 

Shazia is a housewife who spends her time at home and takes care of her household responsibilities. In her spare time, she supports her husband in preparing samosay (made with gram flour and potatoes) and pakoday (also made with gram flour and served with yogurt & chili sauce). 

She is the mother of a 10-year-old son who stays at home with her. Shazia couldn't educate him due to financial constraints. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband's business. With the loan, he will buy ingredients such as gram flour, spices, and potatoes in bulk to be able to prepare better quality food items to increase his sales and profits. 

He has good experience in his business and has been operating it for more than two years. Shazia is confident about the positive growth of her husband's business after the loan investment. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called an Asasah Passbook) is Shazia.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for producing Punjabi food for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and diversify into more goods and increase profits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy meat, ingredients, fish, vegetables, soft drinks and grocery items to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
For the last 16 years, Robert has been selling timber and firewood in Kabuko area, Limuru town. He is 46 years old and married to Leah. They have three children who go to school.

He was introduced to KADET by a KADET staff member. He paid his previous loan well and in good time. He intends to use this loan to add to his stock of timber and firewood.

In the future, he hopes to diversify into other businesses, which will increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase more timber and firewood.

loans.name: Mathelda

texts.en:
Mathelda is a 41-year-old lady married to Yakobis, a 46-year-old truck driver. They have four children. Elsa, 21 and Prily, 20, are studying at a local university. Marthin, 16, is studying in the third grade of Senior High School and Isabel, 8, is studying at the fourth grade of Elementary School. 

Mathelda has a building materials business selling stone and sand. As this is a family business, her husband Yakobis is responsible for delivering the orders to the customers by truck. They have been engaged in this business since 1999. Mathelda sells building materials in large quantities to the contractors. The materials are prepared based on customer demand.

Mathelda dreams of improving this business to better meet her family needs as well as her children's educational needs. She wants to add more materials such as stone and sand due to the increasing demands of her customers. 

She needs additional capital to assist her in improving the business. Therefore, she is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 10,000,000 from TLM.

loans.use: To purchase more materials such as stone and sand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Sahib

texts.en: Sahib is a 47-year-old man who runs his own café. He has six years of experience in this field. Sahib's brother helps him. He serves clients with tea and dinner -- the most popular is the national meal made of meat. Sahib would like to improve his café and applied for a 1,000 Azerbaijani New Manat (AZN) loan.

loans.use: to make renovations to his café.

loans.name: Abida's Group

texts.en:
Abida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further improvement of her clothes sewing business. With the loan, she will purchase a new sewing machine that will allow her to complete the orders on time and increase her profits. She is 30 years old and she started this business to financially support her husband who has a construction supplies business. He makes contracts with different construction companies and fulfills their orders to earn an income.  Abida is the mother of four children. She couldn’t educate them due to financial constraints. Along with her business, she performs her daily routine tasks very well.
 
She is very hopeful that her business will improve a lot after investing the loan into it. She has been doing her business for many years. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Abida.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business

loans.name: Milagros Group

texts.en:
Milagros is widowed with two children. Milagros is 55 years old and lives in Marapong, Sibutad.

Milagros sells rice to earn a living and has had this business for eight years. She has requested a loan for PHP 12,000 to purchase eight sacks of rice to sell.

Milagros has been a member of PMPC for 1 1/2 years. Milagros is the leader of a two-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: To purchase eight sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 32-year-old married man and the father of two children. He has worked as a fisherman since 1996. Mohamad adores the sea; he was born as a fisherman and can't imagine himself working in anything else.

Mohamad is a hardworking man; he uses fishing webs in order to get as much fish as he can in less time. He believes that this way of fishing is more kind to fish than other ways.

Mohamad has been an A. Majmoua borrower for seven consecutive loan cycles. All his previous loans had a very good impact on his business, and at the same time, he is a borrower in good standing.

Through his previous loans and business improvement, he was capable of buying his own boat, which helped a lot in increasing his income and improving his sociA. and financiA. situation. 

Through this loan, Mohamad will be capable of buying necessary tools for his business and paying for an urgent surgery for his mother.

Mohamad is a man with a very good reputation; he is liked by most of his relatives and friends. He hopes to buy a bigger boat in the future, and to increase the number of boats he has.

loans.use: To buy necessary tools for his business, and to pay for an urgent surgery for his mother.

loans.name: Zebogul

texts.ru: Зебогул проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст, 56 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Зебогул имеет высшее образование. Она по профессии финансист. В этой области проработала 25 лет. Сейчас она занимается животноводством. В основном она занимается купле - продажей крупнорогатого скота. Кредит берет для закупа коровы.
texts.en: Zebogul lives in the city of Vahdat.  She is 56 years old, married and has three children.  Zebogul has a higher education.  Her profession is a financier, and she spent 25 years working in this field.  Currently, she is involved in animal husbandry.  She primarily buys and sells cattle.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of a cow.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 32-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife. He has owned a barber shop since 2004 with seven years of experience working in the same occupation. He is well known in the whole region for his good business reputation and his great welcoming. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase an air conditioner for his shop and renew his business tools. His income is considered almost reasonable and he struggles to be able to face the uncomfortable life circumstances. In the future, he is planning to improve his work and enlarge his shop.

loans.use: to purchase an air conditioner for his shop and renew his business tools

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is married and her husband has a business selling clothes. He purchases clothes from different cities and sells to his community clients by putting them on his bicycle. He is a very dedicated and hardworking person and works very hard to put three meals on the table for his family. Naseem is a housewife who spends her time staying at home and doing her household responsibilities. She is the mother of six children but none of them could get an education due to financial constraints. One of Naseem’s sons is also involved in the clothes selling business and helps his father sell clothes. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy clothes in bulk quantity, which will allow him to offer more variety to his customers and increase his sales and profits. Naseem is confident that her husband’s business will grow further after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Georges

texts.en: Georges is a 46-year-old married man living with his wife and two school-aged children. He is from Lebanon. He has 22 years of experience selling photocopiers. He also performs the needed maintenance on damaged ones. In parallel, and in addition to his photocopy shop, he has owned a small mini market since 1998. His wife works in a local supermarket to help provide the family with extra financial support. George’s unstable situation is not such a positive indication for him to improve his family’s standards of living. So today, he is asking to borrow $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase his purchases of new photocopiers in order to increase his business sales and therefore his income. His main purpose is to be able to satisfy his family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase more new photocopiers

loans.name: Primo

texts.en:
Primo, a father of three, is engaged in rice farming. Primo did not receive a college-level education because his parents did not have the capacity to send him to school, even though he wanted to enter and finish college. This experience gives him the perseverance and passion to send his children to school until they finish college. 

Primo is 40 years old and married to a housekeeper. He and his wife manage their business and have the same goal of getting a better yield in every harvest to finance their children's education. According to Primo, he will just reach his goal if he improves his farming practice.  That’s why he is asking for a loan of 25,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizers and herbicides and to pay for the cost of farming labor.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides and pay for the cost of farming labor

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 57 years old and married with nine children. She is a hardworking woman who sells charcoal within her village and in nearby villages. Aside from vending charcoal, she also manages her store to have extra income. Five of her children are married, and the rest are still single and working. She is glad because her children are supportive in improving her business.

Victoria would like to ask for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to be used in buying charcoal to sell within her village. She is hoping that she can maintain her business so that she can give her family a better life.

loans.use: to purchase stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 50-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three children. He has been working as a car spare parts trader and broker since 2000 with more than 16 years of experience. His business is specialized in buying wrecked cars to gather the pieces that can be repaired in order to resell them back after fixing them up. He is thankful for his business income, but he also needs supplementary financial support to help meet his family’s requirements. Today, he is asking to borrow $600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase more car spare parts to sell and make good profits.

loans.use: to purchase more cars spare parts to sell

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Cynthia has a shop that sells canned goods, beverages and snacks. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Cynthia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Cynthia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Pech

texts.en:
From the province of Kompong Speu, Mr. Pech, age 51, is married to Mrs. SamAn, age 50. He has five children, four of whom are employed as garment workers. The other one attends school.

Mr. Pech is a farmer. Aside this, he has been earning a living for many years by climbing the palm trees behind his house. He is able to earn a profit of approximately $0.50 each day from his business. He has a life partner in his wife who is a local farmer. Mr. Pech would like to request a loan from HKL and Kiva to add to his current savings to build a new house. His current house is becoming older and older now and it is not comfortable for him and his family to live in. With the rest of the loan, he will buy a new cow to replace the old one.

Mr. Pech really hopes with his additional income to add to his crop-planting business and to enlarge his house. Mr. Sam and his wife appear in the photograph.

loans.use: to build a new house and to buy a cow.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 23-year-old married man. He is the father of one child. He owns an Internet cafe, which is his only source of income so he has to take good care of it in order to develop himself and his family's social and financial situations.

Ali's shop is well known in the region; most of his customers are friends, neighbors and relatives. His work improves a lot during the summer season, while during winter, most of his customers are busy with their education and might come only during their weekends or when they have to do a certain project.

Ali is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to increase his number of computers, which will increase his income. He will also continue building his sweet home, and he hopes to make it the way he imagined with his wife.

Ali is experiencing Al Majmoua's loan for the first time, and he hopes it will be with a positive impact.

He is planning to expand his business through opening another branch in the future.

loans.use: To increase the number of computers in his Internet cafe.

loans.name: Gulzada's Group

texts.en: Gulzada is the leader of this group. She is 43 and married to a taxi driver. Together with her husband, she brings up three sons and two daughters. The youngest son and the younger daughter study at school and the other children are married and live separately with their families. Ten years ago, with an initial investment of 12,000 soms, Gulzada started to breed livestock. Reselling livestock after fattening them, she earns about 3,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan Gulzada wants to purchase more livestock for breeding. In the future, she wishes to open her own grocery store. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard is a 27-year-old man. He is married with two children, aged 5 years and 1 year, to whom they hope to give a good education to the university level. He operates a motorcycle transport business and serves the local people at Maondo in Kakamega. He has been running this business for two years now. He says that the business is profitable and the major challenge he has is the high cost of fuel. However, he works hard from early morning to late evening to ensure his business is doing well. He is using his loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy another motorcycle to grow his business and serve more people. He hopes to buy two more motorcycles to expand his business, and in the future, purchase a matatu (minibus). He describes himself as a visionary man.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Dominador

texts.en:
Dominador is a responsible father who lives happily with their six children in a village. He has been a farmer for almost 30 years, planting and harvesting rice for sale. Every cropping, they usually earn a net profit of 25,000 Philippines pesos (P), which they utilize for food, clothing and the school fees of their children.

He plans to continue sending all his children to school, for he doesn't want them to be like him. He didn't finish his studies, and he doesn't want them to experience the hardships that he suffered. At this time, he endures hardships and problems, for he wants to support their education.

He aimed to increase his rice production to earn a higher income for the sake of his family. He wants to ask for a loan of P12,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides to sustain his rice production. He believes that this coming harvest season, he will increase his yields and income. He mentioned that he needs to work hard and strive harder to make his dream come true.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for rice production.

loans.name: Novelyn

texts.en:
Novelyn is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Novelyn has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 14,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

Novelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Novelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Tuychi

texts.ru: Туйчи проживает в районе Восе. Ему 41 год. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Он живет вместе с родителями. Его брат занимается производством муки. Сам Туйчи зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается четыре года. До этого он работал в средней школе, преподавателем. Туйчи берет кредит для расширения своей деятельности. Он хочет купить несколько голов телят.
texts.en: Tuychi lives in the Vose district.  He is 41 years old, married and has five children.  His wife is a homemaker.  He lives together with his parents.  Tuychi's brother is involved in flour production.  Tuychi earns a living by breeding cattle.  He has been involved in this business for four years and previously worked as a teacher at a secondary school.  Tuychi is requesting this loan for business expansion.  He wants to buy several calves.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is married and has 12 children. She is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Wilma is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 11 years. She has requested a loan for 14,999 to purchase corn fertilizer. 
Wilma has been a member of PMPC for 1 year and 4 months. In the future, Wlma hopes to be successful in her chosen business.

loans.use: to purchase corn fertilizer.

location.town: Stimson Abordo, Ozamiz City Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a 21-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her father. After her mother’s death, which was the most terrible accident she had to face, Mariam was forced to move on with her life because she found herself the main person responsible for the family. In 2009, she decided to open her own restaurant where she started to produce delicious traditional Lebanese breakfast and drills. With her requested loan of $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, she will be able to increase her inventory of food products and provisions. She works hard to support her older father. In the future, she is hoping to further expand her business and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of food products and provisions

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en:
Elmer is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with two children. 

Elmer has a shop that sells and provides electrical services like antenna installation. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy tools and materials needed for electrical services.

Elmer has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Elmer hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and materials needed for electrical services.

loans.name: Safina's Group

texts.en:
Safina is married and her husband is a retired government employee. He gets pension from the government every month. Safina is the mother of two sons and two daughters. Both of her sons left their education in their teenage years and started work to financially support the family. Her eldest son works in a factory for a low income and the second one is an embroidery expert. Safina is only able to provide an education to her elder daughter who is 16 years old and studying in class 9th. 

Safina is a very supportive lady in nature. She sews clothes for her neighboring clients to earn an income for her family. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her sewing business. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine that will allow her to finish the orders on time and increase her profits. She has been operating her business for the past seven years and is very confident that an investment will be a profitable one for her.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for sewing business

loans.name: Selpha

texts.en: Selpha is 38 years old, married and has four children between 15 and 7 years old whom they hope to educate to the university level. She operates a restaurant business where she makes and sells local food to the people at Enjinja in Kakamega. She has been in this business for three years now and has managed to give employment to two people. She says that the business is good and the major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works hard from early morning to late evening to make sure her business is doing well. She is using her loan of KES 30,000 to buy foodstuffs to make different types of dishes to sell to her customers. She sees herself growing her business, opening restaurants in other areas within Kakamega town and building a residential house for her family. She describes herself as a visionary woman.

loans.use: to buy meat, beans, flour, etc.

loans.name: Letty

texts.en: Letty is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Letty has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & vegetables. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & vegetables. Letty has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Letty hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & vegetables

loans.name: Mastula

texts.en: Mastula lives in Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. Mastula has a business selling clothes. She has been in this business for five years and she works six days out of every week. Mastula sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. Mastula has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more new clothes for resale. She also generates additional income through tailoring .The main business challenge(s) for Mastula include transportation and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to be a wholesaler and to build her own house .Mastula lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more new clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase electrical tools and supplies

loans.name: Khea

texts.en: Mrs. Khea, age 45, is married to Meth and has six children who live under her income. Khea has been spending her life cultivating crops. This is a skill she learned from her parents when she was young. Taking time from this business, Khea is a pig raiser also. From these businesses, she earns approximately $2 each day. According to the rainy season and the lack of money, she would like to request some funds. These funds will be used to purchase fertilizers, seed and other materials for supporting her business. This is the seventh cycle that Khea is borrowing from HKL and the first cycle from Kiva. She said that this loan is very useful for her life and her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seed and other materials.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Jocelyn has a shop that sells fish like sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 14,000 to buy fish to sell.

Jocelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Ainura's Group

texts.en:
Ainura is the treasurer of this group. She is 29 years old and married to a man who works in the District Department of Water Resources. Together with the husband, she brings up a daughter and two sons. Her daughter is at school and the sons are preschool age (under seven). Five years ago with an initial investment of 10,000 soms, Ainura began to breed livestock. By reselling the livestock after fattening, she adds an additional 2000 soms to the family budget. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase more livestock for breeding, fattening and further reselling. In the future, with the profits gained from this activity Ainura wants to improve her living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Abdumalik

texts.ru: Абдумалик житель города Худжанд. Ему 43 года. Он женат. У него трое детей. Он имеет среднее образование. Абдумалик занимается животноводством. Этот вид деятельности у них является семейный. Он разводит мелко - рогатый скот у себя дома. Разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en: Abdumalik lives in the city of Khujand.  He is 43 years old, married and has three children.  He has a secondary education.  Abdumalik is involved in animal husbandry, which is his family business.  He breeds small livestock at home for future sale.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle in order to increase its quantity.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 56 years old and a married woman with two children. She is a farmer working in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. Susana plants rice crops and vegetables. She sells her harvest at the market. Susan also sells dried fish to her neighborhood.

Susana is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She is hoping this loan will help to improve her farming business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Armeda

texts.en:
Armeda is 72 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. 

Armeda has a shop that sells green & yellow bananas & coconuts. She has had this business for 42 years. She requested a loan for PHP 13,000 to buy green bananas & coconuts to sell.

Armeda has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Armeda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy green bananas & coconuts to sell

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 47 year old single woman who owns a grocery shop. She does not have a husband or a son to take care of her, and she did not want others to pity her, so she started this business 4 years ago as a good source of living.

Fatima has been an Al Majmoua borrower for two cycles. Her previous loan was very impressive. It reflected positively on her business development and on the product diversity in her store. She is requesting a new loan to fulfill her customers' needs and meet their requests. She wants to keep her shop filled with every thing they need, all the time, to keep them loyal to her and to emphasize the continuity of shopping at her shop. Fatima will work hard on expanding her business, and hopes to start wholesale trade in the future.

loans.use: To increase her merchandise for the summer season and upon her customers request

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities like sugar, maize flour, soap, toothpaste, etc to resell

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 
Flora has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages . She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks & beverages for resale.
Flora has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Flora hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Diosdado

texts.en:
"I continually dream for a better life of my family" says Diosdado. He is 49 years of age with only one child. His wife is a teacher, teaching elementary school pupils.

Diosdado has managed his farming business for almost 30 years. He wants to earn a higher income, to have savings for the future of his family. Financial assistance from the traders comes with a high interest rate, so Diosdado wanted to finance his farm expenditures himself. He is requesting a loan of P25,000 to buy farm inputs like fertilizers, insecticides and hybrid seeds for farming. In the future, Diosdado wants his dreams to come true.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like fertilizers, insecticides and hybrid seeds for farming.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
35-year-old Virginia is a married woman with 4 children.  The oldest child is 14 years old.

Virginia is engaged in farming. She helps her husband till their land and grow rice crops.  Virginia's husband mainly manages their rice farm.  Virginia spends most of her time managing their mini-grocery store. She sells items like canned goods, noodles, shampoo and soap.  Virginia does her best to support her family and send her children to school.

Virginia has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and insecticides. She hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Sut

texts.en: Sut is 33-year-old woman. She is living in Baray District, Kompong Thom Province. Now, she is a farmer. From this business she gets low income per month. Due to the lack of money and it is the time for farming, Sut has decided to request some funds from Kiva Partner, HKL. With these funds she would like to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other materials. She hopes that this loan will increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional firewood and wood for making beds and chairs.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
Cirila has been running a fire wood shop for 5 years.  She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy fire wood for resale.
Cirila has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Cirila hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fire wood for sale

loans.name: Liverpool Group

texts.en:
Subira, who is in her early 30's, is married with one child. She has been running a general store and airtime selling business for four years now. She works from 7 am to 9 pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.  

This will be her 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase both businesses, for house expenses and school fees, and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She wants a loan to increase her store stock. Her dream is to one day be able to take her child to good schools.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Liverpool", which has a total of 18 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase store stock.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mwangi

texts.en:
Mwangi has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last twenty one years.  He is 61 years old, married to Veronicah.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, he hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Herminio

texts.en:
Herminio's dream is to become financially stable in the future. He is 56 and a father of five.  He has owned and managed 1 hectare of rice fields for almost 28 years and usually earns a profits of only P 23,000 per cropping.  He works hard and endures hardships because he wants to continue sending his children to school.

He aimed to increase his yields this coming season to earn a higher income to finance the education of their children and other family needs.  He requests a loan of P10,000 to buy fertilizers, pesticides and pay expenses incurred in transplanting the rice seedlings. He believes that, patience and hard work are the only key to make his dream into a reality.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and pay expenses incurred in transplanting rice seedlings

loans.name: Mirzomuddin

texts.ru:
Мирзомуддин родился в 1976 году в Таджикистане. Он честный умный и добросовестный человек. Он женат и любящий отец 4 детей. Мирзомуддин занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур около 3 года. Он выращивает арбуз и дыню, а потом продает их на местном рынке. Мирзомуддин хочет, устроит своих детей в лучших школах и университетах. С этой целью он хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить прибыли. Мирзомуддин хотел бы получит кредит в размере 2000$ США для покупки минеральных удобрений, семена, горюче смазочные материалы и скота. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Mirzomuddin was born in 1976 in Tajikistan.  He is an honest, smart and conscientious person.  He is married and a loving father of four children.  Mirzomuddin has been involved in growing agricultural crops for about three years.  He grows watermelon and honeydew and then sells them at the local market.  Mirzomuddin wants to place his children into the best schools and universities.  To achieve this goal, he wants to expand his business and make profits.  Mirzomuddin wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $2000 for the purchase of mineral fertilizers, seeds, lubricants and livestock.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers, seeds, lubricants and livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more drugs for his pharmacy.

loans.name: Robina's Group

texts.en:
Robina helps support her family financially by operating a small clinic at her home. She treats women specifically. She is also a seamstress and sews clothes for her neighboring area clients to earn extra profits.

Her husband operates a business selling wheat. He purchases wheat from different farmers and sells to customers for a profit. 

Robina is the mother of three sons: the eldest one works in a factory while the other two are studying. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband because he wants to buy wheat in bulk. That will allow him to fill the orders of his customers and improve his profits. 

Robina hopes that an investment will be a profitable one for him and it will improve the living standard of her family as a result.

loans.use: To buy wheat for selling.

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 2 children. 
Azucena has a shop that makes & sells snacks like rice, pan & corn cakes.  She has had this business for 9 years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making the snacks.
Azucena has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Azucena hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 26-year-old young man. Married with one son, he has a project of raising poultry and benefiting from selling their products. Mohammad wants to purchase fodder and medicine for his poultry and also wants to expand the coop size, but the money Mohammad has isn't enough to pay for theses expenses, so he needs to take a loan in the amount of $2,000 from FATEN.

When Mohammad gets the loan, that is repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to purchase the necessary living needs for the poultry such as fodder and medicine and also to make the needed expansion for the coop. This will increase the productivity of his poultry and Mohammad will sell more poultry products and so increase the income he gets to have better living conditions. Mohammad is photographed here.

loans.use: To purchase poultry fodder, medicine and expand the coop size.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is 46 years old. She is married, and they have five children aged between 8 and 20 years, whom they hope to give a good education to the university level. 

She operates a clothing sales business at the Kakamega shopping center. She has been in this business for four years. She says that the business is good, and the major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works hard from early morning to late evening to make sure her business is doing well. 

She is using her loan of 33,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more clothes to grow her business and meet the demand of her customers. She hopes to grow her business into a wholesale one, and in the future, diversify to the real estate business. She describes herself as a visionary woman.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en:
Abbass is a 33-year-old married man and the father of two children. He has worked as a carpenter for 17 years. This experience gives him a very important advantage among others in the same field. He is an expert in his business, specializing in furniture making, and he's always up to date with new designs and colors to keep his customers happy, relaxed and able to choose anything they want.

He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, for the first time, in order to buy an important machine that will help in making any design in a very short period of time and with the best quality to be given. Abass hopes to expand his business more and more through buying new improved machines and moving to a larger place at the same time.

loans.use: To buy a new machine for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new boat.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James has operated in the transport industry in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last seven years. He is 31 years old, married to Naomi, and they have two children. 

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan. He has been loaned KES 60,000, which he plans to use to buy a dairy cow to try selling milk. This will boost the income he gets from his motorbike business. 

In the future, James hopes to focus more on dairy farming and become a leading supplier of dairy products in Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to try selling milk.

loans.name: Naneth

texts.en:
Naneth is 35 years old and lives in P-5 San Antonio, Ozamis City. She is married and has 3 children. 

Naneth is a caretaker. She has had this work for 4 years. She requested a loan for 14,900 to purchase materials for her house renovation.
Naneth has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Naneth hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase lumber for her house repairs.

location.town: San Antonio, Ozamis City, Mis. Occidental

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase pig feed.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and breads. She has had this business for 11 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 16,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Marivic has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Nurahmad

texts.ru: Нурахмад проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 36 лет. Женат. Его жена домохозяйка. У него двое детей. Он имеет высшее педагогическое образование. Нурахмад 10 лет проработал в средней школе района. На сегодняшний день он занимается торговлей. Арендует помещение, где открыл продуктовый магазин. В этой области он два года. Кредит берет для покупки продуктов питания. Он хочет увеличить ассортимент своего товара.
texts.en: Nurahmad lives in the Hamadoni district.  He is 36 years old, married and has two children.  His wife is a homemaker.  He has a higher pedagogical education and spent ten years working at the district's secondary school.  Today, Nurahmad is involved in sales.  He leases a space, where he opened a food market.  He has been working in this field for two years.  Nurahmad is requesting this loan for the purchase of food products.  He wants to expand the assortment of his merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase food products

loans.name: Jameela's Group

texts.en:
Jameela is a very active lady and supports her husband by selling clothes. She purchases the clothes from different cities and sells to her local area customers for profits. Her husband is an electrician and provides electricity repair services to his clients. 

Jameela has given birth to three sons and a daughter. Eldest one works in a factory while two others are studying. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her clothes selling business. She will use the loan in buying clothes in bulk quantity and of better variety which will allow her to make better sales and earn better profits. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Jameela.

loans.use: To buy clothes for selling.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last three years.  She is 56 years old, married to Makumi, and they have three school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Nancy hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is thirty years old. She is single and does not have any children yet. She operates a beauty salon in which she braids, weaves and treats ladies' hair. Her business is located at a busy area known as Bombolulu in Mombasa. She has been in this business for one year now and says that though the business is profitable, she has challenges of financial constraints. 

She is using her loan of KES 20,000 to buy more hair weaves, braids and treatments to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. In the future she hopes to expand her business and provide employment to the local people. She describes herself as a very cheerful lady.

loans.use: to buy hair weaves, braids and treatments.

loans.name: Vikindu Group

texts.en:
Khadija, who is in her early 40's, is married. She has five children who go to school. She has been running a business of selling fabrics and materials for men's suits, on order and from door to door. She works from 10 a.m to 1.30 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.
  
This will be her 1st loan from Tujijenge, Tanzania which she wants to use for buying more fabric and suit materials for making men's suits. Her dream is to one day be able to take her children to good schools.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Vikindu", which has a total of 21 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more suit materials for men suits and fabrics.

loans.name: Teodulo

texts.en: Teodulo is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 1 child. He has a shop that sells a variety of fish. He has had this business for 6 years. He requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy dried fish to sell. He has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Teodulo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Maricho

texts.en:
Maricho is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. She has a shop that sells fish like sardines and mackerel. She has had this business for 6 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 14,000 to buy fish to sell. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Maricho hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last three years.  He is 24 years old, married to Wanjiku, and they have one child.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He has been loaned KES 5,000, which he plans to use to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Isaac hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Virgilio is a farmer who lives in a village with his wife and their five children. He and his wife plant and harvest rice and vegetables for sale. Some of their children did not pursue their studies because they could not afford to finance them all. Two of them are presently studying and they want them to finish their studies despite the hardships and difficulties of life. 

In this regard, Virgilio wants to increase his yields to earn a higher income and support the education of their children, and to acquire their daily basic needs. He wants to ask for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides, and to pay labor costs for transplanting rice seedlings. He hopes that the loan will help a lot to increase their yields.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides, and to pay labor costs for transplanting rice seedlings.

loans.name: Revelita

texts.en:
Revelita is 63 years old and married. She has been blessed with eight children. Six of her children are married and have their own families. Revelita is spending her income on her youngest child who is graduating this coming year. She is an honest and goal-oriented person.

Revelita is engaged in a business of retailing construction supplies within the village where she lives. She has had this business for five years. According to her, she disposes of her products immediately because they are made to order. She will sell the products to her costumers and they will pay within four to five months. 

With her determination in life, which is increasing her profit, she is asking for additional capital amounting to PHP 30,000, which will be utilized to buy additional construction supplies for her retail business, such as cement, hollow blocks, iron and steel. She hopes that through this financial support she requests she will be able to support her college student and save money for her own security purposes when she gets weak.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for resale, such as cement, hollow blocks, iron and steel.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. She has a shop that sells snacks, breads and bananas. She has had this business for 11 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy snacks and bananas to sell. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Elvira hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 28 years old, comes from Mbale and is married to Edward; they have two children.

Caroline has a business selling clothes and has been doing it for the past nine years. She is applying for her second loan from Kadet Ltd. She has been loaned KES 60,000. Caroline intends to buy more clothes to add to her stock.

She hopes to open up a boutique in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to add to her stock.
